La socia desea invertir en la compra de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de arenaria. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANADAHUAYLILLAS” (The Entrepreneurs of Anadahuylillas).  It is located in the town of Andahuaylillas, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Judith is 32 years old, married, and has one child.  She divides her time between her household chores and her business buying and selling handicrafts.  She has been selling handicrafts in the main square of Andahuaylillas for more than one year.  This is a traditional and beautiful town which is visited by tourists who come from all over the world because of the town's beautiful chapel which is called "The Little Sistine Chapel of Cusco".  Judith makes the most of this attraction and, together with her companions, she buys handicrafts in Cusco and sells them in the town square.  She would like to invest in buying handicrafts.

Judith is grateful for the loan and would like to make it known that she will make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 42  años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales ella vive con dos de ellos de 16, 11 años de edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de animales mayores, la socia compra y vende toros, vacas; la socia desea invertir en la copra de 2 toros pequeños para criarlos y engordarlos y después de esto venderlos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales mayores, la socia comprara dos toros.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito que le otorgarán para así mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to, " PEROLNIYOC"; she lives in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.  This member is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children, 2 of whom she still lives with, of ages 11 and 16.  She alternates her household activities with the purchase of older animals; she buys and sells bulls and cows.  She wishes to purchase 2 younger bulls in order to raise them and fatten them up to later sell.
This member solicits the loan to invest in the puchase of older animals, she would be buying 2 bulls.  This member values and is thankful for the loan given to her in order to improve her quality of life; at the same time she commits to fulfilling her payments withing the allotted time.

loans.use: to purchase older animals, this member would purchase 2 bulls.

loans.name: Eva Olinda

texts.es:
Eva de 34 años de edad, es soltera,  vive en casa de sus pades, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Reque que se encuentra a unos minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Se caracteriza por que sus pobladores desarrollan la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Eva se dedica hace algunos años a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de corral como gallinas,pavos,patos y gallos al por menor.   Los cría en su corral que se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa para mayor seguridad de sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos natural posible, una vez que han completado su desarrollo los vende a los distintos mercados de la zona y los ofrece a sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá seguira ayudando a sus padres.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para seguir comprando aves de corral y seguir incrmentando sus ventas e ingresos para su casa, cubriendo sus necesidades personales.  Eva es una mujer responsble, trabajadora y empeñosa conocida por los pobladores del lugar donde vive, por querer mejorar  económicamente y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eva is 34 years old and single  She lives in her parents' home which is located in a rural area  of the Reque district, within minutes of the province of Chiclayo.  The area is characterized by its people working in agricultural and livestock activities.

For the last few years, Eva has worked purchasing, raising and selling at retail poultry such as chickens, turkeys, ducks and cockerels.  She raises them in the pen that is behind her house for better safety of the birds.  They are fed a balanced feed and natural grains when possible.  Once they have completed their growth, they are sold to different markets in the area and she also offers them directly to customers.  With the income she earns, she is able to continue helping her parents.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 New Soles through Edpyme Alternativa, to continue buying poultry and to get incremental growth in her sales and income for her home, covering her personal needs.  Eva is a responsible woman, hardworking and earnest, who is well-known by the locals where she lives.  She want to improve economically and have a better quality of life

loans.use: to buy more poultry.

loans.name: Naama

texts.en:
Naama is a 35-year-old mother of six. She began selling sheets, blankets and pillows from her home. Her business draws a good clientele with Naama gaining a name in providing quality customer service and a special personal touch. Naama is now ready to move the business from her home to another location in her neighborhood.

Naama needed this loan to purchase additional stock, shelving and do some renovations.

In the future Naama wants to move into a store near the central market and continue to see her business expand.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies, shelving, and do some renovations.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla decided to start her multiservice company, Precise Multiservices, three months ago. After working in the multiservice industry (which offers clients access to legal, notary, and tax services) for 10 years, Perla realized that she could offer these services to a community that she felt needed them most.

Originally from Monterrey, Mexico, Perla began working in the multiservices industry in the U.S. when she was 16, gaining experience as a notary with a local multiservice company in Houston, Texas. The work was immediately gratifying to Perla because, as she says, she was “doing something for somebody that they wouldn’t be able to take care of on their own.” From her first job, Perla worked constantly to better herself and the community around her. Growing up with a strong sense of family values, she balanced work, school, and family responsibilities as she grew her experience in the business. 

While Perla valued all of the clients she served in the early years of her career, she found working with clients in the Hispanic communities in Houston particularly fulfilling. Many of these clients were members of low-income families with little or no education on how to complete the complex legal forms necessary to live in the United States. Because she was helping people with such unique needs, these clients quickly found a place in Perla’s heart. As a result, she slowly began to work independently with non-English speakers and their families to manage and file complicated immigration materials alongside her full-time work with larger multiservice companies.

Now, at 26, Perla is ready to take her business expertise to the next level. She says that she has been ready to start her own business for a few years but has been unable to do so for financial reasons. With this loan, she will make her dream come true. She will use the money to purchase office equipment and supplies for her at-home office space, professional business software to design a website and print business cards, and a color laser printer to offer her clients more prompt and reliable printing and copying services. 

When asked what she hopes for her business in the coming years, Perla remains faithful to her family-oriented upbringing: “I hope to turn this into a family business….to move our business into a location where our services are most needed.”

Without her loan, Perla says she wouldn’t have been able to turn her dream into a reality. With this in mind, her advice to aspiring entrepreneurs is to “never give up on your dreams. It might take a while, but, if you stay with it, something good is bound to happen.”

loans.use: to pay for office equipment and supplies, business software, and a color laser printer.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala vive en la comunidad de San Pedro pero pertenece a un barrio que esta lejos del centro, la señora camina un largo tiempo para poder salir y entrar a la comunidad, en su barrios hay bastentes milpas que la gente siembra para poder tener maiz, hacer tortillas a mano y utulizar el zacate para darles de comer a sus animales, es de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo sembrar la milpa.
La señora Pascuala tiene 19 años y 2 años viviendo en union libre, vive en casa de sus suegros y tiene 1 hijo de un año de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y sabe hacer muchas cosas en lo que a construccion se refiere, mientras tanto la señora Pascuala cria puercos para poderlos vender y tener una ganancia. Ella nos menciona que los puercos y los borregos son los animales que la gente mas busca para hacer de comer cuando tienen una fiesta o para poder vender; por ejemplo, la gente que vende tacos, por esa razon decidio criar puercos, lo que mas le dificulta es el alimento ya que estos comen mucho y todo el dia se la pasan comiendo y como no tiene mucho zacate para darles de comer a veces lo tiene que comprar, las metas de la señora son hacerse de otros animales como borregos para poderlos criar y vender. 
Sus sueños es hacer una casa aunque sea pequeña, pero quiere vivir ya aparte de sus suegros y tener sus propias cosas.
texts.en:
Pascuala lives in the community of San Pedro but in a neighborhood that’s far from the center.  She has a long walk to leave and get to the community.  There are many corn fields in her neighborhood that the residents plant to have corn and make hand-made tortillas and they use the grass to feed their animals.  Planting corn is very hard work and takes a lot of effort.

Pascuala is 19 years old and has been in a common law relationship for two.  She lives in her in-laws’ house and has a one-year-old son.  Her husband works as a bricklayer and knows how to do a lot of things related to construction work while Pascuala raises pigs to sell and have some profits.  

She mentions that pigs and sheep are the animals people seek to make food when they have parties or to be able to sell, like people who sell tacos, for example.  Because of this she decided to raise pigs.  

Her greatest difficulty is the feed because they eat a lot and spend all day eating and because she does not have a lot of grass available to feed them she has to buy it sometimes.  Her goals are to acquire more animals, like sheep, to raise and sell.  Her dream is to build a house, even if it’s small, but she wants to live apart from her in-laws and have her own things.

loans.use: to raise pigs to sell.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is 36 years old and married with three children ages seven, eight, and nine. He is a farmer who tills land in Banga, South Cotabato. Remy has been growing rice for the past ten years. His farming income allows him to feed his family and send his children to school.

Remy is requesting a loan to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. In the future, he hopes to have a stable income to sustain his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and farm inputs

loans.name: Dilshoda

texts.ru:
Дилшода занимается купля продажей детской одежды. Более 4 года она занимается этим бизнесом. Дилшода мать одиночка и она сама обеспечивают свою семью. Её сын учится в среднем школе, и она хочет, чтобы её сын  учился в престижную школу и в хороших учебных заведениях, так как такие школы стоит дорого, и она не может, учит своего сына в таких школах. Давайте поможем Дилшоде чтоб сбылась её мечта. Она запрашивает кредит в размере 1000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента детской одежды с целью расширение бизнеса. Дилшода очень надеется в вашу поддержку. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Dilshoda is in the business of buying and selling children's clothing. She has been in this business for more than four years. Dilshoda is a single mother and supports the family alone. Her son goes to secondary school and she wants for her son to go to a better school, but such schools cost a lot and she is not able to afford it. Let's help Dilshoda make her dream come true. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000USD to buy a new variety of children's clothing with the purpose of expanding her business. Dilshoda very much hopes to receive your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of children's clothing

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha es socia del banco comunal Las Cuencanitas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una hermosa arquitectura colonia y esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía es muy variada, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Martha tiene 42 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 21 y 19 años de edad quienes trabajan. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Martha es vendedora ambulante de confeti y juguetes, actividad que la desempeña hace 15 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de juguetes y confeti para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es continuar con su negocio pero con su propio capital y sin deudas.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha is a member of the communal bank Las Cuencanitas who lives in the city of Cuenca. This city has beautiful colonial architecture, and is washed by four rivers. The city's cuisine is highly diverse, its people friendly and polite, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their forebears. 

Doña Martha is 42 years old, the single mother of two children, 21 and 19, who are working. She does not have her own home and so she rents. 

Ms. Martha is a street vendor of confetti and toys, a business she has had for 15 years. She works seven days a week without a fixed schedule. This is her second loan with the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of toys and confetti for her business. 

Her dream is to stay in business but with her own capital and without debt.

loans.use: to purchase toys and confetti.

loans.name: Osiris Marlenis

texts.es: Osiris D. 27 años D. edad vive en la ciudad D. Cartagena con su hija D. dos años; allí se dedica a la venta D. mercancía variada, negocio que tiene desD. su adolescencia y en el que ésta empeñada en hacerlo crecer;  mas aun  porque con el genera el bienestar D. su pequeña hija. Osiris venD. productos a créditos, que compra a proveedores y que encarga a empresas mediante catálogos o guías especializadas; su mercado se ubica en los diferentes barrios D. la ciudad D. Cartagena especialmente son mujeres quienes le compran. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa, calzado, productos cosméticos, bisutería, aprovechando las exhibiciones que traen sus revistas en  ésta época, y que vienen con buenos descuentos. Su desafío es la competencia agresiva con precios especiales, pero su trabajo y buena relación con sus clientes,  hacen que se minimicen las dificultades, además D. su indicadores financieros que muestran su potencial D. crecimiento y la facilidad con que pueD. responder a sus obligaciones financieras, con las que proyecta aumentar su capital D. trabajo y poder comprar facilmente.
texts.en:
Osiris, 27, lives in the city of Cartagena with her two-year-old daughter.  She sells assorted merchandise there, a business she’s had since her adolescence and which she’s determined to see grow especially because it generates wellbeing for her young daughter.

Osiris sells products on credit that she buys from suppliers and that she orders from firms via catalogues or specialized guidebooks.  Her target market is located in various parts of the city of Cartagena, especially women.

Her Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, will be used to buy clothes, footwear, cosmetics and costume jewelry taking advantage of the items on special promotion or sale appearing in her current seasonal catalogues.

Her challenge is the aggressive special price competition but her work and good customer relations minimize difficulties.  In addition, her financial indicators show growth potential and ability to easily respond to financial obligations to increase working capital and be able to buy easily.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, 52 years old, is a cake seller. Between her cake business and doing farming, she earns $5 per day. Her husband operates a motor taxi service, earning $3 per day. She has seven children: five are studying and two more are working in the factory, earning $8 per day for all. 

Every month, Chan spends $30 on food, $10 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a new motorbike for her husband’s career, because the previous motorbike is old and needs a lot of fixing. In the future, she wants to repair her house and to send her children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband's career.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 23 year old married woman who has no children. She has a business of selling charcoal in Jigomoni branch, in Yei, south Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Viola requested this loan through BRAC, south Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to be able to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish farm in the Philippines.

Lilian requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and feeds.

Lilian has been in this business for one year.

Lilian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and feeds.

loans.name: Yissegnon 1 Group

texts.fr: YISSEGNON 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même  quartier. La représentante du groupe, Laure (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un couturier nommé Pascal. Le couple a deux enfants à leur charge. L’un des enfants n’est pas scolarisé.Laure vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Laure a très peu fréquenté l'école. Depuis environs cinq  ans, Laure mène comme activité la vente des savons et des conserves. Laure s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin.C’est la troisième fois que Laure et les autres membres du groupe YISSEGNON 1 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
YISSEGNON 1 is a group of three persons who all live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Laure, who is raising her hand in the photo, is 29 and married to a tailor named Pascal. The couple are raising two children. One of the children doesn't attend school. 

Laure lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in supporting the family. Laure went to school for only a short time. For about five years, she has been selling soap and tinned foods. She buys her supplies in a market in Bénin. It is the third time that Laure and the other members of her group called YISSEGNON 1 are requesting a loan from ALIDé in view of growing their working capital and their businesses so as to better respond to the needs of their clientele. Their first two loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy soap and tinned food.

loans.name: Njete Farmers Group

texts.en:
Simon is the facilitator of Njete farmers group. Simon and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Simon and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Simon takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to have access to One Acre Fund's low prices, to ensure food security for his family, and, later, to educate them. In the 2011 season, Simon had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on three quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Simon was only able to harvest two bags of maize on that land. 

With income from maize sales, Simon will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Njete farmers group will each plant maize plots between ½ and one acre of land. 

The person standing on the far left of the photo is the field officer.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana is a 32-year-old woman who raises and breeds sheep and sells milk products in the local community. Tarana has 3 years of experience in this field. She breeds sheep for meat and fur and keeps one cow to sell milk and yogurt, which are very popular products in Azerbijan. Tarana's profit per month is 250 AZN. Her husband works as taxi driver, but his salary is too low to cover the needs of the family. Tarana's business is the main financial source of income. She has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase sheep and a milk cow.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and a milk cow.

loans.name: Johanna Lissette

texts.es:
Johanna Lissette tiene 27 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 12, 7, 5 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría. 

Johanna se dedica a trabajar en un salón de belleza es manicurista, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en manicurista en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para poder aumentar la vivienda.

Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudaría a poder arreglar la casa y poderse cambiar.

El sueño es poder vivir mejor en los tiempos libres le gusta pintarse las uñas.
texts.en:
Johanna Lissette is 27. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her husband and children, ages 12, 7, and 5. They live in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.

The Luchando Juntos communal bank is located in the Zapotal Nuevo district, belonging to the Ventanas canton. The majority of the members are merchants.

Johanna works in a beauty salon as a manicurist. She buys and sells products in a beauty salon in Ventanas. She is requesting this loan to expand her home.

With the help of this loan she will be able to fix up her house and make some changes.

Her dream is to have a better standard of living. In her free time she likes to paint her nails.

loans.use: to expand her home.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Señora Martha genera sus ingresos con el trabajo de transportista que su esposo desempeña en su movilidad. El crédito que solicita es para gastos funerarios de su hijo mayor el cual se encuentra en el hospital con vida artificial hace tiempo y es lamentable su estado de salud, de tal manera que se tomó la decisión de que descanse en la Paz del Señor.  Martha vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de Alto Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Martha tiene cuatro hijos. Este es un caso muy particular y especial, en el que prima la voluntad de ayuda a Martha.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha generates income in the transportation business with her husband driving their vehicle. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay the funeral expenses for her eldest son. He had been in the hospital for some time on life support and was in a declining state of health. They made the decision to allow him to rest in peace with God. Martha lives in her own home in the District of Alto Sopocachi in the city of La Paz. She has four children.

This is a very unique and special case, so best wishes are being extended in order to assist Martha.

loans.use: to pay for her son's funeral expenses.

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Romel provides a motorcycle or habal-habal service. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his service.

Romel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his service

loans.name: Sanzu A Group

texts.fr:
Lenatte est âgée de 33 ans, elle a  son restaurant  qui fonctionne depuis 5 ans. Elle habite à Ruyigi. Son ancienne activité est le commerce de la bière. Elle a étudié jusqu’en 6 è année primaire Elle est marié à Joseph, ensemble ont 5 enfants dont 3 étudient. Il a déjà bénéficié  10 crédits avec Turame. Le crédit Kiva, lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant d’autres ustensiles pour augmenter la quantité de nourriture  à vendre dans le restaurant.
Elle est membre du groupe  du  « Sanzu I  »
texts.en:
Lenatte is 33 years old and has run a restaurant for five years. She lives in Ruyigi. Her previous business was selling beer. She studied through six years of primary school. She is married to Joseph, and the couple have five children together, three of whom are in school. She has already benefited from 10 loans with Turame. This Kiva loan will allow her to increase her capital by buying additional kitchenware to increase the amount of food sold in the restaurant. 
She is member of the "Sanzu I" group.

loans.use: To increase her capital by buying additional kitchenware to increase the amount of food sold in her restaurant.

loans.name: Maria Riselda

texts.en:
Maria Riselda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more items like curtains, blouses and pants.

Maria Riselda has been in this business for three years. Maria Riselda earns more income from her variety store.

Maria Riselda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like curtains, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 42 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran in Misamis Occidental Province. He is married with three children. Romeo has a general store where he earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

Romeo has been a member of PMPC for two years. He has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for his store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
After graduating from junior high school, Hannah decided to set up her own small business in Elmina near Cape Coast. She is married to a mason and has five children.

She is a successful petty trader who sells items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, and soaps. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. 

Hannah wants to increase her inventory due to a growing number of customers. Unfortunately, she does not have enough working capital. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase an increased amount of toothbrushes, toothpaste, and soaps to sustain her business. Hannah aims to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase toothbrushes, toothpaste, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Melvis

texts.en: Melvis Merchan was born in Manabi, Ecuador and is a 44 year-old single woman. She own a small business, selling various household items in the Municipal de Bastión Popular. She starts work at 6am every day and usually closes her shop around 5pm. Her parents taught her how to operate the store, as they were the previous owners before Melvis took over. In the four years since she has been the proprietor of Bazar Melvis, Ms. Merchan has gained the customer loyalty she needs to now expand. She is asking for a $950 loan so she can buy food-packing items like Tupperware as well as other goods such as cooking utensils, which many local chefs purchase. More than anything, Melvis wants to be free of the “chulqueros” or loan sharks who charge high interest to poor Ecuadorians. She hopes that with this loan she can grow her business and be able to help her parents who are in need of more medical attention as they get older.

loans.use: Purchase goods such as plastic containers, cooking utensils, and marketing materials.

loans.name: Geray

texts.en: Geray is a man from Yardimli district of Azerbaijan. He started his private business in 1998, and in 2005-2006 borrowed three loans for a total of $1100.  Now he wants to borrow 700$ to increase assortment of goods in his shop.

loans.use: To increase business goods

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon N. is a tailor in Phnom Penh. She is 56 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. Nuon N. earns $2.50/day and her husband earns the same as a mototaxi driver.

She will use this loan to buy a sewing machine for her business. She also hopes to be able to fix up their house for the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: J. Tahir started his small business in 1999 when he purchased a cow and a few calves for meat purposes. Now he is going to enlarge his business and bring in additional income from animal breeding. He is going to purchase one calf and mixed fodder and has applied for a 700 USD loan from Aqroinvest CU to achieve his goal.

loans.use: Going to purchase a calf for meat purpose and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: T o expand his clothing business.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa is married and has a small 6-year-old son. They are originally from San Nicolás de los Garza in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. Her husband's salary is low, so to improve her family's quality of life, Teresa decided to start her own business selling perfumes three years ago. With the help of her husband she started getting supplies to present to clients, and fortunately her clientele has increased and her sales are improving every day.

To cover the orders of her clients, Teresa is requesting a loan of $475, which she plans to repay within six months. With it, she hopes to improve her customer service and continue growing her business. Teresa is very grateful for the opportunity to keep moving ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Teresa es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad, ellos son originarios de la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza en Nuevo León. Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Teresa decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de perfumes hace tres años, ya que el salario que su esposo recibe es muy bajo. Con la ayuda de su esposo comenzaron a surtir mercancía para darla a conocer, afortunadamente han logrado incrementar su cartera de clientes y sus ventas mejoran cada día.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes Teresa está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses, con esto espera poder mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece y continuar creciendo con su negocio. Teresa agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Ana Jose

texts.pt:
Ana is married and the mother of 4 children. She lives in Maxixe with her family. She works at a private company. She joined the loan program this year. She wants to use the money to buy some home appliances for her house. This is only the second loan that she is taking. The first one she used to purchase a freezer. Ana's husband is not employed. He lives from small jobs to support his family. For that reason, Ana joined the program in order to help her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Ana e casada e mae de 4 filhos. Ela vive na Maxixe com sua familia. Ela e trabalhadora numa empresa privada. Ela entrou para o programa de credito ainda este ano. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de alguns electrodomesticos para a sua casa. Este e so segundo emprestimo que ela toma. o promeiro ela usou para a compra de um congelador. O marido de Ana nao esta empregado. Vive de pequenos expediente para poder sustentar sua familia. por isso Ana entrou para o programa como forma de reforcar o seu vencimento que e baixo ara poder ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa.

loans.use: Ana wants to use the money to purchase home appliances

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: My name is Naseem P.. I belong to Lahore, a historical city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four: two sons and two daughters. I and my husband both sell video cassettes and audio cassettes in various cities on different festivals. I need a loan of $175 to buy cassettes in bulk for the New Year festival.

loans.use: Expand current business

loans.name: Lady

texts.es:
Lady Isabel is 33 years old and has two small children. They are the reason for her progress and she would like to give them the best she can so their development will be successful. Currently she works retail sales selling sodas, an activity that allows her to live peacefully, with the noble desire to increase her space soon in order to offer a larger quantity of beverages. Lady Isabel requests this loan as work capital in order to begin the expansion of her business. We can make her request possible, so that soon her business can be the biggest distributor in her beautiful city, Pucallpa.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Lady Isabel tiene 33 años de edad, ella es madre de dos pequeños niños, ellos son la razón de su progreso y desea brindarles lo mejor para que su desenvolvimiento sea exitoso. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas al por menor actividad que le permite vivir tranquilamente, con el noble deseo de acrecentar sus espacios a corto plazo para ofertar mayor cantidad de bebidas. Lady Isabel solicita una suma de dinero como capital de trabajo para iniciar la expansión de su negocio. Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto se convierta en la distribuidora más grande su bella ciudad, Pucallpa.

loans.use: Increase capital to expand her business

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Miss N. Sreymom is single and lives with her old parents. She has four sisters, two of whom are married and live in separate houses. The other two sisters weave silk at home.

Her family has three looms, including hers. She started her business weaving silk in 2000. It’s a skill she learned from her sister.

Sreymom and her family live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sreymom is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 from MAXIMA. She will use this money to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Zumreta

texts.en: Zumreta lives with her husband and two children in the town of Rosulje, a suburb of Tešanj. Her husband has a full -time job from which he earns a monthly salary of 500 KM. Zumreta runs a small catering business and has applied for her first loan, for $950, to buy a grilling machine. The machine will help her expand her business and her family's income.

loans.use: To buy a grilling machine for a small catering business.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr:
Born on July 3, 1960 in APLAHOUE in MONO county in the south-west of Benin, Ms. Lucie G. is married and the mother of two children. She sells various goods, such as canned food, soap, liquor, and other items. She has a lot of experience in selling diverse goods which enables her to have many customers each day. She is applying for this loan to widen her field of business and to meet the expectations of her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 3 juillet 1960 à APLAHOUE dans le département du MONO au sud-ouest du BENIN, dame G. Lucie est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de produits divers tels que les boîtes de conserve, les savons, les liqueurs et autres. Elle a une grande expérience dans la vente des produits divers ce qui lui permet d’avoir beaucoup de clients par jour. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour élargir son champ d’activité et pour satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of soap, 5 cartons of table wine, 12 cartons of canned food, 2 cartons of liquor, and 3 cartons of cookies

loans.name: Alice Kalule's Group

texts.en:
Alice leads a group with four members. She is 48 years old and married with seven children. Their ages are 28, 26, 20, 18,15, 12, and 8 and three of them are in school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban within a slum area.

She purchases bales of secondhand clothes, which she grades and prices. The clothes are then put on display in her home or sold in the daily markets in different areas. She sells at both retail and wholesale.

She must deal with high transport costs, price fluctuations, and an environment in which floods keep clients from getting to her stall in the rains.

She is successful in being able to pay school dues, acquire medication, and contribute to the family welfare. She aspires to buy a plot of land where she can construct rooms to rent out.

Alice has successfully paid back more than five loans.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She works in one of the local markets, known as Yubileiniy, where she sells men’s shirts. She has two vending facilities, and her daughter is helping her with sales in one of the vending facilities. Ludmila has been in this trade for 10 years. Currently, she has about $3,600 in inventory.

Ludmila is currently seeking a loan in the amount of 5,000 Grivnas ($1,075). She plans to use the loan proceeds to increase her assortment of shirts and to expand her business. With the expected increase in sales and profits from this loan, Ludmila hopes to open additional vending kiosks and to thereby improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her turnover capital and, eventually, to open additional vending kiosks

loans.name: Amanda's Maendeleo Group

texts.en: Amanda is married and has a one-year-old child. In 2005, she went into business selling chickens, and she now works at her trade daily from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.  She has applied for a loan to buy more chickens to raise and to sell to her customers. Amanda will divide her loan with the other three members of her group, Honorina, Meresia and Merry, all of whom run small businesses of their own.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
This group called El Progreso (Progress), was formed due to the hard-working attitude of Mrs. Agueda R. who currently serves as group president and found out about the program through a neighbor who also participates in an Enterprising Women Group. Agueda invited her neighbors to an information session in her home and the group formed very quickly. The Progress Group is located in the city of Capiata.

The group members are very appreciative of the loan and are a very strong group. They are very faithful women who all participate in their weekly meetings in order to collect funds to pay back the loan.

Currently, the group participates in big activities to collect funds since one of their group members has fallen ill, so they have come together to help her finance the costs of treating her sickness. The group shows significant solidarity and sympathy always helping each other. The group consists of 17 hard-working women that works in a variety of activities.

The Progress Group stands out as an excellent group as they have a record of zero late payments. They will use the loan to help them in such activities as: the sale of cleaning products, cosmetics, notions, food, chickens, charcoal, clothing, and fabrics for making clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

El Grupo denominado El Progreso se conformó mediante la actitud emprendedora de la Sra. Agueda R., actual presidenta del grupo quien se enteró del programa mediante una vecina que ya es parte de un Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Informó a sus vecinas que se realizaría una reunión informativa en su casa y rápidamente se conformó el Grupo. El Comité “El Progreso” se encuentra localizado en la ciudad de Capiatá.

Las integrantes valoran el préstamo y cuentan con una comisión muy sólida, son muy cumplidas, semanalmente participan de sus reuniones semanales realizando actividades para la recaudación de fondos.

Actualmente el Comité realiza grandes actividades para recaudación de dinero ya que una de las integrantes se encuentra muy enferma y de ese modo poder ayudarla para costear los gastos de su enfermedad, de ese modo las mismas demuestran la solidaridad y la comprensión al brindarse apoyo entre ellas. El grupo está integrado por 17 mujeres trabajadoras que realizan diversas actividades.

Se destaca la acción del Comité El Progreso, el grupo cuenta con cero días de atraso, es un excelente Comité. Ellas retirarán el crédito para invertirlos en las actividades que consisten en: venta de productos de limpieza, cosméticos y mercería; venta de comidas, venta de gallinas, venta de carbón, venta de ropas y confección de ropas.

loans.use: The group memebers will purchase cosmetics, clothing, charcoal, lingerie, household goods, fabric to make clothing, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Thi Loan's Group

texts.vi:
chị N. thị Loan năm nay 47 tuổi, Ms 01020011 đã tham gia vay vốn của chương trình qua hai chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt. Chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000 VND để kinh doanh thịt lợn. Hiện tại chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con, con chị đang đi học lớp 10. Hàng ngày chồng chị làm kinh doanh, chị đi chợ nên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định từ 150.000 VND đến 180.000 VND / ngày. chị rất thích tham gia hình thức vay trả này vì nó giúp vợ chồng chị tích kiệm tiền, đồng thời có kế hoạch cho tương lai của con cái. Nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị N. thị Dân Ms 01020012 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để sản xuất đồ gỗ .
  • chị Nguyễn thị Hà Ms 01020013 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn và mua lợn giống
  • chị N. thị Hoa Ms 01020014 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn.
  • anh N. đình Tính Ms 01020015 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua gỗ làm bàn ghế bán
texts.en:
Mrs N. thị Loan is 47 years old. She has already paid back 2 loans. This time she is seeking 4.704.000 VND. She is married and has 1 child who is in 10th grade. Her husband sells pork and she trades basic goods. Her family income is stable, 150.000 - 180.000 VND a day. She likes SEDA program very much because it enables her to save and plan a better future for her child. Other members in her group are:
  • Mrs N. thị Dân who is seeking 4.256.000 VND to manufacture wooden furniture.
  • MrsNguyễn thị Hà who is seeking 4.256.000 VND to buy breeding pigs
  • Mrs N. thị Hoa who is seeking 4.256.000 VND. She raises pigs.
  • Mr N. đình Tính who is seeking 4.256.000 VND to buy wood to manufacture

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy/sell pork

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina has been keeping chickens in Zanzibar since 2006. She is 23 years old, married, and has no children. She is now hoping to take out her first loan so that she may expand her livestock business and increase her profit.

Amina will share this loan with her fellow group members, Asha, Stara and Asha.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her livestock business.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.es: La Sra.  Venancia B., es nacida en Potosí, Bolivia. Actualmente vive en la Localidad D. limoncito  municipio el Torno, Santa cruz,  es dueña D. casa vive con su esposo y sus seis hijos. Su actividad principal es “servicio D. molino” D. semillas, como segunda actividad se dedica a vender cosméticos. Su esposo cuenta con una carpintería en la cual se dedica a la elaboración D. muebles. Su objetivo es equipar un poco más su carpintería y hacer terminar D. estudiar a sus hijos para que salgan profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Venancia B. was born in Potosi, Bolivia. Currently she lives in the area of Limoncito, in the municipality of El Torno in Santa Cruz. Venancia owns her home where she lives with her husband and six children. Her principal activity is to proviD. seed grinding services. Her secondary activity is to sell cosmetics. Her husband has a carpentry business, where he builds furniture. Her objective is to better equip the carpentry business and allow for her children to finish their schooling so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Tulituuka Group B

texts.en:
Twenty-seven-year-old Simon is a clever entrepreneur. He owns and drives a boda boda (motorcycle taxi), and he jointly owns with his a wife a motorcycle repair and parts shop. This greatly reduces his maintenance and repair costs, allows him to naturally solicit his colleagues for business, and it keeps his family working together. Simon is a seasoned veteran, having been driving a boda boda for nine years. Over the years, he has acquired a faithful clientele. 

The loan proceeds will be used to replenish the stock in the spare parts shop. Simon’s ambition is to turn the spare parts business into a wholesale distribution business. This is a less cyclical business and larger volumes will contribute more income to the household. Simon also aspires to own a small fleet of motorcycles for rental of them to drivers on a daily basis. He and his wife struggle to pay school fees for their three young children and dream of one day sending them to Uganda’s finest schools.

Other entrepeneurs in this group have similar goals.

loans.use: Replenishing the inventory in his motorcycle spare parts shop

loans.name: Justina De La Concepción

texts.es:
Justina R. es una dama muy alegre y dinámica que desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de gaseosas y agua ubicada en el mercado la Terminal de la ciudad de León específicamente al frente del local donde salen los buses para la ciudad de Chinandega.

Por tener un espíritu de superación en su negocio, la señora Justina ha buscado la manera de salir adelante y se ha apoyado de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel y por este motivo es que ha solicitado un nuevo crédito  con el propósito de adquirir los productos para continuar comercializándolos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Justina R. is a very cheerfu and dynamic woman that has for several years been selling sodas and agua in her business located in the terminal in the city of León, specifically in the front of the terminal where the buses leaves for Chinandega. Having a spirit of determination, Justina has looked for ways to get ahead and the loans provided by Ceprodel have help her. For this reason, she has requested a new loan with the purpose of acquiring the products to continue selling them in her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas and water

loans.name: Juan Fransisco

texts.es:
El Señor de Nombre Juan Francisco S. R. tiene la edad de 44 años, Don Juan tiene hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 19 años cursa el 1 año de la carrera y su hija de 16 años cursa el 5año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como docente, sus propósitos son de invertir en mas compras de productos para crecer en el mercado, sus sueños son establecer una sucursal para poseer 2 negocios enfocados en lo mismo y obtener mas ganancias para su familia quien lo necesita porque con el salario de su esposa no cubre los gastos suficientes para el hogar, sus deseos son de comprar al por mayor por lo que es la única ferretería que hay en el pueblo y así podría ofrecer la gran variedad de productos y así tratar de ser mas grande la localidad.

La actividad económica de Don Juan es una ferretería, la ubicación de su negocio es e el pueblo de Quezalguaque, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, Don Juan inicio este negocio por la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos que sea mas segura ya que el negocio con el que cuentan como es el de la agricultura y es por temporada no le genera ingresos diarios para la manutención de su familia por lo que apoyado con su familia decide establecer un negocio y decide que seria uno productivo como lo es la ferretería por lo que apoyado por su esposa decidieron establecerlo en su casa de habitación y como todo negocio inicio con pocos productos como: clavos, martillos, tornillos y otras herramientas por lo que fue difícil cautivar a sus clientes pero con el tiempo logra incrementar un poco mas en su inventario para satisfacer a sus clientes, le financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la comprar de mas herramientas, taladros y otros por lo que tiene que recurrir hasta Managua en busca de estas materiales.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco S. R. is 44 years old. Don Juan has two children. The oldest is 19 years old and is in his first year at college. His daughter is 16 and is in her fifth year of high school. Don Juan's life partner is a teacher.

Don Juan wants to invest in the purchase of additional products to expand his market. He dreams of starting another branch of his business and having two stores that sell the same products. He wants to increase his earnings to better support his family, because his salary and his wife's salary are not enough to cover the necessary household expenses. He also wants to start purchasing his products wholesale because his is the only hardware store in town. By purchasing wholesale, he can offer a wider variety of products and increase the size of his store.

Don Juan owns a hardware store in the town of Quezalguaque. He has owned this business for 5 years. Don Juan began his business when he was searching for a source of income more secure than agriculture. Agriculture is seasonal and does not produce the daily income necessary to support his family. For them, he decided to start a business that would be productive, such as a hardware store. They started the business in their home and like all businesses, they began with only a few products, such as: nails, hammers, screws and other tools. This made it difficult to attract clients, but with time, they expanded their inventory more to satisfy their clients.

This loan is capital to purchase more tools, drills and other items, for which he needs to travel to Managua to find.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya, a mother of four, has been selling sweets and cookies at the market for 14 years, attracting and keeping her clients by maintaining a good assortment at low prices. Her net income is about 2,000 UAH per month. This is the family's only income, since her husband left them long ago.

A disciplined, hard working and very enthusiastic person, Mariya’s goal is to raise her children and help them to start their life journeys. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 UAH for two months to increase her assortment of goods, hoping to thereby earn more income for her family's needs.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of cookies and sweets for sale.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha has been a soap and charcoal seller in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for 4 years. She belongs to Kibwana group loan (Group code 2022). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 40. Every day she works for 8 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soap and charcoal for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, pay school fees for her children, and to get more food for her family.

Agatha is 34 years old, married, and has four children: ages 16, 13, 11 and 7.

loans.use: To buy more soap and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo trabaja en una empresa de entrega de cartas, encomiendas, etc.,, es soltero e independiente y el único que genera ingresos para su subsistencia.
Vive en la zona de Villa Salomé de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para tomar una pieza en calidad de anticrético ( es una forma legal de alquilar una habitación,departamento o casa, mediante un pago total anticipado por un periodo especifico de un año o dos,al cabo del cual el inqui,inquilino se compromete a desalojar la habitación y el dueño de casa a devolver el dinero original) y poder independizarse.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Reynaldo works for a package delivery company. He's single and independent and only has to make enough to pay his own way. He lives in his parents' house in the Villa Salome neighborhood of La Paz. The loan will be used to get a room by paying what's called a "calidad de anticretico" (a legal term in Bolivia for a payment to a lessor for a room, apartment or house whereby the renter pays the total expected amount for a fixed period of a year or two, at the end of which the renter promises to leave the room and the landlord to return the original money) and become independent. This is his second Impro loan and his track record for repaying the past loan qualifies him as a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Deposit on leased room.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane Q. is managing a small rice field. She is 44-years old, married and has three children. Her husband, Pedro Q., is a barangay councilor. They work very hard to provide for all the needs of their family. Mary Jane worked as a volunteer social worker for a children's foundation before. She stopped volunteering when she got married because she needed to have more time at home than at work.

Mary Jane is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. Fertilizers are essential to improve the soil conditions. She needs fertilizers to increase her yield.

CEVI is a non-profit organization set up to respond to the needs of small businessmen. It not only provides credit to its clients, but offers training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Godlove

texts.en:
Godlove is a single father of one child who runs a provisional store, farms ginger and raises pigs, running the business out of Fonta and raising his pigs at his home. With this loan, Godlove plans to purchase many small provisions for his general store, labor to work his ginger farm and piglets.

This is Godlove’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. He has been doing well with his business because he thinks he has a good store location and his past experience has been successful. He knows that with even a small amount of capital he can make his business work.

Having fallen on hard times, including being sick and being charged a tax by the local council that was higher than his amount of capital, Godlove continues to keep his business going. He says, with the loan profits he will look to increase his business and perhaps help others who are in need by allowing them to use credit. Godlove chooses GHAPE loans because he can pay back over time, not all at once.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy provisions, pig feed and labor.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn D. is from Cagayan de Oro, Philippines. She is 26 years old. Genalyn is single. To make a living, Genalyn sells firewood. Genalyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Genalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and enable her to engage in business activities. Genalyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan that Genalyn has taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of clothes and shoes in bulk

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria  es socia del Bancomunal Las Amapolas
Maria  es casada tiene tres hijos de 23, 21 y 18 años, este ultimo esta estudiando en instituto superior.
Maria  vendía menú en Miraflores  tuvo que dejarlo por que se mudo a  Villa el Salvador, tiene cinco años viviendo, allí se puso a vender papa rellena, causa y conforme iba ganando clientela decidió vender salchi-papas, a ella le gusta mucho la cocina.  
Desde que Maria esta en Finca, aprendió a como  hacer funcionar mejor su negocio y  aprendió a invertir mejor el dinero. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, para la compra de aceite, gas, descartadles y papa.,  
El sueño Maria es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank group called “Las Ampolas” (The Poppies). She is married and has three children, (ages 23, 21 and 18), with the youngest studying in college.

Maria sold food in the town of Miraflores but later moved to Villa El Salvador, where she has been living for five years. There she sold stuffed potatoes. To conform to the requests of her growing clientele, she decided to sell sachipapas (sausage & potatoes). Her customers really enjoy her cooking.

Since becoming a FINCA client, Maria learned how to improve her business and invest her money better. She needs a loan of 600 soles to buy cooking oil, gas, disposable dinnerware, and potatoes. Maria dreams of opening a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cooking oil, gas, disposable dinnerware, and potatoes

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw is thirty-two years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Yaw trades in textile materials. He sells in a shop in his community. He also hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to other towns to sell. Yaw buys the textiles from Kumasi. He has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand his business. 
He wants to give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Elith

texts.es:
La señora Elith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 26 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Su impulso y empeño de ver a sus hijos profesionales, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de útiles escolares, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia. En la actualidad, es muy querida por sus clientes y alumnos que acuden a su pequeña librería a comprar, ya que ella cuenta con lo necesario que sus clientes necesitan y es ella misma quien les brinda su atención con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará utiles escolares como: cuadernos grandes y pequeños (cuadrados y rayados), cartulinas y lapiceros en diferentes colores, gomas, cintas y útiles de oficina para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Elith, se siente con muy capaz y es una mujer muy trabajadora, día a día agradece a la vida, por brindarle una gran oportunidad de salir adelante como mujer, igualmente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por   iniciarla a convertirse en una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Elith belongs to the Santa Rosa de Lima Community Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is in a common law marriage, 26 years old, and has one dependent child. Her desire and effort to see her children become professionals have motivated her to undertake her own business selling school supplies. The business is located in her own house in a place well set up to wait on her customers. The earnings generated help with the family economic income. She is now very dear to her customers and the students who come to her small bookstore to shop. She has what her customers need, and she herself waits on them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy school supplies like large and small notebooks (square and lined), cardboard, different colors of pens, erasers, tape, and office supplies to continue giving her customers great attention. Elith feels very capable. She is a very hard working woman. Day to day she is grateful for life for giving her a wonderful opportunity to get ahead as a woman. She feels the same about the Moviemento Manuela Ramos for starting to change her into an enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school and office supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old and is married with one child. She runs a small home-based grocery shop. She also has a food stand at a local company, where she sells lunch daily to its workers. Rosa’s husband works as a bricklayer. She can count on his support for her business ventures.

Rosa has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “Madres Coraje” (Mothers with Courage). Rosa plans to use this loan of 1000 soles to buy products for her shop as well as food items, including oil and rice, for her lunch business.

Rosa’s goal is to improve and grow her grocery business. She also wants to someday have a home-based restaurant.

loans.use: To buy items for a grocery shop and a lunch business

loans.name: Amégansi Baï

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est spécialisée dans un commerce d’un genre assez particulier : elle vend des perles et bijoux traditionnels mais originaux, très rares ces temps-ci. Elle a débuté ce commerce en 2002 dans le quartier d’Adakpamé à Lomé. Très vite, elle s’est connue surtout des touristes en visite à Lomé, mais aussi des togolais de la diaspora à la recherche des souvenirs du pays pour leurs amis européens. Elle a recruté des jeunes filles qui se promènent dans les villages et coins reculés du Togo à la recherche de ces perles authentiques. Elle a toujours réalisé de très bonnes affaires. Elle compte ouvrir d’autres points de vente dans deux autres quartiers de Lomé. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander plusieurs perles et bijoux traditionnels. Cette femme est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman became specialized in a fairly unusual business:  she sells pearls and traditional yet original jewelry, very rare these days.  She started this business in 2002 in the Adakpamé district of Lomé.  Very soon, she carried on particularly with visiting tourists in Lomé and also with Togolese of the diaspora looking for souvenirs of the nation for their European friends.  She has recruited girls to stroll through the villages and remotes corners of Togo looking for these authentic pearls.  She has always done good business.  She plans on opening other sales outlets in two other districts of Lomé.  For this reason, she's requesting a WAGES loan to place an order for several pearls and traditional pieces of jewelry.  This is a woman who is married and the mother of two children. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy traditional pearls

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
At the age of 54, Leticia successfully manages to maintain two businesses: her direct selling of Avon products and her vending of food snacks and vegetables in her village of Sto. Nińo Aurora, Isabela. She is gifted with four grown children, all of whom were able to graduate with a degree thanks to her patience and determination in generating income from her direct selling and food vending businesses. She has continued in her businesses for 15 years since then.

Because she enjoys the work and to meet her personal needs, Leticia dreams of further developing her business to bring about further progress. For this reason, Leticia was encouraged to request a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 12,000 to use as additional capital for her business. Many of her customers have become more successful and she would like to offer them new and improved products. She strongly believes that the requested loan will be of great help.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her direct selling and food vending businesses

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel H. sells electronic parts such as switchboard lamp holders, starters, bulbs and electrical cables. He also repairs electrical appliances in Elmina. Daniel has received a senior-high education. He is married and has three children. Daniel has been selling electronic parts since 1999. He is responsible for paying school fees and bills. 

His loan will be used to buy more electronic parts for sale and also for his repair works. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more electronic parts for sale and also for his repair works.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana D. is a 45-year-old mother of four children namely: Romero, 23 years old, Mary Rose, 21 years old, Miraflor, 20 years old, and Merdan, 10 years old. Her husband is Danilo D., who is now 51 years old; he is the one who manages one of their businesses which is making painted signs. This is one of the sources of their income; aside from that is their sewing business that Marciana personally manages because she knows how to sew a clothes. She manages the business well. Most of their children are currently studying thus more expenses for the parents; they need to double their work to make their business more productive.

When Marciana joined Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she properly utilized every loan that she received. She will be using her 6th loan to buy necessary things for her sewing business and also for the business managed by her husband. She will buy cloth, thread, and some paint. She is sure that when she buys this, it will help their business to be more productive and that will give them enough income for all of their expenses.

Marciana's dream is to have her own dress shop and to have a big income and also to help some in her neighborhood who know how to sew clothes by employing them in her hoped-for dress shop. And through the success of her business, she hopes she can afford to send their children to school through college.

loans.use: To finance her sewing business and their second business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working in the fields and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena, 50, is an entrepreneur in Surallah, South Cotabato. She does business in hog raising and rice farming. Three years of experience in this kind of business gives her the confidence to improve her business. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner, to seek a loan to be used for her business. She asked for 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed and farm supplies. She supports six children in the family, which is why she works hard to meet their needs.

loans.use: Feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Roxana que en estos momentos cuenta con 38 años vive en su propia casa, ubicada en la zona oeste de la localidad, junto a su esposo de 46 años y sus tres hijos; de 21, 18 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. La Sra. Roxana es promotora de la afamada línea de cosméticos "avon" desde hace más de tres años. Su esposo es trabajador fijo, seguro y antiguo de una industria de aceites. Actividades que realizan por varios años, por eso sus experiencias. La competencia es mediana en cuanto al comercio de cosméticos, porque hay otras personas con la misma actividad, pero lo importante es que ella es antigua en el negocio y ya tiene sus clientes asegurados. En cuanto a su esposo eso no existe, porque es empleado fijo y seguro. Roxana invirtió la mayor parte del crédito que saco en el pago de los estudios de sus hijos. Este es el noveno préstamo de la Sra. Roxana y todos los anteriores los ha cancelado excelentemente. Tiene una deuda vigente en otra entidad financiera, la misma que está pagando puntualmente.
texts.en:
Roxana is 38. She lives in her own house, which is located in the western part of the area. She lives with her 46 year old husband and their three children; 21, 18, and 15. For over three years Roxana has been selling cosmetics for the well known Avon line. Her husband has a steady, secure, and long time job with an oil industry. They have been in their activities for many years, and they are experienced. Competition in selling cosmetics is average. There are other people who do the same thing, but the important thing is that she has been in the business a long time and has her regular customers. For her husband, competition does not exist because his job is steady and secure. Roxana used the greatest part of the loan she got to pay for her children’s education. This is Roxana’s ninth loan. She paid back all of the previous loans excellently. She has a standing debt with another financial entity. She is paying that punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her children's education

loans.name: Sounkar Diaye

texts.fr: Sounkar DIaye B. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle Est membre du Banc Villageois de BAKIDIOTO depuis 05 ans. Elle a bonne expérience du crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 10 fois de suite. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels que du riz, du lait, du sucre, de l'huile végétale etc... Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Sounkar Diaye B., 60, is married and mother to five children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Bakidioto for five years. She has good loan experience, having received ten loans in a row. She has a shop where she sells diverse products such as rice, milk, sugar, vegetable oil, etc. She helps her husband support the family.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build up her business

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria has a hog raising and rice farming business. She is 58 years old and lives in Norala, South Cotabato. She started her business in 1996. Her business helps a lot to provide for the needs of her family. She supports five children.

Candelaria is requesting a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use it to buy farm inputs and feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and hog feed

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 8 años de edades ella tiene su negocio de confeccion de trajes. Hace 5 años empezó su negocio en su casa, es un negocio formal entrega su mercadería en tiendas en distintos municipios y departamentos. Patricia también atiende en su negocio de tienda de consumo diario esta muy contenta porque le ha ido muy bien ella solicita su crédito para abrir un local en su casa para incrementar su mercadería
texts.en:
Patricia, 35, lives with her husband and her eight year old children. She has a business making outfits. She started the business in her house five years ago. It is a dependable business. She delivers her merchandise to stores in different municipalities and departments. Patricia also takes care of her store, which carries daily consumption products. She is very happy because it has gone very well for her. She is asking for a loan to open a site in her house to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material to make outfits

loans.name: Felix Nicolas

texts.es:
El Sr. Félix Nicolás Meléndez tiene un taller de Carpintería y Ebanistería en su casa de habitación. El hace lo que son roperos, mesas, comedores, sillas, puertas, etc. 

El va a utilizar este crédito para comprar madera ya que tiene  2 juegos de sillas abuelitas encargadas que hacer y un comedor, pero debido a que tiene trabajos pendientes que no le han pagado no pudo comprar  la madera.

El piensa que con estos trabajos que le encargaron podrá surtir más en madera su negocio y así ir creciendo poco a poco, aunque dice manifestar que gracias a los créditos que le ha otorgado  CEPRODEL,  ha podido salir adelante con su taller y en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Sr. Félix Nicolás Meléndez has a carpentry and cabinet-making workshop in his home. He produces armoires, tables, dining sets, chairs, doors, and other items.

He will use this loan to buy wood. He has two sets of rocking chairs and a dining set that he has to complete. However, he has not been paid for his outstanding orders, so he does not have the money to buy wood.

Once these jobs are completed, Félix says he will be able to restock his business with more wood and continue to grow over time. He expresses his thanks to CEPRODEL for providing the loans that have helped him succeed in his business and in his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
Hằng Ngô Thị (20211020017) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hằng is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội 1 - Nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).
