Hằng is married and has two infants. To making a living, Hằng owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Hằng has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Hằng joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hằng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Hằng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Ước (20211020018) is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20211020015) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20211020014) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


4.  Nghiêm Thị Chín (20211020016) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business providing recycling services.


5.  Nguyễn Bá Tuấn (20211020043) is a 34-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his business providing recycling services.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hằng Ngô Thị (20211020017) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hằng là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngô Nội 1 - Nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để B.n.  Hằng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hằng kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Hằng đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hằng đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & B.n sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Ước (20211020018) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20211020015) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20211020014) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn B.n thức ăn.


4.  Nghiêm Thị Chín (20211020016) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


5.  Nguyễn Bá Tuấn (20211020043) là 34 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông B.o bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông B.o các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Malaque's Group

texts.en:
Loty M. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 73 years old and the leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Loty is married and has 11 adult children. She has had a "sari-sari" — general store — for over five years, and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month. 

In 2004, Loty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from PMPC and is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Loty from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 44 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho por forjarse un buen futuro. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Florentino de 47 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación.

Su tienda de abarrotes es una de las más visitadas de la ciudad de Tarma, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su bodega en espera de que sus clientes lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y está dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Para más adelante, espera poder ampliar su tienda y surtirla de más mercadería poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Carmen con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Carmen, 44, has worked hard all her life to forge a good future. She lives in her own home with her husband, Florentino, 47, and their two loved children, for whom she wants to provide a good education. Her grocery store is one of the city of Tarma’s most popular; she is open for business from very early in the morning waiting for her customers to arrive to buy the things they need. She is a very cheerful and solicitous seller; she always welcomes her customers with a smile and is willing to assist them with their purchases. What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers; she has been in this line of work for 2 years and considers the most difficult part having to stay inside her store all day without being able to go outside. Later on, she would like to expand her store and stock it with more merchandise so that she can offer her customers a wider variety of products. This is Carmen’s 9th loan with MFP and she’s determined to repay on time because she doesn’t want to cause any problems to her fellow communal bank members, who hold her in very high esteem. She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more stock items for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Victoire Group

texts.fr:
Victoire est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien car elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, le charbon de bois, le  bois de chauffe, les habillements,  les céréales etc. 
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 5 ans. Elles sont à leur treizième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Wassa Traoré est un membre du groupe Victoire qui vend du charbon de bois.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des chargements de charrettes en charbon de bois auprès des producteurs. Elle se procure  du charbon dans les différents coins de brousse. Son stock de charbon entreposé dans un endroit de la concession, est très important. Elle vend le charbon  de bois en détail et au comptant au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Victoire comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Wassa Traoré compte réaliser 190 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcée ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Victoire is a group of women from Koutiala who know each other well because they live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are, on average, 45 years old, married and have at least three children each. This group of women deals in various products such as charcoal, firewood, clothing, cereals, etc. To grow their business, the members decided to get involved with the loan institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. They are on their thirteenth group loan and all of the previous loans have been properly repaid. Wassa Traoré is a member of the group Victoire who sells charcoal. She plans to use her loan to buy cartloads of charcoal from producers. She gets her charcoal in different parts of the backwoods. Her stock of charcoal stored on her family land is very important. She sells charcoal at retail for cash at the main market of Koutiala to a diverse and varied clientele. While the other members of the group Victoire plan to clear a profit of 160,000 FCFA during this loan cycle, Wassa Traoré plans to clear 190,000 FCFA. In addition to repaying the loans, they use a part of their income to meet daily family expenses. They hope to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that supplies will not run out.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Almohada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Almohada está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y decididas provenientes del barrio Camilo Ortega que se encuentra ubicado en la zona sur de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es Nora B. quien en 1990  empieza a realizar y comercializar donas y platanitos los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Darxnia Leticia H. H. quien desde hace un año tiene una pequeña venta en la que invertira con la  compra de frijoles, papel higiénico, pan, arroz, huevos, gaseosa etc.  y Lesbia Raquel Dávila A. quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos e invertirá en las líneas  Fareway, Ismari, Dulce Honestidad.
texts.en:
The Almohada group consists of three hard-working, enterprising, and determined women from the Camilo Ortega district located in the southern region of Managua. The coordinator of the group is Nora B., who in 1990 began to create and sell doughnuts and chips that she sells as a street vendor. Her group companions are Darxnia Leticia H. H. who for a year has had a small sales business; she will purchase beans, tissue paper, bread, rice, eggs, soft drinks, etc.; and Lesbia Raquel Dávila A. who sells cosmetics and will invest in Fareway, Ismari, and Dulce Honestidad products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of business stock

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora L., 50 years old, is from the village of Poblacion 1, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is married and has 3 adult children.

To make a living Aurora sells plastic wares like pails and other small water basins in the local community. Aurora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

Aurora joined HSPFI in 2006 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional inventory.

Aurora is requesting her 11th loan, for 15,000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family’s income.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Deylin Francisco

texts.es: El señor Deylin Francisco tiene 25 años, es casado y tiene un hijo menor de edad. El señor tiene una unidad de moto taxi, la cual circula en el área urbana desde las seis de la mañana hasta las diez de la noche. El maneja dicha moto taxi y ya tiene tres años de tenerla. Anteriormente él trabajaba como chofer pero esto no le generaba ingresos mayores para  él. Está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de realizarse unas mejoras a la moto taxi que tiene, con el objetivo de brindar un mejor servicio. Algo que afecta a él en el transporte es que las calles están bastante malas lo que hace que los vehículos se deterioren con mayor facilidad. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a comprar un microbús, con el objetivo de obtener mayores ganancias en su negocio de transporte.
texts.en:
Deylin Francisco is 25, married and has a young child. He has a motorcycle taxi unit, and he circulates through the urban area from 6 am to 10 pm. He drives the motorcycle taxi and has had it for three years already. Previously, he worked as a driver but this did not earn him much income. He is requesting this loan to make some improvements to his motorcycle taxi, with the goal of offering a better service. Something that affects him is that the streets are pretty bad and this makes vehicles deteriorate more easily. His dream has always been to buy a minibus, in order to obtain better earnings in his transportation business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Petty Traders Group

texts.en:
Victor T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Petty Traders.  He is 28 years old, single and was only able to attend school through 12th grade, due to a lack of financial support.  

For eight years, he has been selling cosmetics in Clara Town Market Monrovia, Liberia. This is his third loan circle.

He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 38,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cosmetics.  He describes himself as a God fearing person.

His goal is to improve his business and become a supplier in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia lives in the city called Pakpattan in Pakistan. She has applied for a fourth loan from Asasah. This time she wants to help her husband who works in the field and needs money to buy seeds and fertilizers for his land. 

She is the mother of two children who are both very young and need the fulltime attention of their mother. She is a housewife but she also sews clothes for her neighborhood clients to earn extra income for her family. 

She is a regular client of Asasah. She has maintained a good credit behavior. She has successfully completed her three loans of Asasah and now has applied for the fourth time for a loan to establish her husband’s business. With the loan he will buy the abovementioned items for his lands and produce good crops.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng S. and her husband, Mr. Som-oun Nhem, have been married since 1962 and have seven children – two sons and five daughters. All of their children are now married, and one still lives with the family. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Kheng buys silk products from her fellow villagers and transports them to sell in other provinces far away from her home. Her husband is a primary school teacher. She has received a Kiva loan several times already. She is now requesting another loan, for $1,000, in order to continue expanding her business by purchasing silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase finished silk products for resale

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame K. is married.  She has senior high educational background.  Maame sells cooked rice and serves it with palm-nut soup at Takoradi. Her husband is a driver.  Maame adds her income to that of her husband to take care of the entire household. She will use the loan to purchase more rice to cook and to add other foods to it for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to open a shop where she can sell different varieties of cooked foods.

loans.use: purchase more rice to cook and add other foods to it for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of supplies to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa D. is from the village of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 36 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Marissa owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over sixteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Marissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Marissa is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 5th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza ” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de San Estanislao del Asentamiento Santa Rosa .  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, cría de animales etc. 
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 
Este comité ya están en su tercer ciclo, todo este tiempo demostraron puntualidad, solidaridad y  unión entres las compañeras. 
La señora Maria es una de las integrantes, una señora muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta  de varios productos. 
Ella tiene un negocio un negocio en su casa el cual le ayuda mucho con los gasto de su familia y al mismo tiempo para el progreso de la misma.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para el negocio como yerba mate, harina, productos de limpieza, y otros.
texts.en:
The “La Esperanza” (Hope) Group was started by several neighbor ladies in the city of San Estanislao del Asentamiento Santa Rosa. All of the members work independently in sales, preparing fast food, raising animals, etc. They formed a very united group capable of working to strengthen their unity. This group is in its third loan cycle, and they have shown punctuality, solidarity and unity among themselves.

Mrs. Maria is one of the members. She is a very hard-working woman who sells different products. She has a business in her home that does a lot to help with the family's expenses and with their progress. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her business like tea, flour, cleaning products, and others.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (groceries, beverages, cleaning products)

loans.name: Elba Alicia

texts.es: Elba Alicia S. D. G. D. 50 años D. edad, siempre se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y humilD. quien ha luchado mucho por salir adelante. Vive junto a su esposo, un hijo quien trabaja y un nieto D. 15 años D. edad, junto a los cuales vive en Ciudad Delgado. Elba posee un bazar en el cual comercializa juguetes, trastes, ropa, sandalias, recuerdos, cosméticos, cremas para el cabello, pegamentos, colas y ganchos. DesD. hace 25 años que ella posee este negocio, en el cual cuenta con varios clientes. Elba solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo D. surtir aún más su bazar, el cual lleva por nombre “bazar Elba’s”. D. esta forma ella espera mejorar sus ganancias y así poder vivir mejor junto a su familia, en la cual todos sus miembros se dedican a trabajar por el bienestar D. ellos y del el pequeño nieto D. Elba.
texts.en: Elba Alicia Solis D. G. is 50 years old. She has always stood out for being a very hardworking and humble person who has struggled hard to advance herself. She lives in the city of Delgado with her husband, a son who works, and a grandson who is 15. Elba has a market stall where she sells toys, dishes, clothing, sandals, souvenirs, cosmetics, hair creams, glues, soft drinks, and hair pins. In the 25 years that she has had this business, she has had a variety of customers. She is applying for a loan with the great desire to stock her store, which has the name "Bazar Elba's," even more. In this way she hopes to increase her earnings so that she and her family can live better. All the members of the family work for their own well-being and that of Elba's little grandson.

loans.use: Buy various products to stock her shop.

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander B. sells various home products at the central market in Melitopol city. He has been in business for 11 years. His income is about 4,000 Grivnas a month. 

He enjoys selling small things that help make home chores easier. Alexander is a very happy and enthusiastic person. With his income, he helps his sisters and their parents with whom he lives in one big house. He is not married.

Alexander would like to get a loan of 12,000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of his inventories. He always tries to have a large assortment of small home products to offer something to each client that comes his way.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of products he sells

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni N. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two brothers).      

Zaituni has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.   Zaituni sells her products at the market, by means of retail.   

Zaituni has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of fruits and vegetables like oranges,  cabbages, and mangoes.  She also generates additional income through selling bananas.

The main business challenges for  Zaituni include transport, the ever increasing prices of fruits, and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing fruits and vegetables herself.  

Zaituni lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: To buy fruits & vegetables for resale

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus is a fifty-one-year-old married man with five children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He longs to educate all his children to get a bachelor's degree as minimum qualification. 

He has a retail shop and has been in business for ten years now despite challenges in capital and bad debts. However he has made tremendous progress, beginning as a door-to-door hawker and now renting a shop. Deus needs the loan to buy sugar, soap, rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar, rice, and cooking oil to sell in his shop

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip plans to buy a termite and bedbug detection dog with this loan. Philip is a home inspector running his own business, F. Home Inspections. He inspects the condition of homes, checking for electrical, structural, or any other problem.  He also inspects for insects. “I have a pest control business license and I want to expand that side of my business. In a non-conventional way.”  With the rise of bedbugs across the country, Philip sees a real need for these services. “It’s becoming an epidemic.  …To be able to do an inspection of a house with a canine will be very valuable.”

One of the worst parts about bedbugs is the psychological impact. “It really messes with people’s heads,” and bedbugs are very hard to find. “On a typical inspection you have to pull carpets back, look at small crevices – you can’t really find them.”  That’s why Philip says inspections with a dog work well. “Even if we don’t find them, now the customers have the assurance that they’re not there.  And that’s providing another service, beyond finding it.  It’s peace of mind when you don’t find it.” 

Philip F. comes from a construction family – his father was a builder and his mother, a realtor.  For a few years Philip would buy houses to live in, rehabilitate them and then sell them. “Everything leads me back to construction.” In 2003, he went into business as a home inspector and opened his business.

The biggest challenge Philip has faced in recent years has been the slowdown in the economy and especially the housing market. “But our business has grown even in this declining market.  And I know the reason why. If you provide a service above what clients expect at a price less than they expect to pay, they’ll recommend you.  …it’s a win-win.  Everyone’s happy.”

During the winter months, Philip relies on savings to some extent.  “Our business generates significant income, but it’s cyclical.  People don’t move as much during the holidays, so they don’t inspect homes as much.  …You never know, being an independent business – there’s no guaranteed paychecks.  So you tend to be conservative when the market’s slower.”

Philip has been planning on getting an insect detection dog for about 18 months.  He first approached his bank. “They declined my loan.  After I applied to ACCION Texas-Louisiana, the bank reconsidered and offered me a loan, but I turned them down.  Because I was already set to close with ACCION.”

This loan will cover part of the cost of the dog and Philip’s expenses while going through handler training.  “It takes two weeks for them to train you, so I have to pay for hotels while that’s happening.”  Philip will pay for the rest out of his savings. “I will use the loan to bridge that gap.  I don’t get the dog until March, which is when business picks up.  That’s when most people start to move and house hunt.”

Philip is providing for his wife, two young sons and two step-daughters with this business.  Another reason why he wants to expand the business is because “eventually everyone has to retire.  In order to do that you need to generate passive income. Hopefully these two businesses will provide that for me and my family.  …When you get to be 60 years old you don’t want to be on a second-story roof, 80 feet in the air.  And then if my sons want to go into this business, they can do that.”

Philip advises other business owners that “you just have to take a chance.  You have to take a risk.  That’s what’s so cool about Kiva – there’s so many diverse people trying to take a chance. And I want to be part of that.”

Philip has been very excited to discover Kiva.  Since learning about it through his loan application, he has made two loans to other Kiva borrowers.

loans.use: Termite and bedbug detection dog

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Raul; el tiene 41 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte y también el socio es abogado, con respecto a su negocio de transporte el socio tiene un bus que hace servicio público a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar combustible y mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Raul is a member of the “COMUZONE I” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Raul is 41 years old.  He lives with his partner and has two children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his transport business.  He is also a lawyer.  As regards his transport business, Raul has a bus with which he provides a public transport service in the city of Puerto Maldonado.  Through this business, he gets his children ahead in life.  He is requesting this loan to buy fuel and pay for maintenance work on his vehicle.

Raul is happy to be receiving this loan and he pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy fuel and to have maintenance work done on his vehicle

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap N. (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Penh, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980.

Sopheap is a weaver. Her husband is a marine. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting and to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and to repair the house where she lives

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed K. is 28, single, and has no children but has one dependent who lives with him; he helps Mohamed in his business in exchange for Mohamed's help educating him. In 2007, Mohamed established his electronics business where he sells radios, discs, tapes and lights. He began his business because he wanted a means to sustain himself. Working seven days a week, seven hours a day, he earns about Le 400,000 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock for his shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to open another shop and buy land to build a house. He is serious and determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more discs, radio, tapes etc.

loans.name: Ndef Leng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NDEF LENG est créé le 03 mai 1997 à l'occasion de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de SANGHE DOUKA qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elle ont pratiquement toutes des liens de parenté, ce qui favorise et renforce leur solidarité. 

Madame EYNABOU S. mise en médaillon dans la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de trois autres enfants qui lui sont confiés. 

Elle fait la vente de lait caillé et de denrées alimentaires. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de cinq ans. Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille par l'achat de la nourriture, des fournitures scolaires pour les enfants, la prise en charge des frais médicaux etc
texts.en:
The Ndef Leng solidarity group was created 3 May 1997 at the inauguration of the Sanghe Douka « Banc Villageois », to which it is affiliated. It consists of 13 women all from the same village. Most of them are relatives, which encourages and strengthens their solidarity.

Mrs. Seynabou S. (seen in the medaillion) is the group responsible. She is married and the mother of four children. She also has three other children placed under her care.

She has been selling milk curd and food products for over five years. Her objective is to participate in providing financial support to her family by providing food, buying school supplies for the children, taking care of medical expenses, etc.

loans.use: Develop her small business selling milk curd and food products.

loans.name: John Carlos

texts.es: John Carlos García es un joven de 26 años que vive en el barrio los Trupillos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, allí se dedica a la venta de productos de ferretería como productos PVC, cables de electricidad, puntillas, tuercas, lijas y soldadura  al por mayor, que le compra a un distribuidor en Bogotá, la capital de Colombia, y le vende  a distintas ferreterías de la ciudad de Barranquilla; esta actividad la inició  cuando, después de cuatro años de experiencia como dependiente de una empresa ferretera, decidió independizarse para  iniciar su propio negocio.  Su sueño es tener una gran central de acopio para distribuir estas mercancías  desde allí, pero necesita mucho capital de trabajo para ello y justamente este es su gran desafío. Con su primer financiamiento en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el comprará productos en P.V.C. que es su articulo principal y tambien de electricidad,  para responder a  encargos y porque estos son de mayor rotación; con su credikiva aprovechará las ofertas que se han generado en este mes, en el que las plataformas comerciales tienen muy  baja rotación de estos productos y los ofrecen a buenos precios.   John Carlos maneja su negocio mediante  ventas de contado principalmente y a crédito que recupera semanalmente, estas últimas es donde  reposa mayormente su cartera, la cual  recupera mensualmente, mientras persiste con su sueño de lograr crecimiento  empresarial y personal para potenciar el futuro exitoso  de su familia.
texts.en:
John Carlos G., ages 26, is a young man who lives in the neighborhood of Trupillos in the city of Barranquilla. There he sells hardware products such as PVC, electrical cables, nails, screws, sandpaper, and welding supplies at wholesale. He purchases these products from a distributor in Bogota, the capital of Colombia, and sells them to different hardware stores in the city of Barranquilla. John Carlos started this business after he gained four years of experience working for a company that sold hardware. He decided to become independent so that he could start his own business. His dream is to have a large centralized warehouse from which he could distribute his merchandise, but he needs plenty of operating capital to do this. The lack of capital is his greatest challenge.

With his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, John Carlos will buy PVC products since this is the main item he sells, as well as electrical supplies, so that he can fulfill his orders. These products also have high turnover. With his Kiva loan, he will also take advantage of bids being generated this month at commercial auctions where products that have low turnover are being offered at good prices. John Carlos manages his business mainly through cash sales and credit payments he collects on a weekly basis. Lately most of the cash stays in his wallet while he tries to recover payments each month. He continues to pursue his dream of having a growing business and reaching his personal potential so that his family can be successful in the future.

loans.use: Purchase PVC products & electrical supplies in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Banisilan, North Cotabato. She is 39 years old. Grace is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and beverages in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita B. is from the village of Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 77 years old. Carmelita is married. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to  purchase livestock feed. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Carmelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Pum

texts.en: Pum H., age 31, is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector since her children were very young. Currently, she owns a piece of land on which she cultivates different kinds of crops to earn a living. Her husband helps her in the business. She is married with two school-age kids. They generate around $2 US each day to cover the family’s expenses. Pum H. will use this loan to grow watermelons for extra income.

loans.use: to grow watermelon.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Veuve de 37ans, Mme Akossiwa est mère de 02 enfants et revendeuse de boissons. Elle a démarré son activité depuis 2005 et emploi 02 personnes. Elle vend dans son bar « CHELSER » après avoir acheté à la brasserie de Lomé. Ce pret lui servira à acheter des boissons pour revendre à la population. Mme veut accroitre son activité afin d’agrandir son bar en ajoutant d’autres activité parallèles, assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants, avoir plus tard sa maison afin d’éviter de payer le loyer.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 37-year-old widow with two children, and is a retailer of drinks. She began her business in 2005 and has two employees. She sells drinks at her bar, named "Chelser," after buying her supplies at the brewery in Lomé. This loan will serve to buy drinks for resale to the general populace. Akossiwa wants to increase her business in order to enlarge her bar by adding additional business activities, ensure a bright future for her children, and eventually own her own house so she will no longer have to pay rent.

loans.use: To buy and sell drinks.

loans.name: Jocelinda

texts.es: Jocelinda, de 25 años, es una mujer ambiciosa y luchadora, vive con sus padres y su hermana Lisbet de 22 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Desde hace 5 años que prepara pan, en un inicio lo distribuía en los diferentes puntos de venta de su localidad pero ahora tiene su propia panadería, que además de vender pan, vende también tortas y pasteles. Con ello creció su negocio y sus ganancias, y eso le favoreció mucho para poder ayudar con los gastos de estudios universitarios de su hermana que deseaba estudiar enfermería. Pero para continuar con el apoyo a su familia, tuvo que incursionar en la agricultura, ayudando a sus padres en la siembra de arveja, papa y hortalizas; y durante el fin de semana, ella va a supervisar los cultivos y a negociar lo que ha cosechado en el mercado central de su ciudad; logrando enviar hortalizas a la capital. Lo que más le gusta a Jocelinda es ayudar a su familia, pues su mayor deseo es ver a su hermana realizada y a sus padres tranquilos. Ahora quiere comprar productos para implementar su panadería, asimismo adquirir su propio terreno y de esa manera poder cultivar mayor cantidad de hortalizas, para cumplir con la demanda que le genera los compradores mayoristas y para ellos tendrá que contratar peones para que le ayuden en el cuidado de sus futuros cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura que su banco comunal es muy respetado en su localidad. Jocelinda, con el crédito solicitado comprará semilla de espinaca, varios sacos de abono orgánico, para su próxima cosecha. Asimismo  sacos de harina y manteca para realizar los ricos panes y pasteles que prepara.
texts.en: Jocelinda, 25 years old, is an ambitious and hard-working woman. She lives with her parents and her sister, Lisbet, who is 22, in their own house located in the Palcamayo area. For five years she has prepared bread, initially distributed in the different outlets in her area but now she has her own bread shop where, in addition to selling bread, she also sells cakes and pastries. With that her business and earnings have grown and this helped her a lot to be able to help with the university education expenses of her sister, who wished to study nursing. However, to continue to support her family, she had to enter into agriculture, helping her parents in planting peas, potatoes and vegetables. And on weekends, she supervises the crops and negotiates what has been harvested in the city's central market, sending vegetables to make money. What Jocelinda likes most is helping her family. Her greatest wish is to see her sister successful and her parents calm. Now she wishes to buy products for her bakery, as well as acquire her own land and, in this way, be able to farm a greater quantity of vegetables to meet the demand that the wholesale buyers generate and for that she will have to hire workers to help her to take care of future crops. She belongs to the "Patrón San Cristóbal" community bank and this is the second loan with MFP, where she is sure that her community bank is very respected in her area. Jocelinda, with the loan requested, will purchase spinach seeds and various bags of organic fertilizer, for her next harvest, as well as bags of flour and butter to make the delicious bread and cakes that she prepares.

loans.use: to purchase spinach seeds and bags of fertilizer. She will also buy bags of flour for the preparation of bread and cakes.

loans.name: Benitos

texts.es:
Benitos tiene  45 años de edad, el es casado y tiene un hijo menor de edad, el vive con sus esposa y su hijo en una comunidad donde la mayoría de pobladores son independientes  la actividad que en su mayoría desarrollan es la agricultura,  está comunicada es un anexo llamado  Cruz del Medano en el distrito de  Mórrope, el cual cuenta con 40 años de creación aproximadamente cuenta con 20 viviendas es una zona rural.

Benitos se dedica a la  comercialización de animales menores, en variedad además al engorde de cerdos, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, este negocio lo desarrolla ene. Mercado central o en  los distintos caseríos de Mórrope.  Esta actividad la realiza desde hace mas de 6 años, en los que a adquirido experiencia en el rubro y clientela fija a su negocio.

Benitos está solicitando un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para el engorde de su ganado vacuno y porcino, con el préstamo comprara alimento para dicho ganado, medicina y adecuará corrales para tal fin.

Benitos es una  persona emprendedora y responsable, el desea poder crecer como empresario y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Benitos is 45 years old, married, and has a young child. He lives with his wife and son in a community where most of the residents are independent farmers. This community is located in an annex called Cruz del Medano in the District of Mórrope, which has been in existence for approximately 40 years. There are 20 homes in this rural area.

Benitos sells a variety of small animals. He also fattens pigs that he raises in pens located behind his home. This business is developed….at the Central Market or in different villages in the District of Mórrope. Benitos has been in business for more than six years. Throughout this time, he has gained experience in this type of work and acquired an established customer base for his business.

Benitos is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN so that he can fatten his cattle and pigs. He plans to use the loan to buy feed and medicines for his animals, as well as build adequate corrals to house them.

Benitos is an enterprising and responsible person who desires to grow as an entrepreneur so that he can provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines for his animals.

loans.name: Andriy

texts.en:
Andriy is married with a teenage son and a daughter. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Andriy offers transportation services on the territory of Ukraine. He has been working in this business sphere for four years. Currently, his monthly net profit amounts to 5,500 Grivnyas. 

Andriy is requesting a 16,000 Grivnya loan to do major repairs on his vehicle engine, as well as to purchase four tires and an accumulator unit for his car. Andriy’s enterprise is the main source of income for his family of four. He is working hard hoping to ensure a decent living for his children. One of Andriy’s biggest dreams is to help his children through college thus giving them a chance to become educated people and get a better life.

loans.use: to do major repairs on his car engine and purchase four tires and an accumulator unit.

loans.name: Romains 10:13 Plus Group

texts.en:
Genevieve, 52 years old, is married and has eight children between 13 and 35 years old. Two of them go to school.

She is the chairwoman of the group named “Romains 10:13 Plus,” made up of 26 members firmly united to receive loans from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Genevieve’s main business is sewing. She also sells drinks in her area. She has been a micro entrepreneur since 1990. Each week, her business generates a profit of $100. She likes her business and she is working hard to achieve her goal of one day opening a pastry shop. 

She is a loyal client of the HOPE RDC who has already received eight loans and has repaid them properly. 

She intends to use the next loan to purchase a new sewing machine in order to sew more items to sell and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita desD. muchos años atrás trabajó en la calle al sol y al agua vendiendo dulces y mecato, sin embargo hace poco tiempo tuvo un golpe D. suerte que le ha permitido tener un espacio fijo para vender comidas y bebidas.

Ella trabaja con su hijo ya que es muy enferma D. las piernas por permanecer la mayor parte del día D. pie, ella quiere poder brindarle a sus clientes una variedad mas amplia D. productos y por esto quiere comprar mas insumos, variar los productos y así incrementar sus ventas y poder descansar un poco para recuperar su salud.
texts.en:
For many years, Margarita has worked outdoors in the sun and the rain selling candy and snacks.  However, she recently had the good luck to find a permanent place to sell her food and beverages. 

She works with her son because she has serious leg problems from spending most of the day on her feet.  She wants to be able to offer her customers a wider variety of products and so she wants to buy more supplies.  This will increase her sales and allow her to rest a bit to regain her health.

loans.use: to purchase breads, cold meats, sauces and other ingredients

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Joyce has a retail shop where she sells different kinds of rice, by the kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Joyce is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Joyce hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Jasmin has a retail shop that sells clothing like blouses and t-shirts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy t-shirts, blouses and underwear to sell.

Jasmin is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jasmin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 56-year-old widow with three adult children. The family lives in a barrio and plants rice and vegetables. As rice is their main source of income, they want to increase their rice production to earn more income and satisfy their basic needs.

Due to financial constraints, Nena has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay for the labor costs of transplanting rice seedlings. She hopes that, during the upcoming harvest season, they will increase their crop yields and income so they can meet their basic necessities and save for future emergencies. She dreams of putting up a general store in the future as another source of income. She believes that if there is patience, there is progress.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for the labor costs of transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo de 60 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Segundo desde hace muchos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (patos, pollos, pavos y pichones), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para la compra de más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Segudo es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia con la finalidad de que logren su objetivo.
texts.en:
60-year-old Segundo lives with his family in his own home which does not have basic services.  His house is located in the rural part of Cayaltí district, in Chiclayo province.  The people in this area farm and raise livestock.

Segundo has been raising and selling farmyard bird (ducks, chickens, turkeys and chicks) for many years.  His pen is located behind his home.  It is suitable and spacious.  He feeds his animals balanced feed so that they reach an optimal level of growth and he is able to sell them in the different markets in his area, making good profits with which to cover his family expenses.

Segundo has requested a loan for 2,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more animals and their respective feed.  With the profits he makes from selling his animals, he will be able to repay his loan and enjoy a better quality of life.  Segundo is a person who, through hard work and determination, has known how to get his family ahead in life with the aim of helping them achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Rudyliza

texts.en:
Rudyliza is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Rudyliza has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Rudyliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rudyliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Saidaati

texts.en:
Saidaati is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married with five children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past 14 years, Saidaati has been working hard to manage her small shop, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Saidaati has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Saidaati to generate greater profits and provide for her daily needs. Saidaati hopes that in the future she will be able to own a boutique. 

Saidaati is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Saidaati who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 36 year old, single, and has two children, one of whom attends school and one of whom works in a garment factory and earns $4 per day.

Pov is a cake seller earning $3 per day. Every month she has to spend $40 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

Pov is requesting a loan for $200, which she will use to buy wood to repair her house. She wants to extend her career of selling cakes when she can service more customers.

loans.use: to purchase wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Katty

texts.es: Doña Katty es una clienta con 42 años de edad, divorciada, tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales vive solamente con uno. Es muy trabajadora y tiene visión empresarial. Cuenta con una amplia trayectoria en la Fundación y siempre se ha caracterizado por su reponsabilidad y puntualidad. Tiene su negocio de pizzería en su misma casa, ubicada en un buen punto de la comunidad. Ella junto con una hija son las que realizan la actividad. Cuenta con contratos en ocasiones especiales con asociaciones de diferentes bananeras que hay en el lugar. Actualmente necesita invertir en equipo de trabajo para mejorar la calidad del servicio express que ofrece.
texts.en: Doña Katty is a 42-year-old borrower. She is divorced and has four children, of whom only one lives with her. She is very hard-working and has an entrepreneurial vision. She has a considerable history with the foundation and has always been characterized by her responsibility and punctuality. She has a pizzeria in her own house, located at a good spot in the community. She and one of her daughters are the ones who work in the business. She has contracts for special occasions with associations of various banana workers in the area. Now she needs to invest in some equipment to improve the quality of her express service.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and invest in her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy, a married woman blessed with one child, describes herself as a hardworking business woman. Operating a grocery business to support her family, since joining Faulu Kenya she has learnt how save her money, and hopes to grow her business in the future. Lucy has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy potatoes, tomatoes and fruits for resale.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes and fruits.

loans.name: Chripus

texts.en: Chripus is married and blessed with two children. One of them is in school. He has been running a posh mill (also known as posho mill, mechanical mill for maize where grains are ground into flour) for the last five years to support his family. Previously, he was farming. He has employed one person to help him in the business. The major challenge he faces is competition so he has to work hard and be aggressive to retain his customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy maize.

loans.use: To buy maize for processing into flour.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La socia Benita; continua con su negocio de elaboracion de comidas caseras y venta de las mismas en la plaza principal del poblado, la socia ha visto que su negocio se ha incrementado gradualmente y por ello desea seguir invirtiendo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboracion de comidas caseras, la socia desea seguir apoyando en la mantencion d elos hijos en casa por ello sigue trabjando para ahorrar para los estudios futuros de sus hijos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de comidas caseras.
texts.en: Benita continues making home-cooked meals to sell in her town’s main square.  She has seen her business grow gradually and wants to continue investing in it so needs to buy ingredients to make the home-cooked meals.  She wants to continue supporting her children at home and this is why she continues to work to save up for their future schooling.  She requests the loan to buy ingredients to prepare home-cooked meals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare home-cooked meals.

loans.name: Eureka ( Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Eureka y se integra de tres personas un hombre y dos mujeres quienes cada una se dedican  su respectiva actividad.

   Quien se le tomo a la entrevista se llama  Edin  quien es  casado con la señora Mireya y con quien procreo tres  hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.

   El solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de mercancía par surtir su negocio de abarrotes en  donde lleva trabajando hace   dos años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a mejorado mucho sus ingresos.

   Para de dedicarse a esta  actividad lo decidieron con su esposa  quienes ambos trabajaron en estados unidos  y con los  ahorros que obtuvieron pusieron la tienda de abarrotes y le s va bien ya que día con día agranda mas sus negocio.
  
  Quine se integran en el grupo son la señora Guadalupe quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su  tienda de abarrotes y Marbella invertirá en la compra de mercancía  también para surtir su tiende  abarrotes.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named Eureka and it is comprised of one man and two women, each with their respective business.
The one who was interviewed is called Edin. He is married to Mireya, with whom he had three children who are still under their responsibility.
He requested the loan in order to purchase goods to stock up his grocery store. He has worked in the grocery store for two years and he says that it is going well, since his income has increased a good deal as a result.
In order to run this business he, along with his wife, decided that they both would work in the U.S. and with the money they earned, they set up the grocery store. It is going well, because the business keeps expanding every day.
The other members of the communal bank are Guadalupe, who will use the loan to purchase goods to stock up her grocery store, and Marbella, who will also use the loan to purchase goods to stock up her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase goods to stock up his grocery store.

loans.name: Anale

texts.en: Anale is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. In the picture is Anale and her son. She makes and peddles meals like ginisang gulay (vegetable saute), & afritada (stew). She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anale hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La señora Edith se dedica a la  venta de antojitos mexicanos  como es tostadas, tacos  dorados, carne  frita y sopes.
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos  trabajadores , humilde llena de sueños  por cumplir.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar ingredientes como es: cebolla,chile,tomate,carne de pollo y res,tortillas y aceite.
Le da las gracias a fundación por todo el apoyo que le ha dado.
texts.en:
Señora Edith sells Mexican antojitos [traditional corn-based food] such as tostadas, fried tacos, fried meat, and sope [fried tortilla topped with refried beans, onion and hot sauce].
She has three hard-working children. They are humble and full of dreams to achieve.
Edith requested this loan for the purchase of ingredients such as: onion, chilli pepper, tomato, chicken and beef, tortillas, and oil.
She thanks the Fundacion for all of the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is 33 years old. He is married and supports a family of six people. For the past 18 years, he has run a brick-making business, earning a monthly income of KES 26,000.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd,of KES 30,000, with which he plans to increase output and employ more casual labourers in his project. 

His hope and dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To increase output and employ casual labourers in his business.

loans.name: Jeanylyn

texts.en:
Jeanylyn is a married wirh three children. She is 25 years old, and lives in Lusot, Baliangao, Mis. Occ.: Philippines. 

Jeanylyn own and operate a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 4,000. She requested a loan of 7,000.00 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In 2010, Jeanylyn  joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock.

loans.name: Ehtiram

texts.en: Ehtiram is an Internally Displaced Person from Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He came to Baku in 1993, and started his business in 1996.  In 2005-2006 he borrowed two loans from Normicro Baku branch. The total amount he borrowed is $1,100. Now he wants to borrow $700 to increase the variety of goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Justa

texts.en:
Justa lives in her own home on 3 de Mayo street in the Villa Nuevo Potosí district of La Paz. She is 47 years old and has been separated from her husband for almost 10 years. She supports her three children by making ice cream (cones, cream cups, cinammon lollipops, etc.) She also sells her products in stores and on the street close to several schools. She has two employees who earn by commission.

Justa has been a client of Impro since 1999. She started with one refrigerator but currently has two for ice cream, and two ice cream makers, one to make ice cream from cream and the other to make ice cream from cinammon. Because of her past loans with the institution we recommend her for this loan to buy more specialized machinery.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Justa vive en casa propia en la calle 3 de mayo de la zona de Villa nuevo Potosí de la Ciudad de la Paz . Ella tiene 47 años de edad, esta separada del esposo casi 10 años y mantiene a sus tres hijos; se dedica a la elaboración de helados (conos, vasitos de crema y chupetes de canela, etc). Además de que ella misma realiza la comercialización del producto ofreciéndolo en las tiendas, como también en la venta ambulante en diferentes colegios. Ella cuenta con dos empleados a los cuales les da a precios económicos y ellos generan sus ingresos de acuerdo a lo que vendan en el día.

La señora es cliente de Impro desde el año 1999; empezó con una heladera y actualmente ella tiene 2 conservadores de helados y 2 maquinas, una para hacer helados de crema y otra para los helados de canela. Por su antecedente con la Institución se sugiere otorgarle el crédito porque ella necesita comprar una maquina selladora de helados.

loans.use: Increase her capital

loans.name: Namusu

texts.en: Mamusu K. is forty-five years old with four children. Her husband’s income alone is insufficient to meet all the family’s expenses.  Mamusu runs a small business of selling chilli peppers wholesale and retail.  She purchases the peppers in bags from the villages and sells them to retailers in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone).  In order for Mamusu to continue to make a good profit, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to increase her inventory.

loans.use: Increase inventory of chilli peppers sold wholesale and retail

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
For the past four years, Yuliya has operated a children’s clothing kiosk in the central market of Melitopol. Shy but hardworking and enterprising, Yuliya has successfully grown her business to provide herself with a stable and consistent income. Yuliya uses her income to support her mother and continue investing in her growing business.

Yuliya is a veteran client of Nadiya Ukraine and has successfully used the support of micro-loans to expand her business and generate additional income. Currently, Yuliya is seeking a loan for $600 to increase her inventory. With the additional profits, Yuliya plans to continue developing her business and eventually purchase her own apartment.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Gloria Consuelo

texts.es:
Gloria and Héctor are dedicated parents who, through much hard work and sacrifice, have mangaged to provide for their 3 children. They are very proud to continue to support their children as they study in the best and most prestigious universities in their country. This is why the couple has to work even harder, so that they can continue to keep up with the expenses created by their children living outside of the home, such as food and rent for them. It is increasingly difficult to come up with the money due to the difficulties caused by nature, such as climate change, and competition from other farmers.

These factors have had negative effects on their economic stability and they have had to cut back on household expenses. So as not to disrupt their children’s studies, they are requesting a loan of $350.00 to buy fertilizers, with the goal of improving their crops. We hope you will contribute to this request. Your collaboration is invaluable and very important.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria y Héctor son unos abnegados padres que a costa de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio en sus labores agrícolas, han podido mantener a sus 3 hijos a buen recaudo y con mucho orgullo ahora los mantienen cursando estudios superiores en las universidades más prestigiosas de su país. Por ello es que esta pareja tiene que dedicarse aún más en sus actividades con el propósito de seguir solventando los gastos que le demanda la permanencia de sus hijos fuera del seno familiar como es la comida y el alquiler de los cuartos. La suma de dinero que tienen que conseguir cada vez es más difícil de obtener por la dura lucha que hay que emprender con la naturaleza por los cambios climatológicos y con el hombre por la dura competencia de sus productos. Estos factores han perjudicado mucho la estabilidad de su economía y han tenido que acortar los gastos en su hogar. Para no interrumpir con los estudios de sus hijos solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares para comprar fertilizantes y abonos a fin de mejorar sus productos. Esperamos usted pueda contribuir con esta petición su colaboración es imprescindible y muy importante recuérdelo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Aziamayo

texts.fr:
Mrs K. Aziamayo was born in 1972 in Dagbati and lives with her husband in the village of Atséti in the Vo region. A mother of three (3) children, she works in production of palm oil from palm nuts. Her small business helps her gain a considerable income which helps her to provide for her needs and those of her family. To further grow her business, she is asking for a loan of $200 in order to buy a larger quantity of palm nuts.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Aziamayo est née en 1972 à Dagbati et vit avec son mari dans le village d’Atséti dans la préfecture de Vo. Mère de trois (3) enfants, elle est spécialisée dans la transformation des noix de palmes en huile. Cette activité lui procure un revenu non négligeable qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Pour redynamiser cette activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $200 afin d’acheter en quantité importante les noix de palme.

loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru:
Ali A. is 62 years old and has a secondary school education. He is married and has seven children. Rustam has been breeding livestock for three years and this is his main source of income. He plans to use his loan to buy two young bulls to raise and sell. After he sells them in 40-45 he will buy more young animals to fatten and sell over ten months. At the end of the credit cycle, he will retain three bulls as profit. He plans to repay his loan within a ten month period.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Азизов Али, возраст – 62 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 7-х детей. Али в течение 3 лет занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота и этот вид деятельности является основным источником приносящий ему доход. Он планирует на сумму кредита приобретсти 2 бычков для откормки и продажи. Продавать бычков он будет через 40-45 дней после откормки, затем он будет покупать новый молодняк, откармливать и опять продавать, и так в течение 10 месяцев. В конце кредитного цикла ему в качестве прибыли, согласно подготовленного прогноза должно остаться 3 бычка. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase new livestock

loans.name: Betty Lely's Group

texts.en:
Fortunata, Filomena, and Betty have been members of the community bank “Dignidad” for 2 years, 4 months, and one year respectively.  Fortunata is the current president of her bank.  They all mentioned that they have learned a lot from the lessons on how to treat your children, self-esteem, punctuality, responsibility, and saving.
Fortunata is 39 years old, and is a single mother of one son.  Together with a friend she sells orange juice, which they make.  In addition, with her free time she cleans houses and hotels.  Fortunata dreams of owning a house, and her own hotel.
Filomena is forty, and is also a single mother.  She has two children.  Filomena has been selling plastic wares from a stand in Ayacucho for three years.  Before that she worked as a domestic servant, but thanks to her savings and loans she received she was able to start her own business.
Meanwhile Betty is thirty-seven.  She lives with her partner and four children.  Betty sells coca leaves, which are the medicinal plants cocaine can be made from.  She buys them in the markets of Ayacucho and travels several hours to the region of Huancavelica to sell them.
Fortunata, Filomena, and Betty each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying oranges, plastic wares, bags, and coca leaves.
They plan to use their savings to build a house, buy land, and to pay for their children’s education.  Their dreams are to have their own house, own a hotel, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Fortunata, Filomena, and Betty each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying oranges, plastic wares, bags, and coca leaves.

loans.name: Khairi

texts.en:
B. Khairi is 57 years old. She and her husband raised three children. 

Khairi is a market vendor. She sells socks in the local market. She has been it the business for 12 years. Now the business is the main source of income for Khairi. Her children are grown up and living independently. However, even today Khairi wants to support them and help them, and being a loving mother and grandmother, she always has in store some small gifts and sweets for her grandchildren. The business helps Khairi to feel independent. Now Khairi is planning to increase the range of goods for selling. For this she requests 1,000.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. Being the client of IMON with a positive credit history, Khairi promises to be precise in the loan repayment and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing socks in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Virginia Lourenço

texts.pt:
Virgínia Lourenço S. was born on 23/04/1970 in Manhica, a Maputo province. She studied until the 6th grade because her family could not afford to send her to school. She had 11 brothers and sisters but 7 did not survive. She now has 5 brothers. She married when she was 19 years old, and has 6 children. The oldest is 20 years old. In 1987 she started selling groceries to help her husband with the family expenses. She joined the CCP credit association before but did not like it because some group members were not being responsible. This is the 2nd loan she is requesting through HLUVUKU. The first loan was of 7.000MT.

Virginia is requesting a loan of 16.000MT to improve her house. In the future she plans on acquiring more credit to improve her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 4 - Boane Cliente: Virgínia Lourenço S. Actividade: Habitação Valor de empréstimo: 16.000,00MT Aplicação: Compra de Material de construção Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 31/05/2009 Virgínia Lourenço S. Nasceu aos 23/04/1970 na Manhica Província de Maputo. Estudou ate a 6ª classe e porque a familia não reunia condições suficiente teve de parar de estudar. Tinha 11 irmãos , morreram 7. Actualmente tem 5 irmãos, dos quais 4 maternos e 1 paternos. Casou se com 19 anos de idade e tem 6 filhos o mas velho com 20 anos de idade. Em 1987 começou a praticar o seu negocio de venda de produtos alimentares para ajudar o marido nas despesas familiares. Já foi membro de grupo de uma Associação de créditos de nome CCP e teve que desvincular se for falta de sereidade de alguns de membros do grupo.

Ė pela 2ª vez que trabalha com a HLUVUKU, teve o 1ª credito no valor de 7.000,00MT que aplicou para o comercio tendo pago sem problemas, e agora pretende o valor de 16.000,00MT para a dar continuidade com o melhoramento da residencia familiar. A perspectiva futura e ter outro credito para aplicar na compra de bens de apetrechamento da casa.

loans.use: To construction material to build families house

loans.name: Zineta

texts.en:
Zineta was born in 1976 and is from the town Kalesija. Her husband is a seasonal worker; when he works he can earn about 1000 KM monthly. They live with Zineta's mother-in-law and their three children, two of whom go to primary school.

Zineta breeds cattle and earns money by selling the milk to dairy plants. This is her first loan, for 600 KM. Zineta will buy chickens to fatten. Her wish is to increase monthly income and to improve the living standard for her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz S. sells cattle. He started his business in 1998 with growing the calves. Now Aziz has the large cow-shed in which he has many calves and the milk cow.
