He likes animals and his job very much which allows him to support his family. Aziz is 48 years old. He is married with three children. The youngest is in his last year of school. His elder son has become an adult and now helps him as well as his wife.

The business requires a great effort to keep it successful and to generate stable income for the family. Thus, Aziz gets up every morning at five o’clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. Today Aziz requests $1200 US for the term of 12 months. The loan is required to purchase calves and fodder for cattle. Aziz would like everyone to trust him, and he promises to be precise in the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchase cattle and fodder for the animals

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Mr. Marcelo C. B. sells basic consumer products from a store in his house. He started the business four years ago with a small loan provided by FAPE.

His wife tends to the business, while he dedicates himself to other activities such as farming and commerce.

Thanks to his efforts the general store has grown. Together with his wife he has been able to help his ten children, all of whom are in school studying, get ahead.

The loan would be used to invest into more products for the business, and he hopes to grow and provide better service while tending to the needs of his customers.

His dream is for his children to advance and continue with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Marcelo C. B., tiene una venta de productos de consumo diario en su casa, este negocio el lo inicio hace 4 años con un pequeño préstamo que FAPE le dio. Su esposa atiende el negocio, mientras el se dedica a las actividades de agricultura y comercio. Gracias a sus esfuerzos su negocio de la tienda ha crecido, y con su esposa están sacando adelante a sus 10 hijos, y todos sus hijos están en la escuela estudiando. El préstamo lo utilizara para invertir en mas productos de su negocio, y desea crecer y atender de mejor manera las necesidades de sus clientes. Su sueño es sacar a sus hijos adelante y que sigan con sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase basic merchandise to offer for sale.

loans.name: Dung

texts.vi:
Her husband abandoned her and her 4 children. She alone has to work hard to tend to their lives so it is unendurable. Her children one by one had to quit school to go to work for others. She currently only has the ability to educate one child. Her oldest son had an accident so his communication skill and health are not good, and thus he is unable to work. In addtiion, she has to spend money to buy him medication. They have little land to cultivate. They only have 1 small lot that they planted 100 green dragon plants, and therefore, she and her children have to work to make extra money to live, and buy medicine for her son who had the accident. Her family wishes to have some capital to expand their chicken farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chồng bỏ nhà đi đâu không rõ, để lại 4 đứa con. Một mình mẹ phải vất vả lo toan cuộc sống nên không thể kham nổi. Các cháu lần lượt bỏ học đi làm thuê. Hiện tại chỉ còn khả năng nuôi một cháu đến trường. Con trai lớn bị tai nạn giao thông sức khỏe yếu không đi làm được nhưng lại phải tiêu tiền thuốc men. Đất canh canh tác không có nhiều, nhà có 1 sào đất trồng 100 trụ thanh long vì vậy mấy mẹ con phải đi làm thuê kiếm sống và lo thuốc thang cho cháu bị tai nạn. Gia đình mong có nguồn vốn phát triển chăn nuôi gà.

loans.use: Raise Chicken

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea is married, and she is 68 years old. She studied only until the first year of primary school. She is the mother of 7 children, and she lives in a block of the plaza called Armas de Centro Poblado, in Mazocruz, in the Santa Rosa District of the Province of Collao de la Región Puno.

With a first loan of S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, she was able to buy more vegetables, potatoes, meat, etc. in order to continue preparing viandas (food), a business that she has worked at for several years.

Because of her age, two years ago she changed her business. Currently she has a small snack store, and she also makes bread together with her spouse.

With this loan of S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she would buy ingredients to make bread, sweets, cookies, and soda pop. “Thanks to the loans that I have gotten from the Banco Comunal, I have increased my business and my earnings,” says a very satisfied Doña Dorotea.

Her greatest wish is that her youngest daughter would become a professional, and that the older children don’t have to stop studying because of a lack of economic means.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Dorotea está casada, tiene 68 años de edad, estudió solo primer año de primaria, es madre de siete hijos y vive a una cuadra de la plaza de Armas de Centro Poblado de Mazocruz . Hace siete años es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez del Centro Poblado de Mazocruz , Distrito de Santa Rosa, Provincia del Collao de la Región Puno, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles pudo comprar más verduras, papa, carne, etc. Para seguir preparando viandas (comida), negocio que se dedicó varios años. Por su edad hace dos años cambió de negocio, actualmente cuenta con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes dedicándose también a la elaboración de pan, conjuntamente con su esposo. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará insumos para la elaboración de pan, golosinas, galletas y gaseosas. “Gracias a los créditos que obtuve del Banco Comunal he incrementando mi negocio y más ganancias” manifestó muy contenta doña Dorotea Su mayor deseo es que su hija menor sea profesional, ya que los hijos mayores no pudieron estudiar por falta de medios económicos.

loans.use: To buy various food ingredients and products

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. is 40 years old. In 1999, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed her first loan worth VND 1 million to raise ducks. Her business is now in its 10th year and she has expanded following the farm model. At present , her family has a milling machine and it helps increase their total income to VND 4 million/month. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 10 million to buy unhusked rice, husk it and sell the rice to local people.

loans.use: buy unhusked rice to husk and sell

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ret L., 29, is a vegetable seller. She grows vegetables and sells them at the market, earning approximately US$2.16 per day. She is married with four children, all of whom are students. Unfortunately, insects often ravage her vegetable crop. To address this problem, Ret is seeking a loan in the amount of US$250 to buy insecticide in order to protect her vegetable crop and to buy more seeds in order to grow additional vegetables. In turn, she expects that the loan will enable her to increase her family's income. Ret is the leader of a small group of three members who live in Paksneng Commune, Siem Reap Province. For greater clarity, the group members are described briefly below.

1. Mrs. Leab M., 51 years old and a widow, grows and sells vegetables. Leab requests a loan in the amount of US$200 to purchase insecticide to use on her vegetable crop.

2. Mr. Sary V., 28, makes and sells charcoal from his house. Sary requests a loan in the amount of US$200 to grow rice by plowing his farmland.

3. Mrs. Sophal S., 38 years old and a widow, is a vegetable grower. Sophal requests a loan in the amount of US$250 to purchase insecticide to use on her vegetable crop.

loans.use: To purchase insecticide to protect crops and to purchase seeds to grow additional vegetables

loans.name: Bolivar Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "BOLÍVAR" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA MAGDA KARINA QUIEN ES CASADA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD; LAS DEMÁS SOCIAS TANBIEN SON MADRES DE FAMILIA, CON NIÑOS MENORES DE CINCO AÑOS. EXISTE UN PARENTESCO EN LA FAMILIA ENTRE MARIBEL Y DILMA QUE SON HERMANAS PERO AMBAS TIENEN NEGOCIOS INDEPENDIENTES. LA PRESIDENTA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE CALZADOS, HACE YA CINCO AÑOS. Y LAS DEMÁS SOCIAS SON COMERCIANTES EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL ELLAS TIENEN BASTANTE EXPERIENCIA EN ESTA ACTIVIDADES PRÉSTAMO LES SERVIRÁ PARA AUMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO AXIAL COMO PARA EL INCREMENTO DE MERCADERÍA PARA LA VENTA.ELLAS NO TENÍAN OPCIÓN A UN CRÉDITO PERO GRACIAS A LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL YA CUENTAN CON ESTE SERVICIO.
texts.en:
The Bolivar Group is represented by Mrs. Magda Karina who is married and has two young children. The other members are also mothers with small children younger than 5 years old. Two of the members, Maribel and Dilma are sisters but both have independent businesses. The president has worked selling shoes for the past five years. The other members are merchants in the central market who also have a lot of experience in sales. This loan will help them to increase their working capital to increase the merchandise they have available to sell. They could not obtain a loan elsewhere but thanks to the AgroCapital Foundation, they are able to obtain it.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for their business operations

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib, 41, lives in Nabatieh, a town in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Habib has been painting houses for 25 years. He is requesting a loan of $1000US from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his house and to support his family expenses. This is the first time that Habib has requested a loan.

He decided to start his own business because he wanted to be independent and have a better income.Habib has a good reputation because of the quality of his work and his competitive prices. He is not only a house painter, but he also takes care of water leaks. His clients include his friends and family members.

When he first started his business, Habib faced the difficulty of convincing people that he was capable of doing good work. His future plan is to expand by enlarging his territory of clients as he wants to be known not only in his village, but in other villages.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on the family house and support his family expenses.

loans.name: Eliezer

texts.es: El Sr. G., casado, de 32 años de edad con 2 hijos, elvaron estudiara el 3er grado, la niña no esta en edad escolar, su esposa no tiene ninguna profesion, pero sale a realizar lavado y planchado donde gana dinero extra por semana los que aporta a los gastos del hogar y el con su salario paga su credito y asume otros gastos.  Eliezer trabaja para la Alcaldia Municipal de juigalpa desde hace 12 años como vigilante nocturno, ademas cuenta con un bono mensual que le otorga la Alcaldia a sus trabajadores lo que viene a ayudarle en su economia; esta solicitando su 2do credito que lo utilizara para continuar con la construccion de su vivienda, pues con su primer credito levanto paredes hasta la altura de las puertas, en esta ocasion comprara el resto de las piedras, perlines y zinc para el techo, manifiesta que esta haciendo un esfuerzo muy grande para construir su casa y darle un techo propio a sus hijos y a su esposa, pues es muy triste estar comprartiendo con otras personas que tienen diferentes caracteres, donde sufren los niños y los padres al no tener techo propio, gracias a la Alcaldia que ha hecho convenios con AFODENIC muy pronto complira con el sueño mas grande de su vida que es tener un techo digno para su familia.
texts.en:
Eliezer G. is married, 32 years old, and has two children. His son is in the third grade, while his daughter is not yet old enough for school. His wife doesn't have an official job, but earns extra money each week by offering washing and ironing services, and this money goes towards household expenses. Eliezer's salary goes toward loan repayments and other living expenses. Eliezer has worked for the Juigalpa Municipal Council for twelve years as a night watchman. He also receives a monthly voucher which the council awards to its workers, which helps him financially. This will be his second loan, and it will be used to continue construction on his home. With his first loan he built walls up to the height of the doors. With this loan he will buy the rest of the stones needed for construction, and perlines and zinc for the roof. Eliezer has shown that he is making a great effort to build a home and provide shelter to his wife and children. It is very sad to have to share a residence with other people who have different personalities, where the children and parents suffer for not having their own roof over their heads. Thanks to the agreement that the council has with AFODENIC, Eliezer will very soon fulfil the greatest dream of his life, which is to provide a good home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Yessica es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Yessica tiene una botica llamada Virgen del Carmen en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida concurrida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de un personal.
Yessica necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicinas y regalos.
Los sueños de Yessica son ahorrar para que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Yessica is a member of the Triunfo communal bank. Yessica is married, 36 years old and has 2 children. She has a pharmacy called "The Virgin of Carmen" in a rented storefront located on a busy avenue. She runs the pharmacy with the help of one worker. Yessica needs a loan for 2000 soles, which will be invested in buying medicines and gifts. Yessica dreams of being able to save so that her children can become professionals and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medicines and gifts.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Ali has been working as a livestock smallholder for nine years. He also sells milk. Ali requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase animal feed. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

His clients are his neighbors. Ali decided on doing his business because he always liked animals. In the future, he plans on improving his business in order to improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Atuganile A.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Atuganile M., a 28-year-old woman from Mbeya. She is married, and she has three children who are between the ages of 12 and 16. In addition, she is responsible for supporting two dependants who are orphans.

Since 2005, Atuganile has been operating a cosmetics shop. Specifically, she purchases cosmetics at wholesale prices and then sells the cosmetics at retail prices for a profit. She works at the business 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and she is assisted by one employee. Atuganile currently earns approximately $200 per month. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $625 in order to purchase a large quantity of cosmetics for her business. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Atuganile thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional cosmetics

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia T. is 46 years old. She is married with four children, two of whom are currently in school. One is in senior high school while the other is in junior high school. Two are working at the moment. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Elmina, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Cecilia works to support her husband financially. She is a trader and also runs a cold store. She procures fresh fish and meat from nearby big cold stores to stock her shop. Cecilia’s shop is located at the market square. She says she supplies the greatest percentage of her goods to food vendors. She also sells to retailers and other consumers. Cecilia has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: Procure food in bulk.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo B. is one of the farmers residing in the rural village of Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is married and blessed with six children: Three of them are high school graduates and some are still studying.  Because of financial problems, they could not afford to send their children to school since their income is just enough for the basic needs of their family.  

In this regard, Danilo wanted to increase his crop production by expanding his rice and vegetable farming.  For this, he is planning to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 16,000.00. The loan will also be used not only for his farming needs but also to restart his hog raising business which was stopped due to lack of financial support.  He believes that he will be able to increase his production and income and hopefully afford to send their children to school to pursue their college education.

loans.use: For farming needs

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат исполнилось 27 лет, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Работает совсем недавно и еще не имеет стабильного заработка. Муж в России и присылает денежные переводы. Кроме основного заработка также откармливает скот дома. В этом ей помогает мать ее мужа, которую вы видите на фотографии. Продает готовый к убою скоту младший братишка мужа. Полученная прибыль частью идет на расходы семьи, а другая на покупку нового бычка. Саодат собирается получить новый займ и потратить его на покупку бычка и корма для него.
texts.en:
Saodat turned 27 years old; she is married and has 2 children. She started working very recently and does not have a stable income yet. Her husband is in Russia and sends her money transfers. In addition to her main income she also fattens livestock at home. Her mother-in-law helps her with this and you can see her in the photograph. Her husband’s younger brother sells the livestock that is ready to be butchered. The revenues from this are partially used for family expenditures and partially for the purchase of a new bull. Saodat plans to get a new loan and to spend it on purchasing a bull and on its feed.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull and feed

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru:
Сангов Исматулло,  ему 47 лет, женат и имеет 6 детей. Предпринимательством занимается семь лет и на данный момент торгует овощами на центральном  рынке города Вахдат. У него много клиентов. Каждый день с ближайших районов приезжают клиенты, чтоб закупит у него товар. В его ассортименте разные сорта картофели, моркови, капуст и луков. 
Для увеличения ассортимента и товарооборота, хочет получить займ в сумме 1500 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ismatullo S. is 47 years old, married and has six children. Mr. S. has been working in sales for the last seven years and currently sells vegetables at the central market in the city of Vakhdat. He has a lot of steady clients. Every day clients come from neighboring areas to purchase produce from him. He mainly sells different types of potatoes, carrots, cabbage and onions. Mr. S. would like to expand his inventory and for this purpose he wants to take out a loan of 1500 somoni for the next 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of produce

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is already 58 years old. She sells native cakes (glutinous snacks) in their village of Barangay Divisoria, Santiago City. She is a mother with strong determination. She has been able to raise her children alone and sustain her family’s daily needs through her hard work and patience in vending her cook snacks. She says that she needs additional vending capital for her to gain bigger income in order to continue to support the schooling of her youngest daughter. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to KIVA lenders as financial assistance in her vending business. “This amount will already be a big help,” Hilda further said.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana K. is 32 years old. She is divorced and has one child, who is currently in school. She says selling women's lingerie is very profitable and, therefore, she has been selling lingerie by hawking for two years to support her child’s education. Diana wants to use the loan to buy bales of lingerie to increase her inventory and sales so she can increase her income. She believes this loan will help her save some money to travel to Togo and other parts of the world to buy her stock. Diana hawks and treks to sell her goods.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is single. She is a small-scale entrepreneur from Melitopol where she runs a business selling household items in the central marketplace. Nadezhda offers a nice selection of merchandise at her kiosk, which is located in a very favorable location. She has been running this venture for over 10 years. Vending experience and additional funding have helped Nadezhda’s business grow and expand. Presently, she has about 15,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her net monthly profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas.

Nadezhda is requesting a loan of 11,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital and generate additional income. She enjoys running her small business and is very grateful to her friends who encouraged her to start her business many years ago and have been very helpful ever since. Nadezhda can be characterized as a very diligent and hard-working entrepreneur. We believe her strive for further expansion of her trade and determined attitude will help her repay the current loan and achieve sucess in her business endeavors.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn A. is 42 years old and is the mother of three children. Her business is rice farming and what she does on her farm is help her husband till the land and sow quality rice seeds for an abundant harvest. Currently, they are tilling a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm. While waiting for the harvest, she is also planting vegetables in their backyard.

Rosalyn would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. The loan will be used to buy two bags of complete fertilizer and four bags of urea fertilizer.

Because she has already transplanted their rice seedlings, she hopes that by buying the fertilizers it will help increase their yield.

loans.use: To purchase two bags of complete fertilizer and four bags of urea

loans.name: Angela Juana

texts.es: La señora Ángela Juana Chávez tiene 48 años de edad, ella posee un negocio que es una pulpería. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, además de poseer este negocio trabaja como maestra de primaria lo cual le genera un ingreso extra a su a hogar, es madre de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 lograron coronar sus carreras y el tercero está estudiando, con la ayuda de su esposo ambos  han logrado salir adelante la señora está solicitando este financiamiento para aumentar su variedad de productos ella vive de manera humilde y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angela is 48 years old. She owns a grocery business. This business is located in her house. In addition to this business she works as a primary school teacher This job generates extra income for her and her home. She is the mother of three children, two that have their own careers. The third one is a student. With the help of her husband, the couple has been able to progress. She is asking for a loan to increase the variety of products that she carries in her store. She lives simply and has all her basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena owns a restaurant where she sells cooked food and drinks. She has been in the business since 1988. She is 51 years old and divorced with 4 children. She is hoping for a loan of N60000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks all of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drinks to sell

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 50 años, es una madre muy alegre, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Víctor D. 76 años y sus 2 hijas gemelas: Maria Rosario y Maria Angélica D. 10 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. El negocio D. venta D. frutas que tiene Paula le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, junto a su triciclo sale todas las mañanas a vender las deliciosas frutas que compró en el mercado mayorista, ella venD. en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donD. se realizan ferias en la ciudad D. Juliaca). Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en la calle bajo los sofocantes rayos solares. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda D. abarrotes donD. pueda vender con más comodidad y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Este es el cuarto préstamo D. Paula con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto D. todos los acuerdos a los que lleguen en su grupo. Con los mil setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más frutas para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad para escoger.
texts.en:
Paula is 50 year old. She is a happy mother of two twin girls age 10, Maria Rosario and Maria Angelica. They live together with Paula's husband Victor, who is 76. Paula wants to proviD. her girls with a good life. Paula's business selling fruit has provided the income she needs to help proviD. for her family. On her bike and wagon, she heads out every morning to sell the delicious fruit she has purchased wholesale. She sells the fruit in a marketplace in the city of Juliaca. What she enjoys most about her work is the chance to talk with other vendors in the market. Paula has had this business for 10 years, and the most difficult part is working all day under the hot sun. In the future, she hopes to have a small grocery shop where she can sell under more comfortable conditions and increase her income. This is the fourth loan for Paula with MFP, and she knows the importance of making the payments on time. In her communal bank, she always complies with the agreements maD. by her group. With the money from this loan, she will purchase more fruit so that she can offer her customers a greater variety from which to choose.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 37 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en la casa de su madre. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a la siembra de papas, arvejas, maíz y habas. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dedicarle el mayor tiempo a sus cultivos, puesto que gracias a sus cuidados sus siembras le dan bueno resultados, sobre todo las arvejas que no necesitan de mucha inversión y de las cuales cosecha hasta tres veces. 

Después de recolectar sus productos los lleva al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde los vende al mejor postor, terminando su venta en menos de 20 minutos. Luego regresa muy contenta a su casa por las ventas realizadas y con esas ganancias compra los comestibles para su hogar, para todo el mes, ya que ella sola mantiene a su madre anciana y a su hijo estudiante.

Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y durantes los anteriores ciclos de préstamos demostró puntualidad; asimismo, para éste, renueva su compromiso. María también está muy satisfecha porque en su banco comunal se les incentiva al ahorro. Con el dinero del crédito piensa comprar fertilizantes químicos y una bolsa de arvejas para sembrar.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en: Kaku M. is currently in the business of buying and selling fish and is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her dried fish. Kaku is 30 years old and is married to a policeman. She has six children and her children go to school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase industrial products and plough to grow peanuts

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely V. C. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin. She is 33 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Emely owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Emely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Emely is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Carla es una socia emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 20 años de edad, cuenta con estudios de Contabilidad y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza desde su casa.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas” y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que fueron utilizados en la compra de productos de belleza.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà prendas de vestir para la venta a sus clientes y amistades.
La meta de Carla es terminar sus estudios de Contabilidad y tener una tienda de artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Carla is a hardworking member who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 20 years old and is studying accounting, and she dedicates herself to the sale of beauty products, an activity that she does from her home. She is part of the Tigers Community Bank and her first loan was for 300 PEN which was used in the purchase of beauty products. Currently she needs a credit of 800 PEN with which she will buy clothes to sell to her clients and acquaintances. Carla's goal is to finish her accounting studies and have a store with home goods.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothing for men and women

loans.name: El Tucán Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Tucan está integrado por Digmara, Luz Marina, Yaritza y Yamil. Ellos son personas muy trabajadoras que desean salir adelante y velar por el bienestar de sus familias.

Digmara comenzó hace cuatro años a echar tortilla en esa epoca contaba con lo mínimos recursos ahora le a proporcionado una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Mientra su compañera Luz Marina vende verduras en el mercado oriental, Yaritza vende nacatamales y Yamil vende frutas en Masaya.
texts.en:
The El Tucan group is made up of Digmara, Luz Marina, Yaritza and Yamil. They are hard-working people who want to progress and ensure the welfare of their families. Digmara began making tortillas four years ago. At that time he had few resources and now he has been able to give his family a better quality of life. His partner Luz Marina sells vegetables in the Mercado Oriental market. Yaritza sells nacatamales and Yamil sells fruit in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida, 45 years old, is a rice farmer. She owns a farm that she hopes could provide her family enough income to buy adequate food and clothing and fulfill other basic needs. She has six children. She wishes that some day she will be able to buy more farms to be able to support all her family needs. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy farming necessities to grow her harvest.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Tsogjargal

texts.en: Tsogjargal is 33 years old and lives with his wife and twin children in a house in Arhangai province, Mongolia. His twin children attend a local secondary school. He operates a meat trading business with the help of his wife at a local market. He is responsible for purchasing and transporting meat and livestock from the countryside and his wife is responsible for selling. They sell a variety of meat to her customers at a stall in the local market. Tsogjargal started his business in 1998. His business currently operates at a stable level and he continues to make progress. He hopes to grow his business in the future and his continued success is very important, as he must support his family. He is requesting a 4,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase more meat in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Angel de 32 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Andrea Marin con quien procreó 2 hijos menores, habita junto a su familia en la Comarca Carquita del municipio de La Libertad, Chontales, es un pequeño productor que se dedica a la siembra de granos basicos, ademas al cuido de sus 3 vaquitas, de quienes obtiene leche para el consumo de la casa.  Miguel esta solicitando su primer credito con el objetivo de establecer cultivo de maiz y frijol, el que comercializara y le permitira obtener mayores ingresos que le ayudarian a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa  quien le ayudan a la siembra y cuido de la tierra, ademas con la experiencia necesaria para este trabajo, pues desde muy pequeño ha trabajado la tierra.
texts.en:
Miguel is 32 years old and is married to Andrea. They have two children and live with his family in “Comarca Carquita del municipio de La Libertad, Chontales.” He is a small farmer and raises basic grains. He also tends his three cows, from which he gets milk. Manuel is asking for this loan in order to establish a crop of corn and beans, which he will sell. This will allow him to increase his income, and improve his family’s living conditions. He has the full support of his wife, who helps him with the planting and tending of the land. He has been farming since he was a boy.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising beans and corn

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios D., 58, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Victoriano D., a businessman, and they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She sells packed cold cuts of meats and a popular brand of cured ham, and also sells condiments like soy sauce, vinegar and fish sauce.

Remedios has been a regular member of Kiva field partner the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends CCT's weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s Cooperative.

Now she has applied for a 12,000 Philippine peso loan. She plans to use this money to buy more meat and condiments to sell.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education, so that they will grow up to have stable jobs and settle down to have families of their own. She also envisions adding an additional floor on to her house.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more meat and condiments for resale.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a single 28-year-old woman who lives with her mother. She learned her hairdressing and beauty trade in an academic school in her town. In 2000, she opened her beauty shop and started to make a profit. She helps her mother, who owns a small lingerie shop, to make a good income and meet the heavy expenses of life. Malak caters to a wide range of clientele in her village and its neighborhoods, and a good number of clients visit her shop because of the good service she offers.
Today, Malak plans to offer a new beauty service to her customers and so she wants to buy a tattoo machine. She needs to borrow $1,200 USD, and is certain that her business productivity and income will both increase as a result of this loan.

loans.use: To buy a tattoo machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more nipa and weaving materials

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 32 years old and married with two children who go to school. She sells polythene (plastic) papers in her hometown to earn a living.  She also practices farming in her hometown to earn a living.  She was previously employed in a horticulture company before she started this business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, her business has grown because she can access loans. She hopes to expand her business and stabilize her income in the future.  She has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of polythene papers for sale.

loans.use: To buy more polythene papers to sell

loans.name: Patron San Jeronimo Ii Group

texts.es:
“El banco comunal Patrón San Jerónimo II de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la  Asociación Arariwa está en el ciclo 10 de funcionamiento".

Sofía nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Patrón San Jerónimo II” somos 13 integrantes (10 mujeres y 3 varones). Las reuniones son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa sede Cusco y en esta oportunidad  me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi principal actividad económica. "El banco comunal es bueno porque me ayudan a ahorrar dinero y me dan charlas de gestión financiera”.

Sofía, tiene 45 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos (Mariela de 22 años y Vanesa de 19 años), su esposo es chofer de la línea de carros “Nueva Chaska”  y Sofía trabaja como cobradora  de pasajes en el carro. Su actividad económica complementaria es cosechar y sembrar maíz. Ya son 22 años que se dedica a los negocios y le va muy bien.  Ella requiere para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.  Su sueño es sacar profesional a su segunda hija  y construir  su casa de material noble.   

La mayoría de los socios son comerciantes por ejemplo algunos se dedican a las ventas de comestible, panes, cosméticos, ropa, golosinas, anticuchos, queso, tarjetas y otros socios brindan servicios  de transportes, mecánica, cocina y guía de turismo.  
	
Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.
texts.en:
“Asociación Arariwa’s Micro Finances Unit’s Patrón San Jerónimo II communal bank is in its 10th operational cycle” Sofía tells us: In my “Patrón San Jerónimo II” communal bank we are 13 members (10 women and 3 men). The meetings take place every 30 days in Asociación Arariwa’s central offices, Cusco branch. On this occasion I was elected communal bank representative to give my testimony regarding my main commercial activity. “The communal bank is good because they help me save money and they give financial operations chats.” Sofía, 45, is married and has two children (Mariela, 22, and Vanesa, 19). Her husband is a driver for the “Nueva Chaska” transportation company and Sofía works as his fare collector. Her complementary commercial activity is corn farming. She has been in these lines of work for 22 years now and she does well. She wants to buy seed and fertilizers. Her dream is to see her second daughter become a professional and to build her house with substantial materials. Most of the other group members are merchants. For example: they sell food, bread, cosmetics, clothing, sweets, anticuchos (skewered grilled meats), cheese, cards; some members provide transportation, auto mechanic, and cooking and tourism guide services. Cusco is a city that is known for its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and its history; it is an enchanting city in the south of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand A. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de oro City. He is 31 years old and married with three school-aged children. He runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products. Ferdinand has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ferdinand joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to invest in expanding the business. He is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Ferdinand from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and build a stock of soybeans

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: Sabino, de 39 años, es un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Verónica de 41 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con el apoyo de su esposa, Sabino ha logrado que sus chacras se vuelvan muy fértiles y productivas. Y esto se debe a que todos los días trabajan juntos en sus tierras, haciendo que sus cultivos cada vez sean mejores. Durante la temporada de cosecha, se dispone a llevar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde generalmente recibe muy buena paga. Lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus arvejas y papas, y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar sus cultivos, hasta el lugar donde los vende. Con el tiempo, espera poner un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado para su esposa, de esa manera podrá aumentar sus ganancias si vende su propia producción. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos que tienen en su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja y papa, ya que estos son los productos que mejor se están vendiendo.
texts.en:
Sabina is 39 years old and the father of a simple and hardworking family. He lives in his own house with his wife, Veronica who is 41, and his two dear children, for whom he wants to provide a better life. With the support of his wife, Sabino’s farms have become very fertile and productive. And this is because everyday they work together on their land, making their crops better each time. During the harvest season, they prepare to bring their products to the wholesale market in the town of Tarma, where they usually get paid well. He has been doing this for 21 years and what he likes best about his job is growing his peas and potatoes. He believes that the hardest part is having to transport their crops to the place where they are sold. Over time, he hopes to put a small selling post at the market for his wife, that way they can increase profits by selling their own production. This is his ninth MFP loan. He has been very punctual in his previous loans and expects to be again. In his community group he is a very responsible partner and is always aware of the agreements they have in their group. With the 1500 soles he is requesting, he will buy pea and potato seeds since these are the the products that are selling.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea and potato seeds

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah S. is currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread (tamia and gelabia) at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour. Sarah is 39 years old and married to a peasant. She has four children and three of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a small restaurant. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice G., photographed with one of her children, is from the town of Baclayon. She is 27 years old, married and has 4 young children. Janice owns and operates a business providing waste management and motorcycle transport services. Janice works hard to save for her children's education.

Janice joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janice is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Janice from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah L. sells cosmetics by moving from one area to another at Takoradi. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics to sell. She hopes to build a shop for her business, should there be any form of increase in her sales.

Sarah has received senior high education. She is married to a mason and lives with him and their two children. She is responsible by supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret N. M. is sixty years old. She is single and has one child aged forty years old. Her business location is in Nairobi and is well known by the name Ebenezer. She owns a beauty shop in which she has been selling cosmetics to the women. She has been in this business for three years and has managed to employ two people. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more cosmetics to meet the demand of her clients. In future, she hopes to be a wholesaler. She describes herself as aggressive and ambitious.

loans.use: Cosmetics

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy U. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Levy is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Levy owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling of bananas in the local community. Levy has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Levy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Levy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Levy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Angela Maritza

texts.es: Ángela Maritza vive en una zona muy poblada, no está casada pero ha salido adelante con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos que ofrece diferentes productos como pinturas de uñas, pintura de labios, tratamientos, polvos y cepillos para el cabello su negocio lo inicio hace mas de 2 años, poco a poco ha venido trabajando con ayuda de Dios y las personas que la quieren. Para tener más ganancias y tener otro estilo de ingresos ella también les brinda consejos a sus clientes de cómo aplicarse sus productos. Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo materia prima pues actualmente tiene bastante pedidos. En el futuro quiere su negocio sea más grande para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Ángela Maritza lives in a populated area.  She is not married, but she has managed to get ahead with her child.  She sells cosmetics, offering a variety of products such as nail polish, lipstick, treatments, powders and hairbrushes.  She started her business more than 2 years ago, and this has gradually given her an occupation, thanks to God and the people who care for her.  To have more income and another means of making money, she also provides advice to her customers on how to apply their products.  With this loan, she wants to buy merchandise, since she currently has sufficient orders.  In the future, she wants her business to be bigger so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: working capital to buy beauty products

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik G. has been living in Germany for the last 15 years. A year ago he returned to Armenia to attend his father’s funeral and decided to stay in Armenia. Andranik decided to start production of cleaning lint rollers for clothing and soft upholstery. Some parts for the rollers come from China, and the others are ordered locally. 

At first Andranik was using pure ABS plastic material for the stamped parts. Then he started using recycled material, which is much cheaper and increased the profit margin to 60%. Andranik delivers the rollers to more than 30 stores. The highest demand for the rollers is during late autumn and winter, when people wear woolen clothing. Andranik has applied for the loan to order some roll parts from China, to receive the goods in 2-3 weeks and start the production before the peak season.

loans.use: ordering parts for his lint rollers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del banco comunal “Con Fuerza y Unión” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó. Ella se dedica a la pastelería, en su casa desde hace 7 años. Sus principales productos son pie de limón, queque de manzana y plátano, pan amasado y tortillas entre otros, los cuales vende por pedidos. Además María trabaja como asistente de educación en un colegio. 
Con este préstamo comprará ingredientes. Su sueño es dejar su trabajo dependiente para dedicarse 100% a la pastelería,  sin embargo este sueño lo está postergando hasta que sus hijos de 24 y 17 años terminen sus estudios superiores. El mayor estudia arquitectura en la universidad y el menor, cuando salga del colegio, a los 18, iniciará también sus estudios universitarios.
María agradece a Fondo Esperanza por confiar en ella al entregarle los préstamos y también  le motiva mucho la unidad de su grupo.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de una belleza mágicamente natural
texts.en:
María is a part of the “Con Fuerza y Unión” [“With Strength and Unity”] communal bank in the city of Curicó. She has worked as a baker from her home for the past 7 years. Her main products are lemon pie, apple and banana cake, kneaded bread and Spanish tortillas, among others. She sells them by order. María also works as an educational assistant in a school.
She will buy ingredients with this loan. Her dream is to leave her job as an assistant to devote 100% of her time to baking, but she is holding off on this dream until her children, ages 24 and 17, finish college. The oldest studies architecture at the university. The youngest will also begin college once he finishes high school at 18.
María thanks Fondo Esperanza for trusting her by giving her loans. She is also very encouraged by the unity of her group. 
Curicó is located in the Maule region, the central area of the country. The climate in Curicó is Mediterranean-like and is considered one of the most pleasant in Chile. Curicó is also characterized by its wine culture and the magical natural beauty of the surrounding area.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara R., age 46, is a cattle breeder. She sells dairy products for a living and earns approximately 3,900 soms per month. Her husband works as a security guard at the local school. They live in Karabalta. Together they have brought up five sons: the eldest is married and lives separately with his family, two sons are working in Russia, and the two younger sons are students. 

Dinara hopes to obtain a loan to help her to purchase coal for heating during the winter season. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds a triple bottom line: 
- People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
- Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and 
- Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase coal for heating during the winter

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: El señor Pedro Jose H., es un hombre de 51 años, casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio de las frutas y verduras, él es agricultor y cuenta con una experiencia de mas de 30 años, en los que se ha enfrentado a robos de cosechas que afectan su economia para nuevas inveriosnes en su negocio que le permitan mejorar sus niveles economicos, fue gracias a la Reforma Agraria que lograron adquirir su terrenos de siembra, y es para su negocio que solicita un prestamo para la compra fungicidas y fertilizantes, que aporten un optimo Mantenimiento Fito Sanitario, que mejore su produccion incremente sus ventas, y permita la remodelaciopn del piso y techo de su hogar, para habitar en un lugar digno y comodo sus dias de retiro.
texts.en: Pedro Jose H. is 51 years old, married, and his wife sells fruits and vegetables. He is a farmer with more than 30 years' experience, during which time he has dealt with people robbing the harvest, and that has affected his economic position for investing in his business and reaching new financial levels. It was thanks to Kiva partner Reforma Agraria that they were able to get their farm fields, and it is for his business that he is requesting a loan to purchase fungicides and fertilizers that contribute to optimal maintenance of healthy crops, which will improve his production and increase his sales. This will allow him to remodel the floor and ceiling in his house so he can live in a dignified and comfortable place during his retirement.

loans.use: Crop maintenance

loans.name: Atilio

texts.es:
Don Atilio, es un señor dinámico, administra su tienda donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, tiene 64 años de edad, vive con su esposa y residen en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, el negocio lo tienen desde hace 10 años y lo administran juntos invirtiendo en productos que son demandados por los clientes.
Don Atilio desea comprar productos para la tienda y solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión, comprara arroz, aceite, mayonesa, pan de barra, pollo, pastas y condimentos, con esta ayudara surtirá el negocio y mejorara su servicio a la clientela que a  diario le solicitan productos para preparar alimentos.
Él quiere cancelar este préstamo puntualmente, así como también realizar una buena inversión al negocio que logre estabilizar los ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de él  y su esposa.
texts.en:
Atilio is a dynamic gentleman.  He runs a store where he sells essentials.  He is 64 years old and lives with his wife in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  He and his wife have had their business for 10 years and they run it together, investing in products that their customers are asking for.

Atilio would like to buy products for his store and he is requesting a loan so that he can make this investment.  He will buy rice, oil, mayonnaise, baguettes, chicken, pasta and condiments.  This will help him to stock his business and improve his service to his customers who visit his store every day requesting products to prepare their meals with.

Atilio would like to pay back his loan on time and also make a good investment in his business that will enable him to stabilize his income and improve  his wife's quality of life as well as his own.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, mayonnaise, baguettes, chicken, pasta and condiments

loans.name: Kiek's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of seventeen members who live in Preaek Kong Reach village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kiek P., 56 years old, has been selected village bank president by the members. All members of this village group will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Kiek P. and her husband, Mr. Chea Siek, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice for a living. They don’t have enough money to continue farming, so Mrs. Kiek P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to cultivate rice. This couple currently doesn’t have any children living with them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and gasoline to cultivate rice

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
el grupo Nuevo Amanecer esta integrado por 3 mujeres, viven en la colonia Nuevos Colorados y son mujeres luchadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, a continuacion se detallan las actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Lilian R. tiene 36 años de edad y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, vende su
producto en su misma comunidad y en varios lugares cercanos a su casa de habitacion.
todos los dias se levanta a las 4:30 de la mañana para empezar su produccion, tambien hace golosinas y las vende a los trabajadores de varias plantaciones cercanas.
Lilian trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, cal, leña y agua.


   Olga Marina M. tiene 26 años de edad y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, las distribuye a gran parte en la colonia donde vive y las demas las hace en las plantaciones de ocra ya que tambien tiene una buena clientela en ese lugar.
se levanta todos los dias a las 4 de la mañana para producir todos los pedidos de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña y cal.

la joven Mirian S. tiene 25 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años, su producto lo distribuye en las a varios comedores de la ciudad de Choluteca, le hacen pedidos a diario.
 trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante a su hija.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, cal, leña y agua.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Amanecer" group comprises three women, who live in the Nuevos Colorados neighbourhood. They are all very hardworking and determined to succeed.

Lilian R. is 36 years old. Her job involves making and selling tortillas, which she sells in her neighbourhood and other areas close to home. She gets up every day at 04:30 to begin making the tortillas. She also makes sweets, which she sells to workers at various nearby farms. Lilian works very hard to provide for her two children. She will use the loan to buy corn, mineral lime, wood and water. 

Olga Marina M. is 26 years old. Her job also involves making and selling tortillas, most of which she sells in her neighbourhood. She sells the remaining amount at the nearby okra farms, where she also has good customers. She gets up every day at 04:00, to prepare the orders requested by her clients. She will use the loan to buy corn, wood and mineral lime. 

Mirian S. is 25 years old. She too works making and selling tortillas. She has been involved in this business for three years. She sells her products to various restaurants in the city of Choluteca, which request her tortillas on a daily basis. She works very hard to provide for her daughter. She will similarly use the loan to purchase corn, mineral lime, wood and water.

loans.use: To purchase corn, mineral lime, wood, and water.

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es: Amancio, es un hombre trabajador de 44 años; que junto a su esposa Rina y sus 6 hijos conforman una hermosa familia. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Pongo. La perseverancia es la principal virtud que tiene, trabaja durante la noche desde hace 5 meses en una empresa privada, que se dedica a la realización de una hidroeléctrica. Aportando de esa manera un dinero extra a su hogar. “Cuando me dedicaba solamente a la agricultura, tenía ingresos escasos”, afirma.  Amancio, tiene 30 años sembrando lechuga, papa y una variedad de hortalizas. Todas las mañanas se dedica a su cuidado y fertilización, pues trabaja sin descanso, para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y verlos convertidos en personas capaces y profesionales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder negociar sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, pues ahí; ve reflejado la recompensa de un arduo trabajo.  Él pertenece al banco comunal “Paraíso al progreso”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente feliz de poder pertenecer a una asociación responsable y comprometida. Amancio, dentro de muy pronto cosechará lechuga, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, que oscila entre los S/. 600 soles cada uno, los cuales esparcirá en sus terrenos de cultivo que muy pronto cosechará, asimismo desea comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Amancio, is a 44 year old worker; who with his wife Rina and their 6 children form a lovely family. They live together in their own home, located in the village of Pongo. Perserverance is his key virtue, he has been working during the night for the last 5 months for a private company, whose business is in the hydroelectric field. He brings in extra money for his household by this means. “When I only work in agriculture, I only have limited income”, he states.  Amancio, has for 30 years grown lettuce, potato and a variety of vegetables. Every morning is focused on their care and fertilization, as he works without rest, to be able to get his children ahead and see them grow into capable and professional people. What he likes the most about his work is to be able to trade his harvests at the wholesaler market in the city, as there; he sees the reward for his hard work.  He belongs to the “Paraíso al progreso” communal bank, and this is the third loan he has had with MFP, and where he feels happy to be able to belong to a responsible and committed association. Amancio, will very shortly be harvesting his lettuce, and with the loan he is thinking of buying 2 bags of pea seeds, which cost about S/. 600 soles each, which he will scatter on his farm land which will soon be harvested. He also wants to buy several sacks of organic fertilzer.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of pea seeds, and sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Akouvi  Vicé

texts.fr: Madame  Akouvi  est mariée et   a  4 enfants.  Elle  habite  quartier  Nukafu  et  est  âgée  de  39 ans.  Pour améliorer  les  conditions  de vie de ces enfants, elle  fait la  vente  de   beignets fris dans l'huile.  Elle a  commencé  en 2000 et  achète  les  ingrédients  au marché de  Nukafu où elle revend.  Elle sollicite un prêt  pour  acheter  2 sacs de  farine, 2  sacs de  sucre et 2 Bidons  d’huile. La dame en question est celle qui  est assise entrait de fris le beignet.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi, age 39, is married and has 4 children. She lives in the Nukafu neighborhood. To improve the standard of living of her children, she sells doughnuts fried in oil. She started this business in 2000, and buys her ingredients at the market in Nukafu, where she sells her doughnuts. She's seeking a loan to buy 2 sacks of flour, 2 sacks of sugar, and 2 cans of oil.

In the picture, she's the one sitting and frying doughnuts.

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of flour, 2 sacks of sugar, and 2 cans of oil.

loans.name: Maylene

texts.en:
Maylene F. is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 24 years old. Maylene is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Maylene owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Maylene has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP whenever she sells her raised hog.

In 2011, Maylene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maylene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to build shelter for her pigs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maylene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to build a shelter for her pigs

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en: Wennie is a married woman who lives in Toledo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Jose, who is 54 years old, works as a Brgy. Captain to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 25 and 27 years old. Wennie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Wennie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to buy a stock of drinks, canned items and plain food items so that she can continue to save up for future education of her grandchildren. Wennie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like drinks, canned items and plain food items to sell

loans.name: Isaias

texts.en:
Isaias C. is from the village of Guingona Ozamiz City. He is 33 years old. Isaias is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Isaias owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting squash for sale. Isaias has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Isaias joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isaias is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Isaias from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches   covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Mrs. Nget was born in 1969. She is a shoe-making laborer who earns some money to support her family. Her husband is a government worker. Currently, she has an obstacle because her husband’s work place is far away from their house. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Nget would like to seek a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorcycle for transport. She is a mother of three children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory; the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Rosiris Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosiris M.  de 46 años vive en el barrio La Luz, al sur de la ciudad, allí se dedica a la venta de mercancías que compra de manera diversa de acuerdo a los encargos que le hacen sus clientes y también ofrece otros productos  a través de guías especializadas  o catálogos, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 22 y 25 años, con los que tiene el propósito de continuar educando hasta que alcancen su éxito. Ella inició hace 3 años su negocio con un capital que le regaló su hermana y desde aquí ha puesto todo su empeño en hacerlo crecer, como hasta la presente lo ha hecho. En la actualidad vende a habitantes del sector y a empleados de empresas mediante el sistema de crédito, acordando con sus clientes la  forma de pago y presentando buenos indicadores financieros. Este es su tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización con la que tiene tres años de estar vinculada; con sus créditos ha logrado ampliar su capital de trabajo y ensanchar la cobertura de sus clientes así como lograr la diversificación de su oferta, su desafío mayor es el capital de trabajo que aún no es suficiente para multiplicar sus clientes, por eso recurre a su credikiva con el cual surtirá su negocio con mercancía alusiva al dia de la madre como cubrelechos, ropa femenina, billeteras, calzado, cosméticos etc.
texts.en: Rosiris M. is 46 years old and lives in the La Luz nieghborhood to the south of the city.  There, she makes her living selling varius goods in accordance with her customers' orders.  She also offers other products for sale through specialized guides and catalogs.  Rosiris is married and has two children who are 22 and 25 years old.  She intends to continue their educations until they meet their goals.  Rosiris started her business 3 years ago with capital given to her by her sister.  Since then she has put all her effort into growing the business, which until now she has been able to do.  She currently uses a credit system to make sales to the residents in her area and to company employees.  She and her customers agree on a form a payment and good financial indicators.  This is Rosiris's third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which she has been connected for three years.  With her loans, she has managed to increase both her working capital and her customers' coverage.  She has also been able to diversify her sales items.  Rosiris's main challenge is that of working capital, which is still insufficient to dramatically increase her customer base.  That is why she is turning to a credikiva loan, with which she will stock up on merchandise for Mother's Day, like bedspreads, women's clothing, wallets, footwear, cosmetics, etc.

loans.use: to purchase bedspreads, women's clothing, wallets, footwear and cosmetics

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es: Epifanio, de 45 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, convive con Juana de 48 años padres de 04 hijos, quienes conforman la felicidad de su hogar y viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de Vista Alegre Baja. Epifanio es un hombre trabajador, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno en donde cultiva cacao, café y barbasco plantas que con mucho esfuerzo consiguió tornarlas muy productivas. Son 20 años de trabajo continuo por lo que lo ha convertido en una persona con mucha experiencia. Sin embargo sabe que este trabajo es arduo, así es que debe contratar jornaleros cuando es temporada de cosecha y limpieza de sus campos. La cantidad de frutos que recolecta son llevados a las empresas acopiadoras, en donde le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo que vende. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos quienes se encargan de dañar los frutos de las plantas. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras ya que no cuenta con espacios para seguir sembrando. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y se compromete seguir aportando sus cuotas puntualmente como en los anteriores créditos, agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por elegirle como presidente de la junta directiva. Con el crédito solicitado comprará plantas de cacao para luego sembrarlos de manera tecnificada.
texts.en:
Epifanio is 45 years old and from the city of Quimbiri.  He lives with his partner, 48 year-old Juana, and the couple have four children who bring happiness to their home.  They live in their own home, in the community of Vista Alegre Baja.

Epifanio is a hard-working man who puts a lot of care into the work that he does.  He is a farmer.  He owns four hectares of land where he grows cacao, coffee and barbasco plants which, through a lot of effort, he has managed to make very productive.
