Manuel is fifty-two years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (a suburban area that used to have hills, streams, and lagoons you can still see the remains of--like an ecological area that is disintegrating). He has a small vegetable stand in Duran. Before he had his vegetable stand, he lived in the mountain's of Ecuador, but because of lack of opportunities, he decided to move to Duran with his four children and wife. His vegetable stand has helped him support his family. All of this time he has worked everyday from sunrise to sunset. In order to get more vegetables and customers he wants to buy legumes and vegetables for his business with the loan. He would like to have his own business in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Legumes,vegetables

loans.name: Cira

texts.fr: Madame Cira N. est une femme de 38 ans qui habite à Guediawaye. Elle est membre de la caisse du centre de sauve garde de Pikine  depuis avril 2010. Elle évolue  depuis plus de 7 ans dans le secteur de la  restauration.  Elle vend le petit déjeuner  et le dimer dans le quartier ou elle habite. Elle a choisi cette activité  car elle a le gout de la cuisine comme toute bonne saint-louisienne  qu’elle est. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs pour renforcer son restaurant. Son objectif est de mieux rentabiliser son activité, accroitre ses bénéfices  pour pouvoir prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses 2 enfants mais aussi augmenter son  niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Ms. Cira N. is a 38-year-old woman who lives in Guediawaye. She has been a member of the credit association at the Pikine youth center since April 2010. She has been in the restaurant sector for over seven years. Cira sells breakfasts and dinners in the district where she lives. She chose this business because she likes to cook, as does any good person from Saint-Louis such as herself. Cira is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for bolstering her restaurant. Her goal is to make her business more profitable and to increase her profits, so as to cover the schooling costs of her two children but also to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her funds

loans.name: Dymfa

texts.en: Dymfa M. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 33 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Dymfa owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale and has been engaged in her business for over seven years. She wishes to be successful in her business. Dymfa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Dymfa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sahadatou

texts.fr: M. Sahadatou est née le 13 Octobre 1961 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Depuis près de quarante ans, Sahadatou vit au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Sahadatou est mariée à SADIKOU Salami et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Il y a environs trente ans que Sahadatou vend des draps, des rideaux et des foulards à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à faire face à ses différentes charges. Sahadatou achète ses produits à Lomé au Togo, et aussi au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Sahadatou sollicite un concours financier auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de plus en plus grandissante de sa clientèle.Sahadatou a bien remboursé son premier crédit.
texts.en:
Sahadatou M. was born 13 October 1961 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. For the past 40 years, Sahadatou lived in the Kpondéhou borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Salami Sadikou and is the mother of three children, all attending (or having attended) school. The couple share the handling of family expenses. Some thirty years ago Sahadatou began the retail sales of sheets, drapes and scarves in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. This revenue-generating activity helped her meet her financial responsibilities. She gets her products from Lomé in Togo and also from Nigeria, a country neighbouring Benin. This is the second time Sahadatou is requesting financial support from ALIDé, seeking to strengthen her activity and respond to the ever-increasing demands of her customers. Sahadatou has fully reimbursed her first loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheets, drapes, scarves, etc.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 60 years old and is married with seven children aged between 9 to 40 years. He has no other dependents. He lives in his own home with his family in Hoima, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children.

Lawrence has been in the textile business for forty years. He started by being a tailor and then saved money and started his own business. He has no major hardships in his business and in future he wants to start a wholesale shop. He wants the loan to purchase clothing material for his business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing material for his business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha B. is from the town of Veruela. She is 48 years old. Editha is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Editha owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. Editha also runs a sari-sari (general) store where she sells a variety of different products.

Editha joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Editha is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional store inventory. This will be the second loan taken out by Editha from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and additional store inventory

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald P. is from the village of Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 27 years old. Gerald is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Gerald owns & operates a business buying and selling daily use products in the local community. He primarily sells "hypo", which is used for cleaning tiles on sinks and in bathrooms, and a very good stain remover for dresses. Gerald has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gerald joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerald is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP. which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gerald from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nelly Angelica

texts.es:
Nelly de 55 años,  vende ropa que confecciona, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Suburbio” caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.  

Cuando su esposo falleció ella tubo que hacerse cargo de sus dos hijos pero como no tenia suficiente dinero decidió invertir sus últimos ahorros en telas y una maquina de coser para confeccionar pantalones, camisas. Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo vender la ropa que ella mismo hacia. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 08h30am vendiendo su propia ropa. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas para hacer mas ropa y venderlas. En el futuro quiere tener su negocio de ropa bien surtido y que sus hijos tengan éxito en el ámbito profesional.
texts.en: Nelly is 55 years old and sells clothing that she makes.  She lives in an urban area called "Suburbio," characterized by the fact that the majority of its inhabitants are informal vendors.  When her husband passed away, she had to take full responsibility of her two children but since she didn't have enough money, she decided to invest her last bit of savings in fabric and a sewing machine to make pants and shirts.  Little by little and with a lot of effort, she was able to sell the clothes that she made.  Since then and even now, she begins work at 8:30am selling her clothes.  With her loan, she wants to purchase, more fabric in order to make more clothes to sell.  In the future, she dreams of have her clothing business well-stocked and her children being successful in the professional world.

loans.use: Purchase fabric.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith A. is 31 years old, separated from her spouse and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Villa Verde within the barangay of Balulang, a part of Cagayan de Oro City, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Bernadith runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Bernadith has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Bernadith joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Madalena Filipa

texts.pt:
NB: nao foi possivel tirar a foto no local de trabalho devido a Distancia.

Madalena Filipa L. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, sul de Moçambique separada e mãe de 2 filhos de 16 e 18 anos de idade, ambos vão a Escola. Fez 9ª classe parou quando se casou. Vive na casa própria sozinha porque os filhos vivem com o pai e tem enviado alguma ajuda para as crianças.

Saiu de Maputo para Matola onde havia construído sua própria residência. Tem um negócio próprio de venda de roupa usada diversa ha mais de 20 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado, consegue em media um rendimento de cerca de 2.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar de vez enquanto porque faz o melhoramento da sua casa.

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos e pagou sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga vizinha que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para aplicar mais no seu negócio e com os lucros concluir as melhorias na sua casa.
texts.en:
Note: It was not possible to take the photo at the place of business owing to distance.

Madalena Filipa L. was born in the city of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is separated and has two children aged 16 and 18.  Both children go to school.  Madalena finished ninth grade but quit school when she got married.  She has her own house and lives alone because her children live with their father, and she sends money to help with the children.

She left Maputo for Matola, where she had built her own home.  For more than 20 years she has had a business selling assorted used clothing.  She has no employees and earns around 2,500 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses.  She also saves some from time to time, and she is making improvements on her house.

Madalena had loans with other banks and paid them off without difficulties.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer at this institution.  This is her first loan, and she is asking for 10,000 meticais.  She will use it to buy bundles of used clothing to increase her inventory.

She is confident that she will pay off the loan ahead of time and ask for another to use for her business.  She will then use her profits to finish the improvements to her house.

loans.use: Purchase bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel K. is 33 years old.  He is from the Ebwirani area in the outskirts of Kisumu city.  He is married to Loice and they have four chidren aged six years and three months old. 

Daniel has a charcoal business that he has been doing for the past six years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client. He intends to use the loan to buy 10 sacks of charcoal to add to his stock. 

His dream is to build a charcoal shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Kajubwe Tukore Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Pasikazia T. is the leader of Kajubwe Tukore group A in Kihihi. A married mother of nine children, all aged above eight years, she grows beans and maize and sells goats from Nshegi, earning as much as 160,000 in monthly profits.

Pasikazia is now requesting a loan to expand her farm by buying more goats and fertilizers. She has been in business for over 20 years and is happy to have grown over the years. Very hardworking and determined, Pasikazia hopes to grow even further now that she is a client of Pearl microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more goats and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Cecibel Johana

texts.es:
Cecibel de 27 años, desde que se caso decidió tener una actividad económica y decidió vender algo que ella sabia prepara muy bien llamada “Humita” (Consisten básicamente en una pasta de masa de maíz cocido y levemente aliñada de aceite, envuelta y finalmente tostada en las propias hojas de una mazorca de maíz).  

En la actualidad sigue con su negocio ya que  la buena administración que le ha dado a sus ventas  ahora tiene una demanda alta de humitas. Las distribuye a distintos vendedores trabajando desde las 07h00am cocinándolas  y tiene una producción de 100 en la mañana y 100 en la tarde. En ocasiones vende las humitas en distintos pueblos y ciudades con ayuda de su esposo. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en la parte delantera de su casa por lo que aun no tienen un local fijo. Cada humita la vende a $ 0.70. 

Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Por lo que es bien turístico quiere seguir con su  negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo maíz para seguir haciendo sus humitas. En el futuro quiere implementar mas comidas y arreglar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Cecibel is 27 years old.  When she got married, she decided that she wanted to have a business activity and so decided to sell something which she knew how to prepare called 'humita' (basically a dough of cooked corn, lightly coated in oil, wrapped and finally toasted inside corn husks).

Cecibel has run her business well and now she has a high demand for 'humitas'.  She distributes them to different sellers.  She starts cooking her 'humitas' at 7.00am.  She produces 100 in the morning and 100 in the afternoon.  Occasionally she sells her 'humitas' in different villages and towns with the help of her husband.  Her business is located in the front of her home because she still doesn't have fixed premises.  Each 'humita' sells for $0.70.

Cecibel lives in Playas canton.  It is an Ecuadoran tourist destination which is noted for its wide range of seafood.  Cecibel would like to continue in her business and would like to use her loan to buy corn so that she can continue making her 'humitas'.  In the future, she would like to make more meals and fix her home's infrastructure.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las emprendedoras se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado es de Capiata en fecha 21deoctubre de 2009, gracias a que la actual Directora Finanzas la  Sra. Teodora F., quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras  ,contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 6° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la  Fundación Paraguaya.
La presidenta del grupo es la señora Maria quien se dedica a la venta comestibles como empanadas, milanesas, panchos, hamburguesas y otros.
Ella todos los días se empeña con mucho esmero para preparar los comestibles para vender y de esta forma logra ayudar bastante bien a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne y aceite, ingredientes esenciales de sus comestibles y actualmente presentan un precio bastante alto en nuestro medio.
texts.en: Las Emprendedoras [Entrepreneurial Women] is the name of the excellent group of women from Capiata, formed on October 21, 2009, thanks to the efforts of the current Director of Finances, Mrs. Teodora F., who sells fruits and vegetables. At a weekly meeting of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendadoras [Committee of Women Entrepreneurs] that was being held in her area, Mrs. F. consulted with the adviser to find out what kind of work  they did. Once she was advised about the Program, she managed to pull together 21 women who are already in their 6th loan cycle happily working together in solidarity within the program. All of them do activities to earn money, and they help each other to reach common goals within the group and in Fundación Paraguaya. The president of the group is Maria, who sells prepared foods such as empanadas, breaded meat cutlets, hot dogs, hamburgers and more. Every day she is determined to take great care in preparing the foods to sell, and in this way to be a great help to her family. She requests the loan for the purchase of meat and oil, essential ingredients for her foods, and which these days are very expensive in our area.

loans.use: Purchase meat

loans.name: Abasse

texts.ar:
عباس في عمر 40 سنة متزوج وله اربع اولاد نجار يعمل في تعهدات المنازل يحب عمله ويسعى دائما الى تطوير نفسه وعمله 
يريد من خلال تحسين وضعه الى تحسين وضع عائلته لأنها من اولى اهتماماته فهو يريد تعليم اولاده وتأمين العيش الكريم
لهم خاصة انهم في ريعان طفولتهم عباس طموح محب لعمله ويريد دائما التطور يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى 
شراء بيك اب جديد لتحسين عمله ونقل البضائع الخاصة بهذا العمل
texts.en: Abasse is a 40-year-old husband and father of four who wants to develop himself and his work to advance his family and provide them with an excellent education, particularly since they are at a tender age. Abasse is a very assiduous carpenter who works in home contracting. He would now like to seek a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a new pickup truck to transport materials related to his work.

loans.use: To purchase pickup truck to transport construction materials

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina tiene 56 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su negocio, ella tiene un pequeña negocio de venta de comida, ella ofrece ricos platos de comida como por ejemplo arroz a la cubana, arroz con huevos, saltadito, mondonguito y muchos más. Celestina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, carne, papas, verduras y muchas cosas más. 
  
Celestina pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Celestina is 56 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. After doing the household tasks, she works and has a small food sales business where she sells delicious dishes like Cuban-style rice, rice and eggs, stir fry, tripe, and other dishes. Celestina needs the loan to purchase food items like rice, pasta, meat, potatoes, vegetables, and many other items.

Celestina belongs to the Renovación Communal Bank of the Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Peru. The communal bank is comprised of enterprising and hardworking people who always look for opportunities to get their children ahead.

loans.use: To purchase food items

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon S. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Marlon owns & operates a general store where he sells medicine to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marlon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Marlon is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This will be his eighth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es: Idalia Del Carmen es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora de 49 años de edad. Trabaja de una manera independiente pues su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, inició su negocio por esfuerzos propios con la venta de ropa más tarde es que decide recurrir a las casa comerciales para la venta de cosméticos,  al ver que tenia ciertos clientes decide mantener este negocio, ya que tiene la obligación de mantener a sus 3 hijos y solamente 1 está a su cargo. Es por eso que realiza este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Por lo que sueña con mejorar seguirle brindando a su familia el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Idalia Del Carmen is a hard-working entrepreneur who is 49 years old.  She has a business selling general goods which she set up on her own initiative by selling clothing.  Later she decided to sell cosmetics and kept up the business in order to maintain her three children, one of whom still lives with her.  

She plans to use the loan to buy raw materials.  Her goal is to continue providing an income and putting food on the table for her family.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene has been practicing mixed farming for the past 14 years in the town of Kitale, in western Kenya. Her main products are maize, beans and milk, which are all sold locally. She also earns income from the sale of timber at the local market.

She has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES, through Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a motorcycle for transporting milk to the market. The proceeds from this loan will help in the education of her children and to provide for the basic needs of her family. She hopes to acquire a pick-up in the future. This will assist in the transportation of her products to the market. 

Irene is 37 years old, married, and has 4 children. Three of her children are currently attending school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transporting milk.

loans.name: Ti

texts.en: Ti S. is 32 years old and resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. S. sells cakes, earning an income of $1 per day. Her husband produces Cambodian noodles, earning an income of $2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $20 on food and $50 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike to transport the cakes she sells. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will S. 's first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport cakes to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 28 years old and married with one three-year-old child. He has a mixed farm in Nkubu town in eastern Kenya that produces bananas, tomatoes and maize. He has been in the farming business for five years now and employs one farmhand. He sells all his products to the local market.
Godfrey has requested a loan of 80,000 KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to expand his banana farm. He intends to use this loan to buy farm inputs, irrigation equipment and improve on the quality of his bananas. The income from this project will help him provide for the basic needs of his family. His major challenges have been unpredictable weather conditions and fluctuations in the market price of his products. He is planning to acquire another piece of land in future to enable him to expand his banana farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, irrigation equipment and expand his banana farming

loans.name: Mrs. Malin Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fifteen people who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Malin is the village bank president selected by the members. She was born in 1979. To earn money to support the family, Mrs. Malin is a chicken breeder and her husband, Mr. Oun, is a key seller in the local market. Since her husband’s business is going well, they want to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Malin is asking for a loan to buy more keys for resale and to buy two piglets to start a new breeding business. Mrs. Malin is the mother of four children; two are enrolled in the local public school and two are too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more keys.

loans.name: Segundo Valeriano

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 65 años de edad, él es casado sin hijos a su cargo.  Vive en casa propia con su esposa. Su casa está ubicada en el caserío Paccha en el distrito de Chulucanas en Piura al norte del Perú. Cliente vive en la parte céntrica de este distrito y cuentan con los servicios básicos.

Segundo se dedica  a la crianza de ganado porcino y ovino, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local y con vecinos de su localidad.
Segundo también de desenvuelve como agricultor,  tiene 3.0 hectáreas  de terreno agrícola herencia de sus padres, pero ya cuenta con toda la documentación a su nombre, en dicha parcela tiene sembrado Mango 1.50 de hectáreas  y ha instalado 0.50 hectáreas  de fríjol chileno, ambos cultivos bien conducidos. Segundo cuenta con más de 15 años  experiencia en la agricultura.

Segundo esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles los que destinará la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y así obtener mayor peso y tamaño.  De esta manera lograr mayor precio en sus animales en el mercado. 

Segundo, es un cliente nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa. Sin embrago ya ha manejado diferentes préstamos y reporta un buen historial crediticio. Segundo presenta buenas referencias personales. Sus vecinos y personas que lo conocen lo describen como una persona muy responsable y respetuosa.
texts.en:
Segundo, 65, is married and does not have any children in his care.  He lives in his own house with his wife.  His house is located in the Paccha hamlet in Chulucanas District in Piura in northern Perú.  The client lives in the central part of this district and they have basic utilities.

Segundo raises pigs and sheep which, when they reach ideal size and weight, he sells at the local market and among local neighbors.  He’s also a farmer.  He has 3 hectares of farmland which was passed down to him by his parents but which he now has legal title to.  He has 1.5 hectares planted with mango and 0.5 hectares with Chilean beans; both crops are doing well.  Segundo has over 15 years experience in farming.

Segundo is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed in order to attain larger size and weight so that he can get better sale prices for his animals in the market.

Segundo is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa.  However, he has managed other loans and has good credit history.  His neighbors and people who know him describe him as a very responsible, respectful person.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has five children aged 20, 18, 12, 10 and 5. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because she is a relative of his wife. 

Mohamed owns a used shoes business.  He began his business because he wants to provide for his family. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy additional used shoes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000.  In the future, Mohamed plans to build a house for his family and educate his children to the university level.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase basic grains, dairy products, soft drinks, and personal hygiene products with the goal of increasing her sales.

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than (pictured above) is a widow with six children--three sons and three daughters. Four are married; three of them live in separate homes, and one still lives in the family home. The other two are garment workers. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Than is a weaver. Because her house is partly in bad condition, she requests a loan of $300 to make the necessary repairs.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco Tulio, tiene la edad de 66 años, está casado, vive con 2 hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la siembra de este cultivo al igual que la experiencia. El tiene la plantación ya en buenas condiciones pero quiere darle a su cafetal una asistencia extra para mejorar la cosecha próxima. El quiere generar las ganancia para su bienestar familiar  y tener un dinerito extra para  luego seguir asistiendo su cef y seguir adelante con su proyecto de caficultor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio is 66 years old, married and lives with 2 children and his wife, who are his biggest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy the supplies needed to help his coffee plantation.  He has land that is optimal for planting this crop, as well as the experience to do so.  He has the field already in good condition, but wants to give it some extra assistance to improve the next harvest.

He wants to generate profits for the well-being of his family, and to have a little money extra to later continue forward as a coffee grower.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has granted the loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy supplies to help his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by growing vegetables in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gloria has been growing vegetables for three years and earns additional income from growing rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna trades in clothing from a rented booth at the city market.  To continue running the business successfully, Anna needs to purchase new clothing stock. With the loan's help, Anna will sell more clothing and increase her income. The income generation is very vital for Anna, who is taking care of her one child all alone. Additionally, Anna will rent another booth and develop her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for clothing.

loans.name: Damazo

texts.en:
Damazo is a 50-year-old married man with six children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to be able to educate his children to higher institutions of learning.

Damazo has been in the produce business for 20 years and with the proceeds, he has been able to build a house and pay school fees for his children. He has challenges of price fluctuation and his dream is to supply the western region of the country. Damazo needs the loan facility to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale

loans.name: Upol's Group

texts.en:
Upol is a member of this group. She is 60 and married to a driver. She has raised two daughters and two sons. The first son is in the military; the second is a cutter. The older daughter works as a teacher and the younger daughter is a housewife. 

Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 6000 KGS, Upol started to provide sewing services. She sews Kyrgyz national cloth, blankets and pillows. With the profits gained from this activity she purchased cattle for breeding. 

Upol applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase hay for cattle. In the future she wants to increase the number of cattle and with the profits gained from the business, she plans to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for cattle.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena de 25 años vive con su cónyuge y su hijos de 3 años de edad al suroccidente de la ciudad donde tiene el negocio de vender mercancía variada, como cosméticos que promociona mediante guías especializadas o catálogos  y también tiene una distribuidora de helados, negocios,  que surgieron gradualmente para resolver la necesidad de generar ingresos para el hogar y con el fin de aumentar su bienestar. Las compras de estos productos las hace de contado, mientras las mercancías las vende a crédito y los helados de contado. Su meta mas adelante es fortalecer su pequeña distribución de helados y convertir este negocio en heladería, donde sus clientes tengan un ambiente confortable, mientras degustan y se refrescan.  Así mismo sueña con adquirir su propia casa y diariamente este pensamiento es su mayor impulso. En la actualidad esta aplicando a su credikiva primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cosméticos que vienen con descuentos especiales y perfumes encargados, a propósito del día del amor y de la amistad, época en la cual ocurre un repunte de sus ventas  y desde dos meses antes los clientes de Lorena han encargado, las mercancías que servirán de obsequio para expresar manifestaciones de cariño a sus familiares, amigos y enamorados.
texts.en:
Lorena, 25, lives with her spouse and 3-year-old child in the southwest part of the city where she has a business selling varied merchandise like cosmetics that she sells via specialized catalogues or guide books.  She’s also a frozen treat distributor.  These businesses arose gradually to meet the need she had to generate income for her home in order to increase wellbeing.  She pays cash for these products but sells them on credit; the frozen treats are sold for cash.  Her goal for later on is to strengthen her small frozen treat distributorship and turn it into an ice-cream shop where her customers will have a comfortable environment while they enjoy their treats and refreshments.  She also dreams with acquiring her own house and this is her daily motivation.

She is currently applying for her Kiva loan, the first financing she’ll receive from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy cosmetics that are on special discount and perfumes she has pending orders for due to the Day of Love and Friendship which is a time when sales spike and customers have placed orders with Lorena with up to two months advance notice for items that they intend to use as gifts to show their affection for family members, friends and sweethearts.

loans.use: to buy specially discounted cosmetics and perfumes on order.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married with one child. Flora is 48 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Flora sells bananas to earn a living and had this business for 35 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase 5 sacks of bananas to sell.

Flora has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Flora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of banana to sell

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: La cliente Pose, leader du groupe d’affaire «Etoile», est  entrepreneur, âgée de 36  ans, femme vivant seule, mère de deux enfants. L’ainé a 22 ans et le cadet a 10 ans, malheureusement tous n’étudient pas faute de moyens. Elle est  vendeuse des tomates, oignons, huile Rina, légumes, pommes de terre . Elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre, il ya 6 ans. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 5 cycles avec  crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut de 5$ reçu de son petit frère, ainsi, elle commença par la vente de maïs grillé au long de la route. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  3 paniers des tomates, 1 sac de pommes de terre,  et réaliser d’autres micros projets de la famille.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Pose is the leader of the "Etoile" business group. She is a 36-year-old entrepreneur and the single mother of 2 children aged 10 and 22. Sadly, due to a lack of funds, neither of the children go to school. Pose has been selling food including Rina cooking oil, tomatoes, onions, potatoes and other vegetables for 6 years. Her initial funding of $5 was given to her by her little brother and she used it to start a business selling grilled corn on the side of the road. She has since successfully completed 5 loan cycles with Hekima and will use this new loan to buy 3 baskets of tomatoes and a sac of potatoes, and to finance other small family projects. Pose would also like to watch her children grow up comfortably and expand her business. She would like to thank Hekima for helping disadvantaged women excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy 3 baskets of tomatoes, 1 sac of potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Lucia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell in her store.

Lucia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria pertenece al banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” y cada treinta días las reuniones se realizan en la ciudad de Izcuchaca en la comunidad de Compone. 

Ana Maria tiene 22 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella nació en la comunidad de compone y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella vende y compra queso y granos secos. En esta oportunidad Ana Maria requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería e insumos como por ejemplo maíz, cebada y leche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Ana Maria agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a member of the 'San Isidro de Compone' community bank which meets once a month in the city of Izcuchaca, in the community of Compone.  

Ana Maria is 22 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has one child.  Ana Maria was born in the community of Compone and this is where she carries out her business activities.  She buys and sells cheese and dried grains.  On this occasion, she requires a loan to buy more merchandise and supplies such as corn, barley and milk.  She has been in this business for several years and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

Ana Maria is grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  She pledges to make her monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and supplies such as rice, barley and milk

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 25 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de 9,meses, y muy contenta con esta bendicion de su primer hijo, su oficio biblotecaria, hoy en dia vive junto  a sus suegros, pero con cuarto aparte el cual ha venido mejorando, su esposo labora como gestor aduanero.
Ana, en el futuro desea tener su propia propiedad, que de a su familia seguridad, lo que espera alcanzar. Este es su segundo credito, en donde con el primero logro, repellar las paredes de su cuarto, y ahora podra construir bien el baño y comprar inodoro para obtener una mejor higiene.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman, aged 25.  She is married and the mother of an 9 month old son.  She is very happy with this blessing of her first child and her profession as a librarian.

Currently she lives with her in-laws, but has a separate space to which she has been able to make improvements.  Her husband works as a customs officer.

In the future, Ana wants to have her own property to give her family security.  She hopes to be able to achieve this.  

This is her second loan; with the first, she was able to plaster the walls of her space, and now she will be able to build a bathroom and purchase a toilet for better hygiene conditions.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and purchase a toilet for the area in the rear of her accommodation, to achieve better hygiene conditions.

loans.name: Sokhai

texts.en:
Sokhai is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

She is a farmer, and her husband is a construction worker. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Sokhai is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase pigs to resell. By doing so, she is able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy pigs to resell.

loans.name: Marjorie Del Rocio

texts.es:
Marjorie de 33 años, con la ayuda de Dios a podido salir adelante en su negocio, hasta ahora a podido agrandar mas su pequeña papelería y confitería, vendiendo artículos de bazar.

Hasta ahora su problema sigue siendo la delincuencia ya que el sector en que vive es peligroso.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar papeleria, confiteria etc. Sigue felizmente casa y gracias a Dios sus hijos están bien y siguen estudiando. Con el préstamo que adquiera quiere seguir ampliando mas su negocio.
texts.en: Marjorie, 33, with God’s help has managed to get ahead with her business.  To date, she’s been able to enlarge her small stationery and sweet shop adding gift items to sell.  To date, her problem continues to be crime since the neighborhood she lives in is dangerous.  She wants to use the loan to buy stationery items, sweets, etc.  She continues happily married and, thanks to God, her children are well and continue studying.  With the loan she gets she wants to continue expanding her business more.

loans.use: to buy gift items, stationery items and sweets.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María Luisa de 51 años, es una mujer separada de su pareja, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 33, 29 y 25 años. María vive con su hija de 25 y sus nietos en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de La Merced. Hace 2 años, María Luisa instaló una fuente de soda en el hogar donde vive. En todo este tiempo ha consolidado su negocio de jugos, desayunos ejecutivos, mazamorras, ensaladas, hamburguesas, bebidas calientes y frías; así pudo captar clientela fiel para su siguiente actividad.
A su vez, se dedica a la venta de comidas para estudiantes de distintos colegios. Por eso cada mañana tiene que preparar un promedio de 25 raciones de almuerzos que incluyen sopa, plato de fondo y refresco, los que distribuye en contenedores personales. “Este trabajo me conviene mucho más que la fuete de soda, por que los pagos se hacen cada 15 días o al mes. Las madres de familia ya me conocen y saben que mis comidas son sanos por eso me confían la alimentación de sus hijos”.
Más adelante, María quiere ampliar su fuente de soda en un negocio más completo, quizás un restaurante o una tienda variada, pero por lo pronto continuará en la venta de almuerzos.
Con el pasar de los años, esta mujer trabajadora quisiera construir su casa propia, que ha sido uno de sus planes más deseados. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser responsable en el pago de las cuotas. Es integrante del grupo “Mujeres al éxito”, y como su nombre lo dice, esa es su mira, el éxito.
De obtener el dinero, María podrá abrir un pequeño negocio por la campaña navideña. Para eso comprará cajas de panteones, juguetes y cajas de cervezas, que expenderá en el local de su fuente de soda.
texts.en:
María Luisa set up a soda fountain in her home.  During that time she has consolidated her juice, breakfast, porridge, salad, hamburger, and hot and cold beverage businesses.  In this way she was able to draw in loyal customers to continue this business.

She also sells food to students from different schools.  Every morning she has to prepare 25 lunches that include soup, an entrée, and a drink, which she distributes in individual containers.  “This work benefits me much more than the soda fountain, because the payments come every two weeks or monthly.  The mothers already know me and know that my food is healthy and they trust me to feed their children.”

María wants to expand her soda fountain in the future, creating a more complete business; perhaps a restaurant or general store, but in the meantime she’ll continue selling lunches.

In time, this hardworking woman would like to build a house; this has been one of her greatest desires.  This will be her first loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time.  She is a member of the group, “Mujeres al éxito” (Women for success), and as the name implies, success is her vision.

Upon obtaining the money, María will be able to open a small business for the Christmas campaign.  For this she will buy boxes of toys and beers that she will sell at her soda fountain.

loans.use: to buy toys and beer for resale.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van is a 47-year-old married woman who has been residing in Kompong Cham Province. She has been there and cultivated rice crops for ages. Farming is the only work she can do for her livelihood because she received only a low level of education. She has one single child who is now working as a local laborer. In the community, there is a lake where Mrs. Van and her husband can grow lotuses. After her lotus fruit becomes ripe, Mrs. Van will sell it in bulk, or sometimes retail, in a local market in the province. 

At the present time, Mrs. Van is looking for some funds from HKL to buy lotus seeds and start growing them in the lake. Through this loan and her project, Mrs. Van will be able to generate extra profit and better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy lotus seeds and start growing them in the lake

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: A sus 67 años, la señora Maria Esther se dedica a la venta de ropa femenina a crédito a familiares, vecinos y amigos de las veredas aledañas al municipio de Marinilla ubicado al oriente de Antioquia. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años y le ha permitido generar los ingresos necesarios para su sustento diario y apoyar económicamente a sus siete hijos. La señora Maria Esther necesita de la compra de mercancía con la cual pueda impulsar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y salud.
texts.en: Maria Esther is 67 years old. She sells women’s clothing with installment payments to relatives, neighbors and friends on the outskirts of the city of Marinilla. The city is located to the west of Antioquia. She has had this business for eight years. The business has allowed her to generate the necessary income for her daily livelihood and for helping her seven children economically. Maria Esther needs to purchase merchandise to promote her business and to improve the quality of her life and her health.

loans.use: purchase women's clothing.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 42-years-old married and they have two children. She has been operating a grocery store for the last 14 years earning a monthly income of kes 15,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of kes 30,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock of kale, potatoes, cabbage and fruit for her business. She plans to expand her business with the anticipated profit.

Her hopes and dreams are to become a grocery wholesaler.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than, 36, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been growing rice for over four years and are successful in their career. 

Due to less income, Than is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a squeezing machine for squeezing sugar cane to get juice to sell. By doing so, she would have a new business and generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her new business, build a new house and send her children to a good school.

Note: Than's husband is in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a squeezing machine for squeezing sugar cane to get juice to sell

loans.name: Flavien Antoine

texts.fr: Flavien est un homme de 45 ans père de famille. il est commerçant et vend du bois dans un quartier de la place depuis quelques années. Son commerce fonctionne bien mais il est confronté à la rupture permanente de son stock ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à finir son stock avant de pouvoir s'approvisionner.Il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises (remplir un pick up de bois) ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui seront réinvesti en parti dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à résoudre ses problèmes quotidiens.
texts.en: Flavien is a 45-year old man who is a father. He is a trader and has been selling wood in a local district for some years. His business is going well but he is constantly running out of stock because he has very little capital, and this obliges him to run down his stock completely before being able to get fresh supplies. He is requesting a loan so that he can increase his stock (fill up a pick-up truck with wood); this will not only increase his sales but also his profits. He will reinvest part of his profits in his business and the rest will help him with his daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy a pick-up truck's worth of wood.

loans.name: Frandzy

texts.en:
Frandzy is a social entrepreneur. He founded RENMEN BON, a fruit-processing enterprise. After graduating with a degree in Industrial Chemistry, he applied his knowledge and skills in his business. His marketing strategy, location, presentation, and the quality of his products are the strengths of his business.

One year later, his turnover increased and customers include most of the major hotels and supermarkets in the North. Now, Frandzy could reduce production costs by purchasing new equipment adapted to production.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle, one industrial stove, one freezer, one cocoa mill, and 500 pounds of cocoa.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
My name is Saturnina, but I am known as Nina, I work making and selling soft corncob tamales, which is a food typical of our country, I have been selling these for five years, and are particularly delicious when served with butter. I also make fried elote (soft corncob) and roasted elote. Thanks to my income I am able to send money to my son and to make some improvements in my daily living.

Loan Use: Purchase elotes ( tender corncob, firewood, milk, margarine, and other items.

Mi nombre es Saturnina, pero me conocen como Nina, me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tamalitos de elote que es una comida tipica en nuestro pais, tengo cinco años de vender este producto que son deliciosos, especialmente cuando se acompañan con mantequilla. Tambien hago fritas de elote y elote asado. Gracias a los ingresos que he podido percibir en mis ventas he logrado sacar adelante a mi hijo y hacerle algunas mejores a mi vivienda.

loans.use: Compra de elotes, leña, leche, margarina y otros

loans.name: Nukhbala

texts.en:
This single man was born in 1979 in Khaladj village, Salyan region .
4 years ago Nukhbala decided to start a small grocery store. This business does not provide him with income to cover household expenses.

Nukhbala needs a loan of $800 to expand the area of his store.

loans.use: To expand the area of his store

loans.name: Eneleka

texts.en: Eneleka operates a small grocery store where she sells drinks, snacks, twisties, lollies, tins of herring, and all other stock needed by customers. She is a 34-year-old mother of eight children; six live in Samoa and two reside overseas, but they all support their mother's business. Her goal was to improve their standard of living, and for her children to get a better education and better access to proper health care. Eneleka joined SPBD in 2004; she paid off her first loan and relaxed for some time, but now she is applying for her next loan to buy more stock for her village store. Her shop is open from Monday to Sunday and she earns ST$140 (approximately USD60) profit a day. She puts the profits from her business into her savings account with SPBD to assist in refilling the stock of the business if any week is too slow.

loans.use: Buy more stock for the shop

loans.name: Fidelia Amparo

texts.es:
Hola Mi nombres es Fidelia Amparo, soy comerciante cuento con una pequeña pulperia (venta de productos Para consumo Humano), ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingreos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, este negocio ha venido aliviar un poco la situación economica de mi hogar.

Hi, my name is Fidelia Amparo. I am a vendor in a small grocery shop, located in the center of our community. I have many years of experience in this line of work, which has allowed me to contribute income to our home expenses and to fulfill my obligations with the distributors. This business has helped in alleviating my family’s economic situation. .

loans.use: Compra de manteca, huevos, azucar,salsa, espaguetis y harina.// Purchase of lard, eggs, sugar, sauce, spaghetti, and flour

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
"I need to put a concrete roof on the front of my house, since I haven't been able to finish the construction due to lack of money and the space for my family is very reduced." I am soliciting $700.00 for the construction of a concrete roof.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Me hace falta poner un techo de concreto al frente de mi casa ya que no he podido terminar la construcción por falta de dinero y el espacio es muy reducido para mi familia”. Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para la construcción del techo de concreto

loans.use: To build a concrete roof

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Mrs. Seang H., 43, widowed, lives with her younger brother in Batambong province, Cambodia. To support her household, she works selling fish at a busy market, where she typically earns a profit of around US$5 a day. Her brother, meanwhile, works buying and selling recyclable items in the local community. 
Mrs. Seang H. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorcycle which she could use to transport fish to the market, while the rest of the loan will be used for other types of investment in her fish-sales business.

loans.use: 1 ) Purchase of a motorcycle to transport  fish to the market 2) business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products to sell for the holiday season

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa B. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 57 years old, married and has five children. Hanifa sells fruits and vegetables with his wife at the Beylagan city bazaar. He started his business ten years ago. Hanifa needs a loan in the amount of $500 to buy more kinds of goods so he can expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Nalweruba A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old and married with five children. She sells used clothes for a living. She wants to use the extra business profits to buy a piece of land and build a residential house. Hadijah and Jolly sell charcoal and want to use the loan to expand their businesses. Fausta sells roasted maize.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale and to expand other businesses

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en: I am Sajida H. from Kot Radha Kishan, a small green town in Pakistan. I am married and my husband is a constructor. I mostly do my household chores and to better utilize my free time I have decided to buy a dairy cow. This will help me to increase our household income. I am a group leader of few other women who are: Razia A. and Nasreen S. both are acquiring for their husbands who sell bricks. Gulistan B. will invest her share of loan in her family’s restaurant. I completely trust these women and request you to give us loans immediately.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
For a very long time, Lorena Velasquez and her husband have been running an agricultural business in the municipality of Achuapa of the city of León. In spite of their low income, Mrs. Velasquez works very hard to provide their son with the education he deserves, so he can become a successful professional.

A very worrying situation that the Velasquez family encounters is that they do not have electric power since they live in a far away rural area. Due to the latter, Mrs. Velasquez has acquired a debt to purchase a solar panel for her home. Her priority is to cancel this debt, and for that reason she seeks the support of CEPRODEL so they can provide her with a loan and in this way improve the conditions of their home and take full advantage of the electric power the panel generates.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Lorena Velasquez desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al negocio de agricultura junto con su esposo en el municipio de Achuapa de la ciudad de León. A pesar de sus bajos ingresos económicos la señora Lorena día a día se esfuerza grandemente para brindarle a su hijo los estudio que el se merece y de esta manera lograr llegar a ser un gran profesional

Una situación muy preocupante que atraviesa la señora Lorena y su familia es que no poseen energía eléctrica para iluminarse ni hacer los quehaceres por el hecho de que viven en una localidad rural donde es muy difícil de llegar. Por esta razón ha adquirido una deuda al haber implantado un panel solar en su hogar y su necesidad mayor es la cancelación de esta deuda. Por este motivo busca apoyo en CEPRODEL para que le aprueben un crédito y de esta forma mejorar la condición de vida de su humilde hogar aprovechando al máximo la energía eléctrica.

loans.use: To Pay for  a Solar Panel for the Home

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar’s family consists of two children, a one-year old and a 3-year old. They live in the township of Mineros. Julio Cesar works in store and draws monthly wages there, but he also has a motorcycle that he rents out on a daily basis. In both lines of work he has many years of experience, and although there is a lot of competition, his business is really successful. There is also increasing demand in the area at certain times of the year for motorcycle taxis. The loan will be used for motorcycle maintenance and to acquire a line of cosmetics priced according to quality and the product itself. Currently Julio has another small debt, but in general he has shown that he is a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La familia de Julio Cesar está conformada por 2 hijos de 1 y 3 años respectivamente. Esta familia reside en una localidad de Mineros. Julio Cesar es una persona que trabaja como dependiente por lo que percibe ingresos mensuales, por otra parte también tiene una moto la cual la renta para poder percibir ingresos de renta diarios. En ambos rubros tiene muchos años de experiencia y si bien la competencia es elevada, él se destaca por desempeñarse muy bien en la empresa y por el otro lado la demanda de mototaxis incrementa en estas épocas de safra en la zona. El crédito esta destinado para efectuar mantenimiento a la moto y para adquirir mercadería de cosméticos que tienen precios variados en función a la calidad y al producto. Actualmente tiene otra deuda pequeña, pero en general Julio Cesar demostró ser una persona responsable.

loans.use: Operating capital and motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria I. is 48 years old and married with four children. She lives and works in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She learned to sell used clothes, bags, and shoes over 15 months and then started her business in 2004. She needs a loan of $1200.00 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes, bags and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es:
Maria lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Sur. She is 58 years old, single and her children are already married. Maria has seven years of experience running a general store which has given her a lot of management experience. She started the business with her own savings and used the proceeds from her sales to grow and offer a wide variety of products. Her home does not have a front wall which would give her added security for her business, the money from this loan would be used for the wall's construction.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Doña Maria habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera y sus hijos ya están casados. Doña Maria tiene una pulpería desde hace siete años en los caules ha adquirido mucha experiencia de administración y en los cuales ha podido diversificar grandemente sus productos con las ganacias obtenidas,el negocio lo logró montar con dinero que ella tenía ahorrado. Su casa no cuenta con un muro frontal que pueda brindarle toda la seguridad necesaria a su negocio, y el dinero producto del préstamo lo coupará para dicha construcción.

loans.use: To build a wall in front of her home.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Noemí has sold cosmetics through catalog for 5 years. Her customers are her neighbors and friends. Noemí also offers hair cutting in a small, furnished beauty salon in her home. Her neighbors know and seek her there.

The loans will go towards paying in advance for the cosmetics and a stock of products at home. The loans will also go towards materials in her small beauty salon. Noemí would like to have a bazaar where she can offer her cosmetics or a market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Noemí se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo desde hace 5 años. Sus clientes son sus vecinos y amistades. Noemí también ofrece el servicio de corte de cabello en su casa. Tiene amoblado un pequeño salón de belleza dentro de su casa. Sus vecinos ya la conocen y la buscan allí.

Los préstamos le han servido para pagar los cosméticos por adelantado y tener un stock de productos en su casa. También le ha servido para los materiales de su pequeño salón de belleza. A Noemí le gustaría tener un bazar donde ofrecer sus cosméticos o un puesto en el mercado.

loans.use: For the advance purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es:
Marlon L. is 23 years old and lives in the San Judas neighborhood. He is married with a 4 year old son. Marlon has two businesses, a small café and a mobile disco/disc jockey service. His wife helps him with the administration of the café when he is working with the disco. He started out as a businessman 10 years ago when he was selling soft drinks in order to help his parents pay for his education. With time he grew his business and currently he has the café, and he invested in a mobile disco that serves the neighbors in his area and other clients who seek out his services. The loan will be used to purchase equipment for the disc jockey business in order to improve the service to clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Marlon L. tiene 23 años de edad, habita en el barrio San judas, es casado, tiene un pequeño niño de 4 años de edad. Marlon tiene dos negocios, un pequeño cafetín y una disco móvil, su esposa le ayuda con la administración del cafetín cuando el está trabajando con la disco. Empezó a ser comerciante hace 10 años cuando vendía gaseosas para ayudar a sus papas a pagar sus estudios, con el tiempo fue creciendo y actualmente tiene el cafetín, y también invirtió en una disco móvil que atiende a los vecinos del lugar y demás personas que solicitan sus servicios. El préstamo será usado para la compra de insumos para la disco móvil y así poder mejorar el servicio que ofrece.

loans.use: Investment in tools for his mobile disco/disc jockey business

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is married with 6 children aged between 17 and 3 years old. She has been a potato seller since 2007. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Hidaya is now looking for a loan to buy more potatoes for re-sale in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for re-sale

loans.name: Saada's Group

texts.en:
Saada has been preparing and selling small food items in Zanzibar for 5 years. During this time, her business has grown to the extent that she now earns approximately $85 in profit each month. She's hoping that her first loan from BRAC Tanzania will enable her to expand beyond her current level of sales.

Saada is 42 years old, married, and has 5 children, ages 7, 15, and 22, along with 24-year-old twins. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Maria, Sabina, Fatma, Veronica, and Martina.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the food she cooks and sells

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. S. U. habita en la Cmca. San Nicolas junto a su familia, por esfuerzo propio se dedica a la produccion de 4 Mzs de arroz, las que atiende personalmente con el apoyo de 1 hermano que habita junto a el; uno de sus principales problemas es el trillado de su produccion, ya que por la lejania vende su cosecha en granza, lo que le reduce sus ingresos que son el sosten familiar; es socio de la cooperativa La Esperanza,  y esta le presenta la oportunidad de participar como socio de la instalacion de 1 trillo arrocero en la comunidad, lo que le permitira obtener mayores ingresos que garantizaran mejores condiciones de vida familiar, siendo su principal anhelo la asociatividad de esta futura empresa de produccion, para lograr incrementar sus ganancias y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. S. U. lives in the San Nicolas community along with his family, and through much effort he dedicates himself to the production of four months of rice. He tends to his crop himself, along with the help of one brother who lives with him. One of his biggest problems is the threshing of his product and, due to distance, he sells his crop piecemeal which reduces his income to support the family. He is a member of the La Esperanza cooperative which is offering him the opportunity to participate in the construction of a rice thresher for the community. This would allow him greater earnings which, in turn, would improve his family’s standard of living. His biggest desire is to participate in this future venture so he can improve his profits and provide a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To contribute 30% toward the construction of a rice thresher in La Peña.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Hanaa has been working as a hair dresser for ten years. She is requesting a loan of $1000US from Al Majmoua in order to pay her medical treatment expenses. This is her third loan and she has always paid on time.

When Hanaa first started her business, she had to rely on her own funding because she didn’t receive any family support. She decided to do start this business because of her social condition. Her business is special because she goes to private houses. Hanaa doesn’t have a shop for her hairdresser. Her customers are her friends and her neighbors.

loans.use: To pay for personal medical treatment expenses.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: R. Gulchehra is a small entrepreneur in Dushanbe city, Tajikistan. She is married with four children, who are the reason she strives for a better life. She sells women dresses and trousers in a famous local market called “Korvon”. Gulchehra is a very hard-working woman and the main bread winner in the family. She achieves her goals and overcomes challenges with a natural optimism. She is requesting a loan of $ 800 USD for the term of 12 moths to re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to purchase more merchandise at affordable wholesale prices for resale. Gulchehra's dream is to ensure her children are happy and have a good education. We believe Gulchehra’s integrity and the consistent growth of her venture in the past years will guarantee further stable expansion of her trade and timely loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of dresses and trousers and expand her business

loans.name: Grupo Canada 0102696-7 Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Canadá ubicado en la Comarca del Valle de la Laguna, son mujeres conocidas por sus actividades comerciales, está integrado por las señoras: Candida Rosa M., Juana Corina A., Angelina S. R..
La señora Angelina S. R. de 55 años, casada, tiene cuatro hijos jóvenes que le ayudan en el negocio, su esposo es trabajador del campo por lo que los ingresos familiares son bajos y tuvo necesidad de emprender este negocio de Destace de cerdo al que se dedica desde muy joven y que lo aprendió de su madre.
Ella necesita el crédito para comprar cerdos vivos para destazarlos y elaborar nacatamales y vender sus derivados como: carne, frito y chicharrones.
Sueña con poder tener un lugar destinado para el taller y separarlo del área de la casa y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
Expresa que Adim le ha enseñado a separar los ingresos de su negocio con los del hogar y espera no tener fallas en los pagos  para poder tener siempre el crédito y salir adelante.
texts.en:
This is the Canada group, located in the region of Valle de la Laguna. The women are known for their businesses. The group's members include: Candida Rosa M., Juana Corina A., and Angelina S. R.. Angelina, 55, is married. She has four children who help her with her business. Her husband is a farm laborer and the family's income is low. Angelina started a business butchering pigs, work that she learned from her mother and that she's been doing since she was a girl. She needs a loan to buy live pigs which she will butcher. She will use part of the meat to make "nacatamales" (a traditional Central American dish similar to a tamale) and sell the rest. She would like to set up a work area separate from her house and help her children with their schooling. She says that Adim has taught her to separate the income from her business from the household income and to never miss a loan payment so that she always has access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Debido a que sus padres se dedicaron siempre a la pesca y venta de pescados, Maria creció en este mundo y por lo tanto, cuando se independizo también se dedico a la venta de pescados.
A sus cuarenta y ocho años ya tiene más de veinte en su negocio. Hoy en día, su puesto de ventas se ubica a una cuadra del mercado, como ambulante. Antes tenia un espacio alquilado dentro del mercado pero tuvo problemas con el administrador del centro comercial y decidió vender por su cuenta.
Felizmente Maria es muy carismática y sus clientes son muy fieles a ella y no la dejan de visitar. En el futuro quisiera ampliar sus ventas y poder adquirir un puesto grande dentro del mercado.
texts.en:
Because her parents always worked in fishing and selling fish, Maria grew up around the business of fish and when she became independent she too worked selling fish. At 48 years of age, she has more than 20 years in this business. Today, her stall is located on one of the corners of the market, as a street vendor. She used to rent a spot inside the market but had problems with the administrator of the central market and decided to strike out on her own. Happily, Maria is very charismatic and her customers are very loyal and have not stopped seeing her. In the future she would like to expand her sales and be able to get a large stall inside the market.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Mercy Awuor

texts.en:
Mercy Awuor O. is a 27-year-old mother of one girl, aged five. She sells cereal to schools and is looking for a loan to expand her business. She regularly sells out of supply but cannot yet afford new stock. She will use this loan to purchase more cereal so that she can sell to more schools. Her husband also works as a businessman. When asked about what else she would like to share with potential lenders, she wanted to let everyone know she has been saved (by Jesus), likes socializing and likes people who talk progressively and don’t gossip.

Mercy recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en: Groups 1 and 2 from the Mujeres Unidas Bank of Hope are ready to start their second loan cycle through Esperanza International.
