The group members all live in Villa Mella, which is located in the northern outskirts of Santo Domingo, which is Dominican Republic’s capital city. Evelyn R. and Josue A. are the group coordinators. Evelyn has five children. The youngest is 12 years old. All her children still live with her. She sells shoes, which she purchases in Dajabon (a city in the northwest of the Dominican Republic, which is about a 5 ½ hour ride from Santo Domingo) as well as in the capital. With this loan, she will buy mostly tennis shoes and sandals. She explains that depending on the time of year, sales increase on a certain kind of shoe (for example, loafers during back-to-school time). Evelyn hopes her profits from selling shoes will allow her to buy a house of her own. This would let her have a more peaceful life. Josue has four children of ages 10, 8, 6 and 3. His current business is selling clothes. He finds greater demand for women’s clothing. Lately, however, he has noticed that people are not buying as much as usual. He will use this second loan to purchase new clothes to sell. During his interview, he commented that he likes the fact that because all the members of his group paid their first loan on time, Esperanza International approved higher loan amounts for them in this second loan cycle. He hopes to continue that trend so he can invest larger amounts in his business and create sustainable growth. Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: purchasing tennis shoes and sandals

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, en la comunidad Rosario, el distrito de Cabanilla, de la provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, ella se dedica al engorde ganado ovino; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar más ganado (ovejas) para engorde. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo ella desea incrementar su capital y poder adquirir ganado mayor (un toro), el mismo que lo manda a los camales de Lima para venta directa, su deseo es educar a sus hijos y brindarles una profesión adecuada.
texts.en:
Sabina Q. is a member of the Communal Bank, "Women Working for Development", in the Rosario community in the Cabanilla district of the Lampa province, department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. For two years she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her business consists of raising livestock, including market lambs. Her first loan was for 3,000 soles and she used it to buy livestock. At present she is asking for a loan of 800 soles ($275), and she commits to repaying the loan in six installments. With this loan she will acquire wholesale livestock (a bull) to produce calves to later resell at market price. Sabina’s desire is to educate her children and to offer them the opportunity to have a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale livestock.

loans.name: Muhammad Hakim

texts.en:
M. Hakim M. A. has a lock and key making and repairing shop. He is married with two children. He is an educated man and a very hard worker. He has a building that is located in a good area near the street.

He tried many times to build shops and rent them out but he could not. When he found AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) and asked about this loan process he was really very happy.

Now he wants to take out an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis to start building the shops and get them ready to rent in order to make a good profit, repay the loan, and support his family to provide a better future.

He is happy with all members of his family and he would like to thank Kiva and AFS for a successful loan process in Afghanistan. He wants to say a special thank you to lenders who are supporters of this process and wants to continue his partnership in the future.

loans.use: To build shops and get them ready to rent

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 27 years old and single without a child. She is also a part-time university student in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Helen sells provisions, drinks and clothes. She hopes for the loan of N40,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 53-year-old Eva R. from Mwanza. She is married with five children between the ages of 22 and 27 years old. Eva has been running a poultry business since 2002. Her business is the poultry/kuku business. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. 
She works at the business for 4 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by two employees. Eva currently earns about 150USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to expand her business. In the future, she plans to renovate her poultry house. Eva thanks you for your support!




ABOUT SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Santos De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Santos de los Ángeles V. de 40 años de edad, reside en el departamento de san Vicente junto a su esposa. Él vende medicinas de forma ambulante en su motocicleta y las comercializa en diferentes pueblos de San Vicente. Santos trabaja diariamente por el sustento de su esposa y suyo y es por esto que solicita un préstamo, con el fin de poder obtener el dinero y comprar más medicinas, las cuales tienen mucha demanda y que le es muy factible venderlas por el bienestar de su hogar ya que le brindan más ganancias.
texts.en:
Santos de los Ángeles V., 40, lives with his wife in the San Vincente department. He sells medicines as a street vendor on his motorcycle. He sells in the different towns of San Vincente. Santos works every day to support himself and his wife. That is why he is asking for a loan to be able to buy more medicines. They are in much demand. It is very practical to sell them for the well being of his household because they give him more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more medicines

loans.name: Union Costaneras Group

texts.es: Inocencia C. es una de las más antiguas integrantes del grupo “Unión Costaneras” ,con 63 años de edad, hace 6 años que administra el negocio de tejido y venta de aguayos (telas coloridas confeccionadas artesanalmente)  y necesita el préstamo para la compra de lana de oveja y tintes. Al igual que Inocencia, sus compañeras tienen diferentes negocios pequeños como la venta de ropa, paraguas, sombreros, medias, mantas, verduras, queso, carne y tienda de barrio, todas aseguran que necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y tener variados productos que ofertarle a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Inocencia C. is one of the oldest members of the Union Costaneras group. At 63 years old, she has operated a textile business for 6 years, selling "aguayos" (a traditional hand-made, brightly-colored fabric). She needs the loan to buy sheep's wool and dyes. Inocencia's fellow members have a range of small businesses selling clothes, umbrellas, hats, socks, blankets, produce, cheese, meat and everyday grocery items. All of them need loans to buy merchandise that they will then resell to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Ijura

texts.en:
Ijura E. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. Ijura is 33 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has three children and her children attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel at Gumbo market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Lily Magaly

texts.es:
Lily es una madre soltera de 29 años que vive junto a sus tres hijos de 11, 10 y 7 años en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Santa Rosa, a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
  
Se ha dedicado durante toda su vida al tejido artesanal de sombreros de palma (planta cuya fibra es utilizada en la confección y tejido de varios productos artesanales), ella compra la palma en el distrito de Monsefú y teje sombreros junto a su madre para luego  venderlos, tan solo tejer un sombrero le puede tomar hasta una semana..
  
Ella depende de esta actividad para apoyar a su familia, sus hijos están estudiando en un colegio estatal de la zona y día a día tiene que dar lo mejor de sí para sustentarlos, su mas grande sueño es poder costruir una casa propia en donde pueda vivir junto a sus hijos y brindarles una buena educación y calidad de vida.
  
Lily desea ampliar su negocio y seguir tejiendo sombreros para seguir sacando adelante a sus hijos, es por ello que está solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más material para su producto.
  
Sus vecinos la consideran una madre muy responsable y trabajadora dentro de su comunidad, siempre está solidarizándose con quien más la necesita.
texts.en:
Lily is 29 years old and a single mother that lives with her three children ages 11, 10, and 7, in her parent’s house located in the Santa Rosa district, 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has dedicated her whole life to making handicrafts, specifically hats made of palm (palm is a plant that has a fiber that is used in the making and crafting of various handicrafts). She purchases the palm in the Monsefu district and crafts hats with her mother, which they later sell; crafting one hat can take up to a week.

She depends on this work to support her family; her children are studying at the local state school, and she has to give her best daily to support them. Her biggest dreams are build her own house where she can live with her children, and to provide them with a good education and quality of life.

Lily hopes to expand her business and to continue crafting hats so that she can continue to ensure that her children get ahead in life. Because of this, she is requesting for the first time from our institution a loan of 800 PEN, which she plans to invest in the purchase of more material for her product.

Within her community, her neighbors believe her to be a very responsible mother and hard worker; she is always supporting whoever most needs her.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dry palm leaves to craft hats.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 35 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and has been in this business for two years.

Victoria hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita D. is from the village of Clarin. She is 47 years old. Lolita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business in which the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $46 a month for these activities.

In 2000, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her tenth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias V Group

texts.en:
Santa (pictured furthest left) is the group coordinator of Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres Solidarias (Women United). Her story is representative of those in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. Her group is based in Hato Mayor, a small rural area of the Dominican Republic. Her house does not have running water and she has unreliable access to electricity.  She lives with her husband and four children (ages 19, 18, 16, and 15). 

Santa has successfully repaid five loans with Esperanza and is seeking a sixth loan to buy more items to sell in her store.  She sells various items for the house including sheets, kitchen items, pillows and interior decorations.  She plans to invest in plastic chairs with this loan to sell in her store. 

Santa has been able to improve her life with the profits she has made from her business.  She recently purchased a stove for her house and hopes to someday purchase a washing machine for her house.  She likes working with Esperanza because it encourages her to work hard and work together with all of those in her group.

loans.use: Plastic chairs to sell

loans.name: Rufine

texts.fr: La cliente est née le 19 Juillet 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est une veuve qui a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Elle vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte les dépenses de la famille. Afin de subvenir au besoin de ses enfants, elle exerce comme activité la vente de divers produits (amuse-gueule, biscuits, bombons, conserves, farine de manioc, etc.) ainsi que du charbon de bois à son domicile. Elle s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bien remboursé ses crédits antérieurs, et même son dernier crédit malgré le décès de son mari. Afin d’augmenter les stocks de marchandises et de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle, elle sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The client was born on July 19, 1970 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. She is a widow who has 3 children, all enrolled in school and all still living with her. She lives alone with her children and is the breadwinner for the family. To support her children, she sells various items (snacks, cookies, bonbons, tinned goods, manioc flour, etc.) as well as charcoal out of her house. She buys her goods in Dantokpa, international market of Bénin. She is a long-time client of ALIDé and she has reimbursed her prior loans and even her most recent loan, despite the death of her husband. So as to be able to add to her inventory and better satisfy the needs of her customers, she is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items wholesale (soap, tins of food, pasta, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and labor for growing corn and cassava

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz D. C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 40 years old. Paz is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Paz owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Paz has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Paz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2009 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Paz is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Paz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gerardo Alberto

texts.es:
Gerardo tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a dos de sus hermanos en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el pueblo joven San Martín, en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero de construcción civil desde que tenía 13 años. Ayudaba a su padre en sus tiempos libres y poco a poco fue aprendiendo esta labor. Actualmente trabaja diariamente gracias a que es conocido por la zona y siempre lo llaman cuando hay obras de construcción. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad cubre sus gastos personales y ayuda al sostenimiento de su familia. 

Gerardo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de algunas herramientas y accesoR. necesaR. para ejercer su labor de manera segura y eficaz.

Su más grande anhelo es instalar una tienda con la cual pueda seguir ayudando a sus padres. El es un joven muy conocido y estimado por sus vecinos y por las personas que trabajan con el: ellos lo consideran un muchacho responsable.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 23 years old and single. He lives with two of his brothers in their parents' home, located in the young village of San Martín, in the city of Lambayeque, about 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in civil construction since he was 13 years old. He used to help his father during his free time, and little by little he learned the trade. Today he has work every day, thanks to the fact that he is known throughout the area and people always call him when there are construction jobs. With the income that he receives from this work he covers his personal expenses and helps support his family. Gerardo is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. He plans to invest in the purchase of some tools and equipment necessary to do his work safely and efficiently. His greatest desire is to open a store, which will enable him to continue helping his parents. His neighbors and colleagues know him well and respect him: they consider him to be a very responsible young man.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools and equipment for civil construction work

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en:
Matauaina T. is 25 and married with 1 child.  She owns a business venture, driving a taxi.  Matauaina has 3 years of experience in this business.  Matauaina needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy car parts for her vehicle.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Matauaina joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Matauaina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Matauaina T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purhase car parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Huyagbat

texts.en:
Huyagbat B. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Arkhangai province of central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two oldest children, 16 and 12, both attend a local high school, while the youngest one, 4, stays at home with his wife. 

Huyagbat operates a retail goods business in a stall at a local market. He usually sells small household items such as spoons, forks, scotch and brushes. He began with a working capital of 50,000 tugrugs, but with a lot of hard work, his working capital currently exceeds 400,000 tugrugs. He hopes to keep growing his business in the years to come in order to provide for his family and in order to send his children to university. 

Huyagbat is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase goods that he can sell in his stall.

loans.use: To purchase consumer goods

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mr. Prum B. is 32 years old and lives with another family member in Kampong Chhnang Province. He inherited a plot of land from his grandparents, who died of senility years ago. On this land he plants crops, including rice and vegetables, from which he earns a living. 

He is a widower with three kids who are going to school or work as temporary laborers. Prum B. complains that his current income is not adequate to support his family. He wants to improve his family's finances with the assistance of Kiva's project partner, HKL, in order to invest in a new suitable trade. 

He requested a loan of $1050 to buy many pairs of oxen, which he will sell and hire to get extra income.

loans.use: To buy many pairs of oxen.

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou Fané est âgé de 57 ans et vit dans une famille polygame avec ses huit enfants et ses 2 femmes dans le quartier Banankabougou courani, sous préfecture de Fana, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur Seydou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Très tôt il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce de céréales. Seydou est très sollicité et jouit d’une grande notoriété dans les activités d’achat et de  vente de céréales.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son deuxième prêt individuel, après  avoir correctement  remboursé le premier.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 7 tonnes de céréales de différentes sortes à un prix abordable pour venir les revendre dans sa boutique, au grand marché de Fana, quand les céréales auront du prix, en détail et au comptant  à une clientèle composée de toutes les catégories sociales de la ville.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses de la famille et le reste investi dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou Fané is 57 years old. He lives in a polygamous family with his eight children and two wives in the Banankabougou Courani neighbourhood of the Fana sous-préfecture, in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Mr. Seydou has not been to school. At an early age he became interested in revenue-generating activities, in particular the commerce of cereals. He is in high demand and enjoys a great reputation in the business of buying and selling cereals. Aiming to satisfy an increasing number of clients, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, where he is now requesting a second loan, having fully reimbursed the first one. He will use this loan to buy seven tons of a variety of cereals, at a low price. He will then resell them retail and for cash, in his store at the main market of Fana, when the cereal prices are higher. His customer base spans all social categories in town. He hopes to reach an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will serve to cover family expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in his activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereals

loans.name: Rinna

texts.en: Rinna Y. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to buy bags of rice and posho (maize flour cooked with water to a porridge or dough-like consistency) to sell. Rinna is 33 years old and is married to a soldier. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Rinna hopes to be able to open a shop and educate her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and posho to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a merchant who sells groceries and drinks at retail prices in the city of Benin, Edo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a very long time. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. Betty, 54, is married to a retired civil servant and has 4 children. She says her only challenge is lack of funds and she hopes to overcome this difficulty. She needs a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Gelasia

texts.en:
Gelasia, pictured here with one of her twelve children, earns from her motorcycle and sari-sari store. She is married to Ricardo. Her older children don’t live with them anymore because they have their own families now. At 58, she still works hard to help provide for her family. She also wants her younger children to have a proper education.

Gelasia’s son drives her motorcycle to transport people in her community. She gets income from that. She also runs a small store located at her house. She applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy inventory for her store and also to maintain her motorcycle.

loans.use: Additional inventory and motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Ana J. M. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha vizinho com o reino da suazilândia, Provincia de Maputo, tem 30 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 3 filhos com idades coopriendidas entre os 7 aos 13 anos, todos vao a escola. Fez a 5ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições pois foi abandonada pela sua mãe e fica nos cuidados da avo. Vive na casa própria com sua familia e sustenta sua avo e mae que vivem com ela.

 Sai do Distrito para cidade da Matola no tempo da guerra, anos depois regressa a sua terra natal, iniciou sua actividade comercial muito jovem, porque sua avo já não tinha possibilidades de a sustentar. tem um negócio próprio é proprietária de um estabelecimento onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade nomeadamente ( arroz, açucar, sabão e refrigerantes). Não tem empregados e conta com ajuda dos seus filhos trabalhando das 6h as 23h e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra,  e consegue poupar 1.500.00mt mensalmente  porque conta com ajuda do seu marido que e docente.

Este e o terceiro empréstimo de Ana na Hluvuku e segundo no kiva. Os dois primeiros de 7.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt foram usados para comprar produtos de primeira necessidade e pede este terceiro de 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. esta confiante que vai reembolsar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Ana J. M. was born in the Namaacha district, neighboring the Kingdom of Swaziland, in the province of Maputo. She is 30 years old, married, and mother of 3 children aged between 7 and 13, who attend school. She attended school until the 5th grade but dropped out due to a lack of resources, as she was abandoned by her mother and was left in the care of her grandmother. She lives in her own home with her family, and supports her grandmother and mother, who live with her. She left Namaacha for the city of Matola during the war, two years later she returned to her hometown. She started her business very young, because her grandmother did not have a way to support her. She has her own business and is owner of a shop that sells basic goods such as rice, sugar, soap, and soft drinks. She does not have employees, and counts on the help of her children. She works from 6am to 11pm and earns around 4.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses and for construction. She manages to save 1.500.00mt per month because she has the help of her husband who is a teacher. This is Ana's third loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva. The first two loans were for 7.000.00mt and 10.000.00mt which she used to purchase basic goods, and she is requesting this third loan for 15.000.00mt for the same purpose. She is confident that she will pay back her loan without any problems and request another loan to complete her construction project.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: beer and food products

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị (20203050004) is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. V. is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách nhóm 01 (1).


V. is married and has three adult children.  To making a living, V. owns & operates a business providing waste disposal services to local community members.  V. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, V. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,944,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by V. from SEDA.  V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050005) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050002) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Trương Thị V. (20203050003) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn Thị

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.en: Crisologo B. is from the village of San Jose. He is 34 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Crisologo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Crisologo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Crisologo is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his eighth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino, de 29 años, es casado y tiene cinco hijos, una pequeña y cuatro mayores. Juntos residen en una comunidad ubicada en la selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa  propia hecha a base de madera.Paulino se caracteriza por ser un agricultor decidido, se dedica a la siembra de café. Su producto es considerado como uno de los mejores en su valle, sin embargo, la única dificultad que tiene es que produce en poca cantidad, pero trata de aprovechar todo el terreno que falta ocupar en su chacra. Su estrategia a largo plazo consiste en adquirir más terrenos de cultivo con la finalidad de incrementar su productividad y atender futuras demandas. Por lo general vende su producto  en los centros de acopio de su comunidad, a un precio competitivo; y le esta resultando muy rentable. Para la buena labor que logra cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos, y su rutina diaria empieza a  las 6  de la mañana, y termina a las 6  de la tarde.Este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, y  se compromete en pagar sus cuotas durante las fechas establecidas, además se siente orgulloso con el trabajo de su banco comunal, porque todos trabajan para el bienestar  conjunto.Con el dinero solicitado Paulino tiene planeado comprar productos comestibles para instalar  una pequeña bodega, pues quiere  seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Paulino, age 29, is married and has five children. One is small and four are older. They live together in a community in the Cuzqueña jungle. They have their own house there, which is made of wood. Paulino is characterized as being a determined farmer. He devotes himself to growing coffee. His product is considered to be one of the best in his valley. Nevertheless, the only difficulty he has is that he produces a small amount. He tries to take advantage of all of the unused land on his farm. His long term strategy consists of getting more land for crops. He will do that in order to increase his productivity and to meet future demands. He normally sells his product at community centers where people gather, and he sells at a competitive price. The result is very profitable for him. He counts on his wife and children for help with the good work that he does. His daily routine starts at six in the morning and ends at six in the evening. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He commits to making his payments on time. He is proud of the communal bank’s work because they all work together for their well-being. Paulino will use the requested money to buy food in order to set up a small grocery store. He wants to keep progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products to set up a store

loans.name: Akuavi Abui

texts.en: Madame Akuavi N. has a store where she sells traditional Togolese cloth like pagnes and bazins, as well as children's clothing and other clothes. She is very successful and has had this boutique in her home since 2004. She lives in Lome and is requesting her first loan from WAGES of 400,000 Communauté Financière Africaine Francs in order to purchase bazins, pagnes and children's clothing.

loans.use: To purchase bazins, pagnes, and other clothing

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix V. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 32 years old. Felix is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Felix raises crops. The main source of income for his business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. From selling rice, he was able to start a sari-sari (variety) store that his wife mainly manages. They sell vinegar, sugar and other products. He says he wants to have a happy family. Felix joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Felix is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Felix from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also has savings, insurance, and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda A., from the town of Trento, is 46 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she recently started raising hogs for fattening and sale. She hopes to acquire more pigs to raise.

Luzviminda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure as well as livestock feed. This will be Luzviminda's second loan from CEVI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure as well as livestock feed

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en: Byambadorj S. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Hovd province, west of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His elder three children attend a local middle school and the youngest child goes to a local kindergarten, while his wife is currently unemployed. Byambadorj has been working as a plumber in his town since 2000. He also works for a local kindergarten as a fireman during the winter season. Byambadorj is a hardworking person who is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car, by which he would transport people and increase his earnings in order to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily I. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 51 years old. Lily is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lily owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lily has been engaged in her business for over 15 years.

Lily joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lily has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lily is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Lily from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela M. is from the town of Banga. She is 20 years old has a 1-year-old child.

Shiela owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also raises pigs for fattening and sale.

Shiela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Shiela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and also feed for her pigs. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and also feed for her pigs

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 33 años, su actividad es una pulpería, esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos, por lo que es una mujer muy emprendedora  Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio y está ubicada en su casa de habitación en donde asisten muchos clientes que son amigos, familiares, vecinos  y conocidos Ella es muy conocida por ofrecer un buen servicio, el crédito es para la compra de pan, galletas, golosinas, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en: Noemi is 33 years old, and has a general store.  This is not the first time she is requesting financing, because she is an enterprising woman.  She has had this business for more than 4 years.  It is located in her home, where she serves many customers, such as friends, family members, neighbors, and acquaintances.  She is known for her good service.  The loan is to buy bread, crackers and cookies, candy, detergents, and basic grains.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her poultry farm

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 36-year-old member of Pioneer Matasiah group in Faulu Kenya.  For ten years, she has been selling vegetables.  She has two employees in the business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more focused on her business.  She aspires to own more grocery shops in the future.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian vive en la zona de Cota Cota de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es comerciante, tiene una pequeña distribuidora de materiales de construcción
Es soltero.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (compra de cerámica).
Es la primea vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito podrá incrementar sus ingresos, y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristian lives in the Cota Cota zone of the city ciudad de La Paz. He is single.  He's also a merchant, with a small construction materials distribution business.  The loan will be used to purchase merchandise (ceramic tiles).

This is the first time he has requested a loan from Impro, and this loan will enable him to increase his income, and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy ceramic tiles for his construction material distribution business

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov S. is a 31-year-old married woman who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Pov S. is a cleaning woman and also spends times at home taking care of her kids and doing housework. She has four children and all of them are unmarried. She also relies on income from her husband’s work selling fish and fish-paste, and his business is running well now. So that Pov S.’s husband has needed more funds to expand his business in order to make more profits for supporting the family’s needs. To solve this problem, Pov S. will request a loan as fund for her husband to purchase more fish and fish-paste for resale. Pov S. was not available at that day, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and fish-paste for resale.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa.

Julio Cesar P. G. y su esposa se dedican a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 2 años ofreciendo ropa usada de todas tallas, sabanas, cortinas y artículos de buena calidad, este negocio es su fuente de ingresos aparte que el que percibe Julio por ser  chofer de camiones de carga. El señor quiere que se apoye en su negocio para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The person in the picture is his wife.

Julio Cesar P. G. and his wife have been selling used clothing for the past two years.  They have all sizes of clothing, sheets, curtains and good quality articles.  This business is their source of income besides what Julio makes as a truck driver.  Julio would like the help with his business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artefactos, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria y también por pedido, la socia quiere tener una tienda de artefactos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artefactos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margarita belongs to the "COMUZONE I" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Margarita is 49 years old, single and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling appliances.  She sells her products as an itinerant street vendor and she also sells to order.  She would like to own an appliance store.

Margarita is requesting this loan so that she can buy appliances.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy appliances

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en:
Chhean C. is a hard-working man who has spent his life as a motor taxi driver in and around his community, Siem Reap province. He is an older man and can earn an average revenue of $3.00 per day from his motor taxi service.

Chhean C. has a life partner in his wife who, along with their two sons, works in the fishing business. They usually spend eight hours a day fishing in and around Tunle Sap River. They catch around ten kilos of fish per day and sell them in bulk to their customers who are retail sellers in the market. The couple is blessed with five children all of whom are married.

To support his wife’s business Chhean C. will use his loan to purchase nets, machinery and other fishing implements for catching more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, machinery and other fishing implements for catching more fish

loans.name: Nelly Luz

texts.es: Nelly Luz vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias y se dedica a las decoraciones  hace humosos arreglos con bombas  y serpentinas que adornan las fiestas de los hogares y espectáculos públicos; así mismo comercializa mercancía variada, porque en el negocio de decoraciones ella ha conseguido múltiples clientes y con ellos ha construido una base de datos y sus ventas se han incrementado. Este es   financiamiento # 33 con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará globos inflables, ojos adornos y mercancías solicitada como ropa deportiva.  Desde que inició su negocio ha logrado muchos cambios positivos en su vida,  como su autonomía y con su buen desempeño, sus ingresos le han apuntado a apoyar el sustento de su hogar, conformado por sus dos hijos en las edades de 19 y 20 años y su cónyuge.  Nelly  inició con la Fundación en cursos de emprendimiento  y fortaleció su negocio inicial de carnes frías, luego participó en cursos de confecciones que la llevaron a despertarle el gusto por  el arte y en especial por las decoraciones que además de constituirse en  un ingreso es su gran hobby. Su sueño es ser reconocida como decoradora a nivel local y posicionarse en puntos de mucha comercialización para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nelly Luz lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias. She makes humorous decorations and arrangements consisting of balloons and streamers for home parties and public shows. At the same time she sells a variety of merchandise. As a result of managing multiple events through her decorations business, Nelly has built a solid customer base and increased her sales.

This is her 33rd loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the funds to purchase inflatable balloons, decorative eyes, and merchandise on order such as sportswear. Since starting her business, Nelly has made many positive changes in her life such as becoming independent and getting out of debt. Her earnings are designated for maintaining her household, which consists of her two children (ages 19 and 20) and her husband. Nelly joined FMSD by taking entrepreneurship courses that helped strengthen her initial business of selling cold meats. She later participated in sewing courses in which she gained a taste for art, especially making decorations, which has become a hobby as well as a source of income. Her dream is to become well-known as a local decorator and position herself in several markets so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: Purchase inflatable balloons, decorative eyes, and sportswear

loans.name: Ludah

texts.en:
Ludah S. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Ludah is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she sells clothing and shoe products from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ludah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Ludah is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts and blouses. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional t-shirts and blouses to sell

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Fatmata C..  She is married and has two children, ages 10 and 15. She has two additional dependents whom she adopted.  

In 2008, Fatmata established her food business. She began her business because it is fast-moving and she has great help from her husband.  She opens her business seven days a week and eight hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.  Fatmata needs the loan in order to purchase a large quantity of palm oil, bags of rice and other food items. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin F. is from the village of Sta. Clara Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 51 years old. Benjamin is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Benjamin owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Benjamin has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2011, Benjamin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benjamin is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Benjamin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Heun

texts.en:
Heun S., age 24, is a sewing worker who spends most of her time sewing clothes at the garment factory. She has had experience in this sector since 2007, and has a formal salary every month. 

Her husband is a blacksmith who is highly skilled at making different tables, chairs, windows, doors, and other things that are made from iron. On average, he can earn a profit of approximately $7.50 a day to support the family’s needs. 

Recently, Heun S.’s husband has been using up the iron from his stock, and it may affect his business. To fix this situation, Heun S. has decided to request a loan that will be used by her husband to buy more iron to go on with his business in the usual process. 

The couple is blessed with only one child who still studies in public school.

loans.use: To assist her husband to buy more iron

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two children.

Ali has seven years of experience in repairing car’s electricity and he has had his own workshop since 2001. He is well known in his local area and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy an electrical tester machine for new cars. He is aiming to extend his business and increase his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy an electrical tester machine for new cars

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en: Mr. Ankhbayar is 23 years old, lives with his parents and three younger brothers in parents apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Last summer he has graduated from a University of Science and Technology as a bachelor in geology.  Currently he has been employed by a private mining company as a geologist.  He has a seasonal job where he goes to a mining site in the summer and autumn time and is free of work the rest of the time. Last year he earned some money working for this company.  Using his savings, Ankhbayar plans to do some proper renovation to his parents old apartment, but he is short on money. The loan Ankhbayar is requesting will be used to buy necessary building materials such as wall papers, paints, plasters, cements and so on to renovate his parents apartment.

loans.use: To buy necessary building materials such as wall papers, paints, plasters, cements, etc., in order to surprise his parents by renovating their old apartment.

loans.name: María Melida

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, uno de 17 años que es un niño especial y otro 7 años que estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante. Este es el tercer  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho tanto en su negocio como en su vida familiar.

Ella se dedica al igual que su esposo a la venta de aliños y especias, pastas de dientes, papel higiénico, entre otras cosas, ellos se desplazan por todo el centro de la ciudad sobre todo por los mercados que es donde todas las personas acuden  a hacer sus compras diarias. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 12h00, ya que a esa hora tiene que ir a preparar el almuerzo y en la tarde ayudar a su hijo en las tareas de la escuela y también a su hijo que es especial ya que en las mañanas ella lo tiene en una escuela para niños especiales es así como aprovecha las mañanas para realizar sus ventas y con esto ayuda a su esposo en la dura tarea de llevar el pan diario al hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar aliños, especias, detergentes, pastas dentales, entre otras cosas.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the "Mujeres De Lucha" community bank meets in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for being very commercial.  It is also noted for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas and the cheerfulness of its residents.

Here we meet 33 year-old María who lives with her common-law husband and has two children.  Her eldest son is 17 and is a child with special needs.  Her youngest son is 7 and in elementary school.  Her husband is a salesman.  This is María's third loan cycle as a member of her community bank.  She likes the bank because the loans have helped her a lot both in her business and also in her family life.

María and her husband both sell seasonings, spices, toothpaste, toilet paper and other products.  They travel around the whole of the city center, especially around the markets which is where everybody goes to do their daily shopping.  María works every day, from 8.00am to 12.00pm.  At midday she has to go and prepare lunch and in the afternoons she has to help her younger son with his school work.  She also has to help her child who has special needs.  In the mornings he attends a school for children with special needs and so she takes advantage of this to make her sales in the mornings and help her husband in the difficult task of making enough money to support their household.

María will use this loan to buy seasonings, spices, detergents, toothpaste and other products.  Her dream is to own a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy seasonings, spices, detergents, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 27-year-old man who takes care of his wife and the household expense. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary.
Mahmoud has a small electronic engine repair workshop in the city, which helps him have more income besides his small salary. Mahmoud took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the spare pieces needed to repair engines. Mahmoud appears in the picture above in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase electronic engine spare parts

loans.name: María Antonieta

texts.es:
La Sra. María Antonieta pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Paz II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera y tiene 63 años.

Marìa Antonieta tiene un pequeño salón de belleza, el cual ha implementado con la venta de cosméticos con un capital de S / 350.00 nuevos soles, actividad que en la actualidad le da la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos y aportar así a la economía del hogar, y como mujer sentirse realizada.  

  Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos,  tanto para adultos como para bebes, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas, para así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades. 

María Antonieta es una mujer  soñadora, se siente muy contenta y quiere continuar trabajando para la realización de sus objetivos y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta belongs to the communal bank "Maria Paz II" of the district of Tarapoto, in the province and department of San Martin. She is single and she is 63 years old.

Maria Antonieta has a small beauty salon in which she has incorporated cosmetics sales. She has a capital fund of S/.350 nuevos soles. This business activity gives her the opportunity to generate her own income and to provide for the household economy, and to feel accomplished as a woman.

With this loan of S/.800 nuevos soles she will purchase beauty products for her inventory, such as perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, compacts, talcs for adults and for babies, lipsticks, and nail polish, to provide her clients with a better service and to satisfy their needs.

Maria Antonieta is a dreamer and she feels very happy and she wants to keep working to meet her objectives. She is very thankful with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for helping women like herself to have opportunities to develop themselves in their field of work.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products including perfumes, skin lotions, compacts, talcs, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old single man from Tyre. He has been the owner of a dental lab since Jan 2011, with six years of experience in this field. Because his financial situation didn't help him to start his own business early, he was employed in order to save the money needed to open his own lab. Ali makes ceramic teeth and more. He works hard to improve his business by attracting more customers through his competitive prices.

Ali is very optimistic that his business will develop quickly and soon, because he's the only dental lab in the region and he's liked by most of his clients, relatives and friends, in addition to most of the dentists in the region. Ali hopes he improves his business and buys new improved and upgraded technical machines in the future.

loans.use: To buy a paindex machine

loans.name: Angelica Carolina

texts.es:
ANGELA CAROLINA:
La señora Angela Carolina se dedica a la venta D. pollo desD. hace 18 años  tiene una hija  es viuda  y  venD. en un pueblo cercano a su casa    y ahora necesita otro crédito para seguir  ofreciendo a su clientela   los pollos   destazados  y así mismo  poder crecer en sus ganancias  como  el pollo es un alimento básico y lo consumen siempre las personas   así mismo su venta crece un poco mas  y  donD. ella venD. es  una colonia    llamada Villas del Quetzal  los sábados tiene más demanda D. su venta porque los días domingos ella descansa y no muchas personas que vendan pollo y que sea fresco  en el tiempo que ella trabajo su crédito no tuvo ningún  problema   su más granD. deseo es poder  seguir  ofreciendo mas  y poder tener una persona que le ayuD. a vender  en otro lugar y generar más ganancias  como también poder seguir dándole lo  necesario  a su hija.
texts.en:
Angela Carolina has been selling chicken for 18 years.  She has a daughter.  She is a widow, and she sells in a town that is close to her house.

She needs another loan in order to continue selling butchered chicken to her customers.  Similarly, she wants to be able to have her income grow.  Chicken is a basic food that it is always consumed; and her sales grow a bit more.  There is more demand for her Saturday sales at the Villas del Quetzal neighborhood because on Sundays she rests.  

During the time that she works there are not many people who sell chicken that is fresh.  There were no problems with the loan.  Her biggest wish is to be able to keep selling more and to be able to have a person help her sell in another location.  This will generate more income, and she would also be able to continue giving her daughter the necessities.

loans.use: to buy chicken to butcher.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a welding shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and equipment for her welding shop.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 13 years. Jocelyn earns more income from tricycle transport.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional materials and equipment for her shop

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
This is Riza, 31, resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Anthony, who assists her with the business. She is also a mother to their children. Together they work hard for a safe and secure future for their family.

Riza operates a piggery. She earns income by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Aside from the piggery, she has a food stall in the morning that serves breakfast. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs. A portion of the loan will be used to buy a sack of rice and groceries for her food stall. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Riza hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and products she used in her businesses

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Giang is a 31-year-old woman living in Yên Phong District, Bắc Ninh Province. She is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Giang owns and operates a restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Giang has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from this activity.

In 2008, Giang joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Giang has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,288,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. Giang is now requesting a new loan of 9,184,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be her fifth loan from SEDA. Giang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Grace has  a poultry farm, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chicken for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Grace hopes to expand her business.   Grace is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken for resale.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en: Areej is a 30-year-old young woman who is married and has no children yet. Her husband works as a driver for cargo. Areej wants to pay for making repairs and painting the vehicle, as it is the only source of income for the family, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for these expenses. Therefore, she needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Areej gets her FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for all these expenses and improve the vehicle the family has. Her husband will serve more clients and work extra to have a better income and improve the family living conditions. Areej is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead next to the vehicle the family owns.

loans.use: To pay for repairing and painting his vehicle.

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.ru: Зарифа умная честная и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Более 19 лет она занимается купля продажей игрушки, фонарики, иголки, лампочки, крышки и т.д. Она любит свой бизнес и с удовольствием продолжает. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и хочет получит хороший прибыль и улучшить своё жилищное условие. Зарифа хотела бы получить займ для покупки нового ассортимента товаров с целью увеличения и расширения товарооборота.
texts.en: Zarifa is a smart and conscientious woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She has been involved in buying and selling toys, flashlights, needles, covers, etc. for over 19 years.  She loves her business and runs it with satisfaction.  She wants to expand her business and make a good profit, and improve her living situation.  Zarifa wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of a new selection of merchandise in order to grow and expand her goods turnover.

loans.use: to buy a new selection of merchandise

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии она проработала 19 лет. На сегодняшний день Дилафруз занимается торговлей в торговом центре. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает женскую одежду и обувь. Этим видом деятельности она занимается два года. Кредит берет для покупки женской осеней обуви.
texts.en: Dilafruz lives in the town of Khujand.  She is 38 years old, married and has two children.  She has a higher pedagogical education.  She worked in that field for 19 years.  Today, Dilafruz is involved in retail sales at a shopping center.  She has a store, where she sells women's clothing and shoes.  She has been in this business for two years.  Dilafruz is requesting this loan for the purchase of women's autumn shoes.

loans.use: to buy women's autumn shoes

loans.name: Sarah May

texts.en:
Sarah May is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Sarah May has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON.

Sarah May has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sarah May hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda D. 52 años D. edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo D. luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Clorinda desD. hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un óptimo crecimiento para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios D. su hogar. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1600 nuevos soles para la compra D. alimento balanceado y sanidad D. su ganado ovino, con las ganancias que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad D. vida.  Clorinda es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia para que logren su objetivo.
texts.en:
Clorinda, 52, lives in a house that she and her family own.  The house has electricity, but no other services.  It's in a rural part of TambogranD., a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Piura.  Local people make their living from farming, raising animals and making and selling traditional crafts.

Clorinda has operated an animal sales business for many years.  She raises and sells sheep.  She keeps them in a yard, appropriate for animals, behind her house.  She feeds them a balanced diet, including grass, so that they will grow to an optimum size for sale in various local markets.  The better the sheep, the more she can make when she sells them.  The earnings from the business cover everyday household expenses.

Clorinda is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1600 new soles loan that she will use to buy supplies for her animal sales business.  She will use the extra money she makes from the investment to repay the loan and improve her quality of life.  Clorinda has worked hard and developed her skills to create a business that is helping her meet her goal of providing a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Koribirama Group

texts.fr:
Gloriose est une commerçante âgée de 46ans qui habite la localité de Mutaho de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle a une boulangerie pour fabriquer du pain depuis 22 ans, un métier qu’elle commence alors qu’elle était vendait des articles divers dans sa boutique. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 4e année primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 200,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité de farine de blé pour fabriquer beaucoup de pains à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« KORIBIRAMA»
texts.en:
Gloriose is a 46-year-old storekeeper who lives in Mutaho, in the province of Gitega in the center of the country. She has a bakery where she has been baking bread for 22 years. She started the business while also managing a small store selling miscellaneous items.  She completed four years of schooling. She is married and the mother of 10 children who are all in school.
The Kiva loan of 200,000 francs will help her to increase her capital to purchase a large quantity of flour to bake a lot of bread to resell at a large profit and to increase savings.

She is a member of the community group "KORIBIRAMA."

loans.use: to increase her capital to purchase a large quantity of flour to bake a lot of bread to resell at a large profit and to increase savings.

loans.name: Ayna

texts.en: Ayna is a 47-year-old woman who has raised and sold fruits and vegetables for the last nine years. Ayna sells her crops in the local bazaar and her monthly income is 160 Azerbaijan Manats (AZN). Ayna applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lukova Group

texts.en:
Joshua is the facilitator of the Lukova group. Joshua and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
