He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Joshua had a very good maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joshua was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joshua and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Joshua will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Lukova group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rio Vilcanota Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “RIO VILCANOTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Pisaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosario; ella es conviviente y tiene 29 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia vende chompas, muñecas, pantalones y llaveros, la socia vende en la plaza de armas de Pisaq, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como chompas, pantalones, llaveros y muñecas al por mayor. 

Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de maíz, negocio de venta de verduras y negocio de venta de frutas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "RIO VILCANOTA".  This bank is located in the district of Pisaq, belonging to the providence of Calca and department of Cusco.

One member is Rosario; she has a live-in partner, is 29 years old and has 3 children.  The member works in her business of selling handicrafts. She sells sweaters, dolls, pants, and key-rings in the main plaza of Pisaq. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m.  Through this business she is able to advance her children.  She wants to expand and improve her business of selling handicrafts.  The member is requesting the loan to buy handicrafts such as sweaters, pants, key-rings and dolls at wholesale.

The other members have a restaurant, sell handicrafts, run a grocery store, and sell corn, vegetables, and fruit.

The member thanks those who form part of this dream through this medium and she promises to fulfill her repayments in the period of time established.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts such as sweaters, pants, key-rings and dolls at wholesale.

loans.name: Orabi

texts.en: Orabi who is a 41-year-old man, is a father of two sons and two daughters. He is a taxi driver with a low income. Orabi wants to finish two rooms in his house by doing painting, installing tile etc, so he could live in more comfortable house conditions with his family. He needs to take a loan from FATEN to complement the amount of money he has for the project. Getting this loan will enable Orabi to finish the two rooms in his house and offer better living conditions to the family. Orabi is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for finishing his house.

loans.name: Tabaksineh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tabaksineh” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of 500,000.00 SLL, for each, in order to expand their respective businesses. They will buy more goods to add to their businesses. As a result of improved businesses, their sales, profit and standards of living will improve. 

The leader of this group is Isatu. Isatu is thirty-five years of age. She was born in Magburaka town, where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and one of her children is attending primary school, the other is not yet of school going age. Isatu has been a businesswoman for ten years now. She sells ready-to-wear-clothes. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy shoes, shirts and jeans to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shirts and jeans to add to her business.

loans.name: 12 De Junio Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través una de las miembros, quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más al respecto del  Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma invito a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 16 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días. Ellas  son independientes en sus labores, pero también realizan actividades en conjunto para fomentar su compañerismo.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Herminia, quien nos comenta que tiene una pequeña despensa que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo puedo sacar adelante. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y al empeño que pone en su negocio puede tener el dinero necesario para ayudar a su familia y mantener su hogar. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder ser una gran comerciante.
Ella pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de bebidas, carne, embutidos, verduras y demás insumos de primera necesidad para poder surtir su local.
texts.en:
This community bank formed thanks to one of its members, who approached the offices of Fundación Paraguaya for more information about the community bank program for enterprising women. She then invited her friends and neighbors, and they decided to collaborate as a group in order to get ahead and thereby improve their way of life. They are sixteen hardworking, humble women who must earn their living every day. They work independently in their efforts, but also do group activities to cement their camaraderie. 

One of the group's members is Herminia. She tells us that she has a small store, and with much sacrifice and effort she can get ahead. Thanks to the hard work and determination she puts into her business, she is able to earn the money necessary to help her family and maintain her home. Her goal is to continue growing and in this way become a great storekeeper. 

Herminia is asking for help from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to buy drinks, meat, sausage, vegetables and other basic foodstuffs, with which to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, meat, sausage, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Yura

texts.ru:
Юра  родился в 1983 году в городе Капане, а в 2003 он вместе с семьей переехал в деревню Шишкерт Сьюникской области. После окончания средней школы, Юра окончил Капанский колледж и получил специальность строителя. Юра пока не женат, и живет вместе с родителями. 
Вся семья Юры занимается сельским хозяйством уже на протяжении 7 лет. На собственном земельном участке Юра выращивает яблоки на продажу. Так как его собственный участок небольшой, он также арендует землю, на которой выращивает картофель для продажи, а оставшуюся часть земли использует как пастбище для своих домашних животных. Юра с помощью родителей разводит крупный рогатый скот, овец, пчел и кур. 
Картофель и яблоки Юра вместе с родителями продают на рынках Сьюникской области, а мясо, молоко, мед и шерсть у них покупают постоянные покупатели прямо из дома. 
Благодаря занятию сельским хозяйством Юра и его родители содержат семью.
Юре необходим кредит на сумму 300.000 драм для покупки 5 овец, что позволит ему увеличить доход своей семьи в будущем.
texts.en:
Yura was born in 1983 in the town of Kapan, and in 2003 he and his family moved to the village of Shishkert in the Syunik province. After finishing high school, Yura went to the Kapan technical college and graduated with a diploma in construction. So far Yura is single and lives together with his parents.
Yura’s whole family has been doing farm work for seven years. On his own land plot, Yura grows apples for sale. Since his own  plot is small, he also leases [additional] land for growing potatoes for sale, using the rest  as grazing land for his livestock. Yura and his parents raise cattle, sheep, bees and chickens.

Yura and his parents sell potatoes and apples at markets in the Syunik province. Meat, milk, honey and wool are sold directly out of their home to  loyal customers. Thanks to   farm work, Yura and his family are able to provide for the household needs.
Yura needs a loan of 300,000 ADM in order to buy five sheep, which will allow him to increase his family’s income in the future.

loans.use: To buy 5 more sheep for his farm

loans.name: Metho. Pri Gegwema Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of a primary school, located in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. This group of hard working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to request for a loan of SLL 8,000,000.00 . They will use this loan in order to meet their most immediate financial needs – some will use it to buy a plot of land, pieces of furniture, pay school fees for their children, etc. And at the end of each month, their school’s bursar will deduct their repayment out of their salaries and repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.
Patrick is the featured leader of this group of teachers. Born in a place called Gegbwema, in Southern Sierra Leone, fifty years old Patrick is married to a housewife and has 5 children. One is in secondary school, three in college and the other is an adults. Patrick has served in the teaching profession for 36years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, iron rods, etc.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, iron rods, etc.

loans.name: Marie Carmele

texts.en:
In 2008, Marie Carmelle gathered a group of people to prepare for the festival in the North, where they collected 35,000 Gourdes (approximately $721 USD). Then they decided to launch SLEG (Societe Legphibao).

They specialize in sewing African traditional clothes, and they sell incense and pots in Cap-Haitien and in Plaine du Nord. Due to the increase in demand, SLEG would like to reinforce the production of clothes and artistic lamps.

From left to right in the picture, the organizational structure can be described as:
Marie Ange Joachim, treasurer; Marie Carmele Menton Lubin, president; Dardelle F. Hyppolite, secretary general; Tanya Baltazar, secretary deputy; Alex Etienne, delegate.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics in bulk, homemade African dresses, accessories, and lamps.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 26 years old; she is married with 3 children. Agnes completed her secondary school education and this assists her being a secretary of Inkiramat women group. She maintains proper and accurate records of the group and this helps in operating the revolving fund. Agnes’ main economic activity is buying and selling of steers. She runs her business with her husband which is not common in the Maaai culture. However, they are not against the culture but believe culture should embrace the wellbeing of people.  Agnes is good in selecting small steers for fattening and this has given her an edge over other traders because at the end of 4 months she starts selling and selling quality steers. The land available can raise over 30 cows and this why she intends to use this opportunity to increase the number of steers. With a loan of USD 450, Agnes will be able to buy 4 medium size Steers. She will sell them after 4 months at more than double the price. Agnes also foresees a better market in future whereby the market prices will be steady. She feels that if current developments recorded in the livestock sector continue, she will work hard to meet her target of increasing the Steers to 40 in a very short time.

loans.use: Agnes wants to buy 4 medium size steers

loans.name: Shola

texts.en:
Shola is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. She has had her business for 5 years and it allows her to support her family.
Shola was born in 1969 in Khaladj village,Salyan region. She is married and has 2 children.
She supplies milk in the village at the nearby markets.
With this business she provides income and also provides milk for her family.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a 40-year-old woman with three young children.  She tends a banana plantation just behind her house.  The income from this plantation puts food on the table and pays for her children’s education.  Thus, Cecilia feels strongly that her children’s futures depend on her ability to keep her plantation productive and in good condition.  Cecilia would like to invest in pest control products that can help save her crop from damaging insects as well as invest in some natural fertilizers that should improve her crop yield.

loans.use: Buy pest control products and fertilizer

loans.name: Kemlauth

texts.en:
Kemlauth married in 1994 and has 2 sons and 2 daughters. She is currently providing public phone service at her house. She also started producing silk products in 1994. She finished grade 7 in a state-run school, and she learnt to grow vegetables from her neighbor. Her husband is a government official. Her second daughter is helping her to weave silk at home, while the other children are still at school.

Kemlauth has already repaid her first loan, and now she would like a loan in the amount of $300 to buy silk material and sewing thread to put in a new loom for her daughter. That way, they can expand her business and have more income to support the family.

Kemlauth is polite and loyal and doesn’t hesitate to give any necessary information to MAXIMA. We are sure she will repay this second loan without any problem.

loans.use: Buying silk material and sewing thread

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov has built a profitable business selling women’s dress suits at the busy Alexsandrovski market in Zaporoshye. She has done well by concentrating on a product that she is interested in and where there is not a lot of competition. Lubov has been in business for six years. She recently was able to expand her business with the addition of a second kiosk. She is looking forward to developing it and making it successful. Lubov is divorced and has one grown son who is married. He and his wife are currently living with Lubov, so she helps with some of their expenses. 

Lubov has requested a loan for $1000 to purchase additional inventory for the summer season. Previous loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have been a great help to Lubov.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal lives in Borj Barajneh, in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. She is a beauty specialist and she is requesting a loan of $1000 to pay the school tuition fees of her children and to purchase a variety of beauty products which will increase her business and generate more revenue. This is the first time she requests a loan from Majmoua. Nawal is a fifty-year-old mother of six children striving to help her husband support their family.

loans.use: To pay the school tuition fees of her children and purchase beauty products

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of three children, Mrs. Akouvi T. was born on April 27, 1963 in Gapé Aloyi. Her husband is an electrician but is unable to meet all the family’s needs, so his wife has to help provide for their children. She sells clothing for babies and children, and beauty products at the large market in Lomé. As she lacks the means to buy her supplies from wholesalers, she is requesting financial support of $1,000 to make new purchases.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, madame Akouvi T. est née le 27 Avril 1963 à Gapé Aloyi. Etant électronicien, le mari n’arrive pas à satisfaire totalement les besoins de sa famille et ainsi la femme est obligée de l’aider à subvenir aux besoins de leurs enfants. Elle est revendeuse d’habits pour enfants, de trousseaux bébé et de produits de beauté au grand marché de Lomé. Elle manque de fonds de commerce pour s’approvisionner chez les grossistes. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un apport financier de $1000 pour faire de nouveaux achats.

loans.use: To buy children's and baby clothing, and beauty products

loans.name: Morenita Hga Group

texts.es:
"Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga" got started 2 years ago. Today there are 26 members who have been together for 8 cycles. Their founders were Hilda, Luisa, Isabel and Victoria.

The members say: "in our bank we have a great time and we learn a lot through conferences". They also say they have learned a lot about values, diseases and the importance of saving money.

Members do a wiD. variete of jobs such as selling chickens, natural products, food, canned goods, cheeses and dairy products. They also offer taxi services, custom maD. jewelry, local clothing, jewelry and other services.

Each member has a story, such as the case of Rosalia who got her small business started with just two pieces of furniture. She currently has a multiservice store where she offers lots of services and has lots of customers.

Olga and her husband have a workshop where they make custom maD. jewelry. At the beginning they only had two machines and slowly but surely began to increase; they currently supply uniforms to various institution. Very soon they will be opening a store in which they will be selling fabrics.

The members need different amounts of loans for many different reasons. Some need 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, etc. The grand total of their loan is 12200 soles through Banco Comunal.

The loan will be used to purchase milk, bread, chocolates, toys, wool, threads, firewood, and gold for the opening of a new store. They will also change the furniture in their new store and to repair their taxicab. The savings will be used to gain their own capital, purchase land, build their own house and proviD. an education to their children.

Their dream is to have a minimarket, have their own home, own business, a restaurant chain and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga se inició hace 2 años. Actualmente son 26 socias y ya tienen 8 ciclos juntas. Las socias fundadoras fueron Hilda, Luisa, Isabel, Victoria. Las socias mencionan “en nuestro Banco Comunal la pasamos bonito y aprendemos mucho en las charlas”, y dicen que han aprendido acerca D. los valores, D. las enfermedades y a ahorrar. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. pollo, productos naturales, comida, abarrotes, quesos y lácteos, también brindan servicios D. taxi, confección D. prendas D. vestir D. alta costura, artesanía en telar, joyería y Multiservicios. Cada socia tiene una historia que contar, como es el caso D. Rosalía, quien inició su negocio con una tienda pequeña con tan solo 2 muebles, y actualmente tiene un Multiservicios donD. ofrece productos variados y tiene muchos clientes. Por otro lado Olga y su esposo tienen un taller D. confección D. prendas D. vestir. Al inicio ellos solo tenían 2 máquinas y poco a poco fueron creciendo y, actualmente, elaboran uniformes para diferentes instituciones. Próximamente implementarán una tienda para la venta D. telas. Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 12200 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. leche, panetón, chocolates, juguetes, lanas, hilos, leña, oro, para la implementación D. una nueva tienda D. telas, cambio D. muebles D. su restaurante y para la reparación D. su taxi. Los ahorros los utilizarán para tener un capital propio, comprar un terreno, construcción D. C. y para la educación D. sus hijos. Los sueños D. las socias son tener un minimarket, tener C. propia, negocio propio, una cadena D. restaurante y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase milk, bread, chocolates, toys, wool, threads, firewood, and gold for the opening of a new store. They will also change the furniture in their new store and to repair their taxicab.

loans.name: Balqees' Group

texts.en:
My name is Balqees A. and my group and I are applying for our second loan. My husband manufactures furniture for a living, and one of my sons sells shoes. We need a loan to expand both of these businesses.

The members of my loan group are: Razia B., who will invest the loan in her restaurant. Sughran B. needs this loan for her grocery store. Razia A. requires this loan for her husband, who is an electrician and needs to buy some machinery. Shazia B. wants to buy a cow. Kalsoom B. will buy a rickshaw for her son.

I completely trust these women and want to help them make their businesses and their lives better.

loans.use: Expand several small businesses

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Mr. B. is married and the father of one child. He lives in Thies, in the neighborhood called "Grand Thies". He is asking for a loan to upgrade his business selling local fruit juices and various other products. He has been a member of IMCEC since June 28, 2004. He has taken out four loans with us and has repaid them all in a timely fashion.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur B. est marie pere de un enfant et vit a thies au quartier grand thies. il sollicite ce credit pour renforcer ses activites en vendant des jus de fruits locaux et divers produits annexes. Il est membre de la caisse de IMCEC depuis le 28/06/2004. Il a bénéficié de quatre prêts avec IMCEC et tout les ces prets ont ete rembourses correctement.

loans.use:
Upgrade equipment used for selling local fruit juices, etc.

Ameliorer ses equipement pour la vente de jus de fruits locaux et divers

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca is a member of the communal bank Las Margaritas, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 52 years old and has one son. With her first loan, she invested in a business buying and selling clothing and other merchandise. She continues with this business today. She gets up at 6am to prepare breakfast for her son, and then works selling her merchandise until 8pm.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase new and used clothing, perfumes, shoes, etc. Blanca is very content, on her own she has grown this business little by little and increasing her sales. She is very grateful for the financial help she has received.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Margaritas, ubicado en el Jr Atahualpa No 221, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años y es madre de 1 hijos. Blanca con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio compra y venta de mercadería. En la actualidad ella sigue con su mismo negocio de compra y venta de mercadería, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de allí sale a la calle para vender, repartir, y cobrar su mercadería, hasta las 8pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, compro: ropas de primera y de segunda, correas, perfumes, zapatos, etc. Blanca esta muy feliz, de si misma, su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco y sus ventas aumentan y ella esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo dado para su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE TO SELL, SUCH AS NEW AND USED CLOTHING, PERFUMES, SHOES, ETC.

loans.name: Blanca Iris

texts.es:
Mrs. Blanca Iris, a native of Juigalpa, lives in the area called Nuevo Amanecer, Second Stage, where she lives together with her three children, two of whom are studying in their fourth and fifth years of secondary school and one who works with and helps his mother, who, as a single mother, has had to take on the roles of both father and mother for her children. She has been able to do this through dedication and constant work. Currently, she earns her living as a receptionist for a non-govermental organizations, where she earns a monthly income to take care of her family's expenses. Mrs. S.'s dream is to build a room so that she can divide it into rooms for her and her children; for this, she is soliciting a loan. She wishes to build three walls for a room in her house and continue advancing her children's development; the latter is her main goal in life.

Translated from Spanish by Sheila Johnson, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Blanca Iris, originaria de Juigalpa, habita en el barrio Nuevo Amanecer 2ª etapa, donde convive con sus 3 hijos, 2 estudiando 4to y 5to año de secundaria, y 1 que trabaja y apoya a su mamá, quien como madre soltera le ha tocado jugar el papel de padre y madre para sus hijos, lo que ha logrado crear con dedicacion y constante trabajo; en la actulidad se desempeña como conserje de una ONG, donde persibe ingresos mensuales para el sosten de los gastos familiares, el sueño que la Sra. S. tiene es de construir una habitacion para compartimentar habitacion de ella y sus hijos, para lo cual solicita el credito, y construir 3 paredes para un cuarto en su hogar y continuar avanzando en la formacion de sus hijos que es su objetivo principal en la vida.

loans.use: Improvement of her home.

loans.name: Grace Nabakaabya's Group

texts.en:
Grace is leader of a group of four members. She is 45 years old and married with five children aged between 28 and 11 years. Three of them are in school. The community she resides and works in is an urban slum in a low-lying area that is vulnerable to floods.

She has been selling dried fish, bananas, cassava, potatoes, and other foods for the last 19 years. When she goes to the seaside to collect the fish, she must deal with the high transport costs to and from the shore and spending nights in the cold.

She has been able to help support her family and she would like to invest more in her children’s education.

Grace has successfully paid back more than 15 loans.

loans.use: She would like to buy more stock in order to raise her income.

loans.name: Luz Rosenda

texts.es:
Señora Luz Rosenda Z. Bendezu, belongs to the “Women Bound to Develop” Communal Bank. She lives in the Region and Province of San Martin, district of Morales. Her residence and business are located on Jr.Peru. She is dedicated to the sale of natural products of the OMNILIFE line, and she supplements the business with the sale of handicrafts, beauty products (ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE) and lingerie (LEONISA).

With the credit of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy natural products such as optimus and teatino in boxes and other products of the line that she is offering. She will also buy material to give services such as injections and serum, that are the ones that have greater demand among the patients that she attends.

Señora Luz Rosenda is 48 years old. She is a technical nurse by profession. She offers health care and natural products for sale to the community in general. She is a woman that most of her life has worked with patients where she learned to serve people with many health needs. She feels happy to be able to serve others with her business that does not have a definite schedule and that always is in the service of others.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz Rosenda Z. Bendezu, pertenece al Banco Comunal” Mujeres Rumbo Al Desarrollo” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de morales, su domicilio y negocio están ubicados en el Jr.Perú, se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la línea OMNILIFE, y complementa el negocio con las venta de manualidades, productos de belleza ( ESIKA, AVON, UNIQUE) y lencería (LEONISA)

Con el crédito de S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará productos naturales como optimus , teatino, en cajas y demás de la línea que oferta, también comprará material para dar servicio de inyectables y sueros, que son los que tienen mayor requerimiento entre los pacientes que atiende.

La señora Luz Rosenda, tiene 48 años, es enfermera técnica de profesión, ofrece asistencia sanitaria y venta de productos naturales a la comunidad en general, es una mujer que la mayor parte de su vida ha trabajado con pacientes donde aprendió a servir a personas con muchas necesidades de salud y se siente feliz de poder servir a los demás con su negocio que no tiene horario definido y que siempre está al servicio de los demás.

loans.use: To buy natural products for resale and products to provide services such as injections and serums.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esperanza is 46 years old and married. She studied through high school and supports 5 children, 2 of which are working while the other 3 are still students. She lives in the district of Salaverry in the Province of Trujillo, La Libertad. When she was studying high school she learned how to make purses. When she finished her studies she dedicated herself to this small business which she started thanks to a small amount of money she had saved. Later her friends encouraged her to participate in the Communal Bank “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”. With her first loan of 200 S. she purchased buckles, closures and other supplies to invest in her business. With a new loan for 1,700 S., to be repaid within 6 months, she will purchase decorative ribbons to make shirts and other hand sewn products for some children’s playcenters. She currently acts as Secretary of her Communal Bank and she is very happy to work with the other members. One of her goals is for her younger children to become professionals since her older children never had the opportunity to complete their studies.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora María Esther tiene 46 años, está casada, estudió la carrera D. Contabilidad, no la ejerce porque tenía que cuidar a sus hijos pequeños, tiene 03 hijos y son estudiantes. Vive en el Distrito D. Moche en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente empezó a vender productos cosméticos D. AVON, EBEL. Luego se animó a vender cerveza al por menor y también participa en ferias vendiendo bordados, tejidos. Una amiG. la invitó a participar en el Banco Comunal “VIRGEN D. FATIMA”, y decidió pertenecer a Manuela Ramos porque tenía la oportunidad D. salir adelante. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00, compró productos cosméticos para tener un stock disponible y poder colocar los productos al crédito. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1200.00 que cancelará en un plazo D. 06 meses comprará cerveza para incrementar la ganancia. La socia colabora con el ingreso familiar, piensa en remodelar el baño D. su casa y también aprender a elaborar pan y ha administrar una panadería porque sueña con tener una.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for resale

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
In the county of Nagarote, in the city of Leon, Maria Ofelia has been making and selling 'quesillos' (a corn tortilla wrapped around melted cheese) for 11 years. She sells them walking around the streets of the county. She has made a great effort and has managed to move forward with her family which is made up of 5 young kids who she has to support and give all they need in life.

Now she needs to make quesillos to sell but does not have enough money, so she sought the help of Ceprodel to get some credit to buy basic ingredients to make the quesillos and in this way continue her business in the county of Nagarote.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 11 años, en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León la señora Maria Ofelia Lopez se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesillos ofreciéndolos ambulantemente por las calles de su municipio. Esta dama se ha esforzado grandemente y ha logrado salir adelante junto con su humilde familia compuesta por sus cinco pequeños hijos a los que tiene que mantener y proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias de vida. Hoy en día, con la necesidad de elaborar los quesillos para su venta y al hacerle falta el recurso económico busca ayuda en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de los quesillos y de esta manera continuar con su negocio en el municipio de Nagarote.

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients/Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Khekh Niakk3 Group

texts.fr: le groupe khekh niakk3 est composé de cinq femmes qui habitent au quartier  Diakhao. elles font de la couture depuis longtemps. elles sollicitent ce pret pour le renforcement de leur capital pour faire face à la demande de la clientèle en vue des fetes de Korité et Tabaski.
texts.en:
The group Khekh Niakk 3 is composed of five women who live in the Diakhao district. They have been sewing clothes for a long time. They are requesting this loan to bolster their capital to address customer demand associated with the Korité and Tabaski holidays.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Couture

loans.name: Abdurazok

texts.ru: Султонов Абдуразок живет в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 52 года , женат и имеет 11 детей. Семья очень большая и он вместе со старшими детьми работает в поле. Арендует землю, которую использует под посев пшеницы и картофеля. Хочет получить кредит для покупки удобрений и семян. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Abdurazok S. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 52 years old, married and has eleven children. His family is vast and to support it Abdurazok works in the fields with his older children. He rents land where he grows potatoes and wheat. Abdurazok wants to use this loan for purchasing fertilizer and seeds for the upcoming planting. He plans to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Martha Olinda

texts.es:
Martha pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash.

Tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Su mayor logro personal ha sido emprender un negocio D. surtido, como ella lo llama, es una librería, locería y útiles del hogar, el cual queda ubicado en el campo ferial tienda 4 y mantenerla. La dificultad personal que ella tiene es que sufre D. los riñones y eso no le permite continuar como desea en su negocio. Menciona que ha trabajado mucho y ahora sufre D. ese mal y afirma que ha crecido mucho porque al iniciar su negocio con  S/. 100 hace mucho tiempo, ahora tiene invertido en su negocio alrededor D. S/. 30,000. El negocio beneficia mucho a su familia D. tal manera que aún cuando su esposo trabaja en la beneficencia pública ella apoya a su familia con este trabajo.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará productos para surtir el negocio, un poco D. locería y regalos para navidad porque ya empieza la campaña naviD.ña.

Martha afirma que le gustaría recibir charlas para saber llevar mejor su familia y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres al Progresso” (“Women Progressing”) in the Yungay province of Ancash. She is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Her greatest personal accomplishment has been starting her groceries business which is located at the fairgrounds, store 4, and she must maintain it. The personal difficulty that he has is that she suffers from kidney problems, and this doesn’t allow her to continue her business as she would like. She states that she has worked hard, and despite being afflicted by a malady, she has grown her business which started a while ago with 100.00 soles. Now, she has invested about 30,000.00 soles into her enterprise. The business benefits her family greatly and, even when her husband works for the public, she supports her family with this work. With the loan of 800.00 soles, to be repaid in six installments, she will buy products to supply the business, some notions, and also Christmas gifts because the season is approaching. Martha affirms that she would like to receive lectures/guidance so she can help her family more and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase store supplies and gifts for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Groupement Novissi

texts.en:
The Novisi Group is a sewing business that consists of 10 entrepreneurs who live and work in Wome, Togo, a small village located approximately 130 kilometers from the capital. The group consists of 8 women – Iveth K., Prisca D., Aimée A., Beatice Y., Abra E. A., Cecile A., Aku M. T. and Afua G. – and 2 men, Dieu Donne A. and Moussilé T.. Everyone in the group is married with children except for the woman on the far right in the photo, who is 19 years old and an apprentice.

The Novisi Group provides sewing and other tailoring services for their community and has earned a very positive reputation in the 5 years that it has been in operation. With this loan from FECECAV, the Novisi Group hopes to buy 3 more sewing machines and a fresh inventory of thread, buttons, and zippers. They also hope to expand the space in which they work. With the expansion of their business, each member of the Novisi Group will be able to support the needs of their families and continue to provide this important service to their community.

loans.use: Buy sewing machines and additional inventory

loans.name: Siniva

texts.en: Siniva P., 57, is married and has one child.  Her husband is working as an electrician. Siniva has had many years experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public people three days per week. Siniva has had one previous loan with SPBD, which is her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She plans to purchase Gromoxone, sting, chemicals, bush knives, and seedlings for her plantation business.

loans.use: Purchase Gromoxone, sting, chemicals, bush knives, and seedlings for plantation business

loans.name: Salehe

texts.en: Salehe J. is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur. He runs a phone accessories shop at Tabata ward in Dar es Salaam. The phone accessories are purchased from the big phone shops in Kariakoo city market. His future plan is to run a wholesale shop but capital is a limiting factor. He needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy more business inventory

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos de 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres y la casa donde radica es propia de su familia. Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte a pasajeros por las distintas zonas donde vive, a razón de ser propietario de un motocarro, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 3 años atrás y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus pasajeros y sobre todo la confianza necesaria durante el viaje. Esta actividad le es rentable ya que es él mismo quien maneja y no tiene que contratar a un chofer, además cuida y administra solo su negocio. En el futuro le gustaría tener un taller de mecánica, ya que estudió para eso y desea poner en práctica su profesión. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque, menciona, que le brindaron la oportunidad que otros no le supieron dar, por lo que está muy agradecido. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a reparar su herramienta de trabajo y luego comprar ropa y zapatos para vender y obtener un dinero extra.
texts.en:
Marcos is 28 years old, single, and lives with his parents in their family's house. He works offering transportation to passengers between the various zones where he lives. For this reason, he owns a motorcycle taxi, which he has been using for his job for 3 years. What he likes about his job is giving his passengers a good experience and above all the confidence necessary during the trip. This job is profitable since he drives himself and does not have to hire a driver. Also, he manages and takes care of the business by himself. In the future, he would like to have a mechanic shop since he studied mechanics, and wishes to put his profession in practice. This is his second loan with Kiva partner MFP. He likes to work with his communal bank, because they offer him an opportunity that others are not able to provide. For this, he is very thankful. With the money that he is requesting, he wants to send in his motorcycle taxi for repairs, and then purchase clothing and shoes to resell in order to earn extra money.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle taxi repairs and the purchase of clothing for resale

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
¿Por qué inició el negocio?   Para poder sacar adelante a mis hijos, ya que yo sola me hice cargo de ellos y tenía que sostenerlos y además quería darles estudio a los tres. 
¿Cuándo comenzó el negocio? (Fecha)  En Agosto de 1987



Amalia empezo el negocio vendiendo ropa y productos cosmeticos, después lo hacia  de casa en casa con su  maleta de ropa, pero su sueño era tener un negocio mas grande y establecido en un lugar fijo. Ahora que sus hijos están grandes y casados pude ver cumplido su sueño  ya que cuenta con un negocio establecido, porque ya esta grande y ya es cansado  vender de casa  en casa o en mercados ambulantes. 
 
Ella ha logrado preogresar en su negocio ya que  comenzo vendiendo de casa en casa, luego ya me establecío su  propio local, y gracias al negocio ha podido construir dos locales comerciales pequeños los cuales renta a otros comerciantes.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por MXN $12,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para  comprar mercancía como regalos y novedades para tener bien surtido mi negocio y poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Why did I start this business? In order to help my children succeed, since I am their sole caregiver and I had to raise them and I also wanted all three to be able to attend school. I started the business in August 1987. Amalia started her business selling clothes and cosmetics, later she sold door-to-door with a suitcase of clothing, but her goal was to have a larger business in an established location. Now that her children are grown and married she has accomplished her goal of an established locale, since she is older now and it is tiring work to sell door-to-door or as a traveling salesperson. Thanks to the business she has been able to build two other small commercial shops, which she rents out to other business owners. Now she requires a loan of $12,000 MXN to pay back in 12 installments to buy merchandise such as gifts and novelties in order to have a varied inventory for her business and offer the best selection to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo S. tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero.
 
Don Hugo tiene un negocio de investigacion.  El investiga todos temas de Paraguay y vende la informacion a varias empresas.  Comenzó con este negocio como estudiante, aproximadamente en el año 2005; desde ese momento el fue comprando poco a poco para sus comodidades ya sea escritorio, estante para sus libros, y en la actualidad el esta trabajando con varias universidades privadas ofreciendo sus servicios de investigación.

El Sr. Hugo  invertiría este crédito para comprar máquinas (computadoras), para que asi pueda ofrecer un servivio completo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Hugo S. is 28 years old and single. Hugo has a business as a researcher. He researches all kinds of Paraguayan topics and sells the information to various businesses. He began this business as a student, approximately in 2005; since then he has little by little been buying the things he needs such as a desk, bookshelf, and today he is working with several private universities offering his research services. Hugo will invest this loan in buying computers so that he can offer a full range of services to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Tagisia

texts.en: Tagisia T., 48, is married with 2 children.  She has many years of experience in the vegetable growing business. She sells to the general public 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Tagisia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.en:
T. Phan Thị (324980674) lives in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has four adult-aged children. T. owns and operates a business selling rice products in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

In 1998, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. This will be her 10th loan from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kun P. is a 25-year-old who has been married to Mr. Nouv Khoeun (pictured) who is age 27. Kun P. now has three children: two daughters and one son. All three of them are attending the local school.

Mrs. Kun P. is a crop farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some flowers. She sells her produce to buyers every two months when her crops mature. To alleviate the hard physical labor, her husband works with her in growing the crops.

Kun P. will use the loan to purchase two water buffalo which she can use to plow a field and rent them out to other farmers as an additional income source.

loans.use: To purchase two water buffalo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rice, maize, beans and tomatoes.

loans.name: María Regina

texts.es: Doña María C. cuenta con 18 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de Blusas típicas para mujeres”, habita junto  con su esposo y su hijo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 3 años en el comercio en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xolcajá del Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su hijo, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña María C. is 18 years old. She is married and works as a businesswoman, in the Purchase and Sale of traditional shirts for women. She lives along with her husband and her child. She and her husband do the same work, and have spent the past 3 years in business from their home that can be found in the Paraje Xolcajá of Cantón Poxlajuj, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, her clients’ demand has grown, but the economic conditions that she finds herself in are not sufficient for her to be able to increase her capital. For this reason, she has approached ASDIR to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying more merchandise and in this manner increasing her sales, hoping also to be able to improve her child’s life, and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds

loans.name: Huzaima

texts.en: Huzaima is 35,  is married and has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Techiman in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a trader who sells clothes. Huzaima sells at the market square and in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy more textile goods to increase her stock. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Angélique

texts.fr: Angèle M., 39 ans, mariée est mère de 03 enfants. Elle membre du Banc Villageois de MPACK depuis deux ans et demi et a reçu quatre prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle est vendeuse d'huile de palme, de miel et de citron et les bénéfice générés de son activité lui permettent de participer à la nourriture de la famille et à la santé de ses enfants. le prêt de 300000 francs CFA qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé en une seule échéance au bout de six mois
texts.en:
Angèle M., 39, is married and the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Mpack for two and a half years and she has received four loans which she has always reimbursed without difficulty. She sells palm oil, honey, and lemons and the income from her little business permits her to help feed her family and see to the health of her children.

The loan of 30,000 F CFA that she is requesting will be reimbursed in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise her income to strengthen her capacity to support herself

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles P. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 39 years old. Angeles is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Angeles owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp. She also produces ice for sale in the local community. Angeles has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Angeles joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angeles has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Angeles is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Angeles from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Dolores de la Ciudad de El Alto, tiene una tienda de venta de comida (almuerzo y platos extras) que ella misma elabora; su negocio genera empleo pues tiene una ayudante de cocina, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre su manutención.

El crédito lo destinará para incrementar la compra de mercadería y compra de algunos utensilios de cocina, lo cual  le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives in her parents’ home in the Villa Dolores district in the city of El Alto. She has a shop where she sells prepared foods (lunches and à la carte dishes). Her business has generated employment because she hired a kitchen assistant. Her business is the main source of income that enables her to cover her living expenses.

Her loan will be used to purchase supplies and a few kitchen utensils. These items will help improve her revenues.

This is Lourdes’ first loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicated she qualified for approval of this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & kitchen utensils

loans.name: Santa Amalia Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe C. B. de 25 años de edad, es la coordinadora del grupo Santa Amalia, quien a su edad es una mujer “Pilas Puestas” como ella lo describe. Trabaja en el destace de cerdos.

Aprendió esto de su suegra quien la motivo y le enseño el negocio; compra los cerdos y los da a destazar para después ella distribuir la carne. Ahora que ha hecho clientela, tiene mucha demanda de carne y desea invertir su crédito en acrecentar el negocio.

Cruz V. P. y Gretches del Carmen P. trabajan en la compra y venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya. Son un grupo muy disciplinado en sus cuotas y de un excelente record crediticio.

loans.use: Para la compra de cerdo

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Maravilla está conformado Leonardo M. T., Heydy H. y Estelvina V. U..  Ellos son originarios de san Francisco, Nindiri.

M. de 48 años desde hace diecinueve años tiene un taller de mueblería, el en un principio alquiló un taller con todas sus herramientas y solo realizaba canastas luego a solicitud de sus clientes empezó a realizar diferentes muebles como roperos.  El invertirá su crédito en compra de madera e insumos para realizar muebles y su sueño es llegar a remodelar su taller y comprar un vehículo. 

Los otros dos integrantes Heydy H. y Estelvina Valdivia vende ropa nueva y usada.

loans.use: madera, clavos, pintura, pega etc

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna is seventy-seven years old. She is widowed and has given birth to eight children, all out of school. She lives with some of her children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Mamuna is a petty trader. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities. She sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers.

Mamuna has been in business for over thirty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Don Julio Cesar G. tiene 36 años de edad, se dedica al servicio de transporte desde hace 20 años, el se levanta desde muy temprano ya que trabaja de las 4:30 a.m. a 9:30 P.M. el es el dueño del taxi, hace diario unas 20 carreras y las cobra a $ 3.00 obteniendo una utilidad diaria de $ 40.00 el no tiene un punto fijo de taxi, pero cuenta con clientes fijos, los cuales lo llaman para que los vaya a recoger a determinado lugar, vive con su esposa quien labora en una empresa privada desde hace varios años.
Tienen un hijo adolecente el cual esta estudiando.
Esta solicitando el credito para comprar repuestos como ser pistones, anillos, vielas, quita empaque de motor, rectificacion de motor para poder brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
El sueño de Julio a corto plazo es ahorrar y comprarse otro vehiculo ya que el es muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar G. is 36 years old and has worked in transportation for 20 years. He gets up very early since he works from 4:30 A.M. to 9:30 P.M. He is the owner of a taxi and has about 20 runs a day. He charges $3.00 each, obtaining a daily income of $40.00. He doesn't have a fixed route for his taxi rounds, but he relies on regular clients who call him so that he can come pick them up at a particular place. He lives with his wife who has worked in a private business for several years. They have a teenage son, who is a student. Julio is requesting the loan to buy spare parts, such as pistons, rings, rods, motor seal removers, and motor correctors in order to provide his customers with better service. Julio's short-term dream is to save money and buy himself another vehicle because he is very hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for automobiles.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam B. is from the village of  Sagay, Camiguin. She is 41 years old and married, with one school-aged child. To make a living, Miriam owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Miriam has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Miriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Miriam is requesting her first loan from HSPFI.  She is seeking 5000 PHP  to expand the business and plans to use the additional revenue generated  to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and serves lower-income households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara T. es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 65 años, es viuda y madre de tres hijos mayores de edad.
Sara se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para lo cual cuenta con un pequeño taller de costura en su casa. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace tres años y el primer crédito que recibió fue 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizó en la compra de productos como hilos, blondas, etc. 
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà telas y a la vez repararà su máquina de coser. 
La meta de Sara es llegar a tener un taller de costura bien implementado.
texts.en:
Sara T. is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 65 years old, a widow, and the mother of three grown children.

Sara sews various articles of clothing in a small sewing workshop in her house. She has been a member of the community bank Madres Corajes (Women of Spirit) for three years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to by fabrics, lace, etc. At the present time, she needs a loan of 500 PEN, with which she will buy fabrics and at the same time repair her sewing machine. Sara's goal is to have a well-equipped sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fabric and maintain her sewing machine

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: La profesora Mayra G. es casada,  trabaja como docente de educación primaria  desde hace 12 años, tiene 3 hijos, dos actualmente estudian su primaria y la niñita menor de 4 añitos en edad preescolar, su esposo trabaja en la finca que estos poseen en la colonia kurinwas, y se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos y cultivo de raices y tuberculos a cuidar su pequeño inventario ganadero que es el patrimonio de su familia,  está solicitando su 5to refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda haciendo la division de los cuartos de la casa, y asi tener privacidad; doña Mayra con los creditos anteriores otorgados por AFODENIC a mejorado su vivienda y ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida, es una mujer que sueña con tener un porvenir mejor y que sus hijos tengan siempre lo basico y que estudien , trabajo y sobre todo estar bien con Dios.
texts.en:
Mayra G. has been an elementary school teacher for the past 12 years. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in elementary school and a daughter, who is under 4 years of age, who is a preschooler. Her husband works the farm that they have in the Kurinwas area; he grows basic grains and tubers while caring for a small herd of cattle, which is his family's assets. She asking for her fifth refinancing to invest in home improvements. She wants to subdivide the rooms so that they can have more privacy. With previous loans from AFODENIC, Mayra has improved her home and her living condiditons. She is a woman that dreams with having a better future and that her children always have their basic needs met, that they study, that she always has work and, above all, that she be in good standing with God.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dividir habitaciones

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is a 44-year-old lady who is married to Joab Mwasamba and they are blessed with four children. She operates a grocery business in Kilifi town which she has been operating for the last nine years. Her business has been doing well all this time.

Elizabeth is borrowing her second loan from KADET and plans to use the money to purchase more groceries for her kiosk. She hopes to clear her repayments in time and to continue taking up more KADET loans. 

Her dream is to expand her business and to see her children successful in future.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her kiosk

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a 29-year-old married mother of one child. In 2004, after having her first child, she decided to help her husband in supporting the household by selling accessories and working as a hairdresser from the home. Over the years, she has been able to build up a growing number of customers for her beauty service and accessories business.
Today, Houda is requesting to borrow $1,000 USD to buy additional accessories and beauty products for her customers. She hopes that this will help her increase her income.

loans.use: To buy accessories and beauty products

loans.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Cecilia, pertenecen al banco comunal  “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA”, nuestra socia está ubicado en el corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, Urubamba está a 1 hora 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 52 años y es viuda, la socia tiene  4 hijos de  28, 26, 24, 15 años de edad; nuestra socia es docente de nivel primario en una escuela de la provincia de Urubamba, la socia es comerciante minorista, ella se dedica entre sus otras actividades a la compra y venta de cuyes, la socia cría cuyes, los reproduce y luego los vende, ella desea darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, ya que es la única que los ha estado apoyando en todo, Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y algunas aves de corral.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Cecilia belongs to the “NUEVA VISION DE URUBAMBA” ("New Vision of Urubamba") communal bank. She lives in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas; Urubamba is 1 hour and 10 minutes from the city of Cusco. Our partner Cecilia is 52 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children, aged 28, 26, 24 and 15. She is an elementary school teacher at a school in Urubamba province. She is also a retail seller. Among her other activities, she buys and sells guinea pigs, and she also breeds and raises guinea pigs to sell. Her desire is to give her children a better quality of life, since she has been the only one supporting them. Cecilia needs a loan to purchase more guinea pigs as well as some domestic fowl. Cecilia is grateful for the opportunity provided to her, and she is committed to making all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing guinea pigs and domestic fowl

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is currently in the business of selling sugar and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice to sell.  Mary is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice to sell
